text: I ate here after reading the reviews on yelp. It was just OK, I got the big Jim. What aburger has gravy and biscuits that's just as good.  Looked like a bunch of goth skater cooks trying to serve some home style food. My friend ate with me and he wasn't very impressed either. I had a QT cup because QT ice tea is bomb and one of the skater workers said because of the liqueur license I had to throw it away. It was ok, I went, I probably wouldn't go back.
If in Phoenix eat here. Fried Chicken and a Champaign-a-cane. Fucking fabulous on a Sunday morn.

great place for a hipster and off-beat dinner. be prepared to wait a while if busy, because the service is slow. it has amazing comfort food though, and the experience and meal is well-worth the wait!! definitely recommended.

Seen this place many times decided to give it a try. Cons: all I ordered was a burger with bacon and cheese on it with a bottle of water and they charged me 17.37 for it?? I was in a hurry so didn't check my bag which I usually do but didn't this one time. I know I asked for fries but didn't get them. The burger wasn't anything special, I could have made it  at home. For $17 I was thinking wow I must be getting a big ass burger. Lol it was big but kind of flat and very greasy. There is parking off the street or you can park in the lot next to them next to a water station. Pros: I learned my lesson about looking at what I'm paying for! And the art on the fence was nice. That's about it.

Surprisingly not bad, had distinct flavors and portion was sufficient(big Jim and roasted spouts).   Only complaint is it should be accompanied with a more hearty side then three small watermelon squares !

The wait it a little much, but the location, food and the weather when we went made for a perfect evening. Everything about this location is bomb. The diner area is a little small but the outside seating is fine as long as the weather permits.  Everything I've ever ordered off their menu has been excellent. Chicken sandwich is my favorite.  The staff all seem to really enjoy being there and take their time to make the experience special. The kitchen area seems cramped but the guys working the grill had a practiced hand and the food came out quicker than I would expect (although slower than most places with a full kitchen staff)  If you are looking to a unique date spot or a nice evening hangout with friends this is the spot.
Really cool little casual place to eat with great food!

Be ready for yum. These guys hit all the right notes - quality food with no pretense. This is what diner food should be. Get a nice drink to start, then order the special. Whatever it is, it is what you should have that day. Scratch made tomatillo gravy, brunch burger with spicy ketchup, etc. Cool staff are eager to please, chef that knows his stuff - works the flattop like the pro he is.

In Phoenix for a few days and wanted to find a unique, good place to eat.  Found both in Welcome Diner.  It's in the middle of a fairly residential area near downtown.  Very informal and looks almost like a Foster's Freeze type place with mostly outdoor seating.  I sat at the counter.  The three young guys working were having a great time cooking, talking to guests and listening to, oddly enough, late-60's rock music.  Had the Big Jim and Poutine.  Ate about 2/3 of the first and 1/4 of the second only because it's an incredible amount of food.  Great tasting comfort food at great prices.  Would recommend.
We have been waiting for more than an hour for our food on a Sunday night... I hope that it is worth this ridiculously long wait!

It was a really cool environment and unique from the vast majority of the Phoenix area. We enjoyed their commitment to fresh and quality ingredients. Everything we ordered was delicious and reasonably priced. The staff was very friendly and prompt.   HIghly recommend to come after dark in the summer because it is so blazing hot (mostly outdoor seating). We will definitely be returning for more pulled pork fries!

I am so glad I decided to take a chance on this little place. Great food at a fair price. And, great service to boot. I had their chicken and cheddar biscuit called the Little Birdy and was in heaven. The chicken was moist with great flavor, not greasy, and not doughy. The biscuit it was on was perfection. Crispy and fluffy where it needed to be with a well balanced butteryness. To make things even better the biscuit did not fall apart after the first bite :). Loved the relaxed atmosphere and music selection outside. The dudes that were working were very courteous and answered questions without eye rolling like you may get at other downtown establishments.

This place had some pretty spot on food! The atmosphere was pretty quaint and enjoyable. Nice little joint. Only downside was the limited hours...it'd be nice to be able to grab lunch during the week here, but the hours won't allow for that option.
The big Jim and the Carol are both fantastic. It is also a really nice place to sit outside in the evening.

Since bringing the magic of Old Dixie's food truck into their kitchen a couple months ago, The Welcome Diner has been hands-down my favorite spot in Phoenix. The food here is incredible. Their burgers are better than what you would get at Deluxe, and the vibe is way cooler. But forget burgers - if you go there, you've gotta get the fried chicken, bacon, cheddar, and gravy biscuit sandwich. It will blow your mind. Everything is sourced locally and made fresh in the vein of Matt's Big Breakfast. The staff is awesome, and it's the most relaxed atmosphere you could find. I love this place!

Proof that art can come from a two burner kitchen. Laughably small kitchen creates some very big tastes. Plan to go on a cool night and enjoy the great patio. Not an indoor diner, it's soul food and stars. Big Jim, Cannibal fries and Coke in a bottle. Great experience, I'll be back.

My favorite burger in phoenix. unless you're at the bar, there is only outside seating, but in good weather it's great. Parking can be dodgey depending on the time of day but never too bad. The place itself has charming decor and great staff. I recommend going at night because the lights are great ambiance.
Definitely one of the best places to eat in Phoenix. Food is always solid and atmosphere is laid back. Our favorite place to take people

Geez, I love love love this place. Love the hurricanes, the pulled pork, the fried chicken, the biscuits, the burgers, the gravy, the 'dining in a trailer park' atmosphere.  The only thing I don't like is that rave reviews are going to make it impossible for us to stroll in on a Saturday night and get a seat at the counter. But they deserve them.

this is probably the coolest diner in downtown phoenix. all organic ingredients, a kickass interior (it's super small, but totally rad), and great people working. say hi to the bearded jewish cook, andy, and he will make your food just the way you want it, and also, with love.  the food is totally cheap and tastes exquisite. you can also eat outside, if you want.   it's located on a nondescript corner in a residential area, so it's easy to miss, but this place is definitely worth checking out if you're downtown.  also, the hours up there ^^ say it's open until 5, but i am pretty sure they close at 3.

So a couple of months ago my co-worker and I were on a dangerous mission to find the one great burger in town. After months of search and going into some of the seediest joints in town, we arrived at Welcome Diner, I was a bit skeptical that this place could produce a burger  that my co-worker and I were so desperately seeking, but oh how rad being wrong is, they knocked the shit out of my taste buds with there burger, I got a double with cheese with a fried egg on top (old school son), I literally finished the burger before my co-worker got his (which was like 5 seconds later) , a true delight.   If you go bring cash money thats all they take, also its a small joint so don't go brining like 40 of your office buddies you'll look like a tool.

This place is incredibly overrated. The service is exceptionally slow, the food is bland, the biscuits are dry, the portions are small, the seating is limited, and the prices are high for what you get. I've been here on multiple occasions each time hoping the prior experience was a one off, but with no different outcome. I wanted to be a fan of this place after hearing the hype and reading the reviews but it really doesn't cut it. I'd highly recommend tempering your expectations as this place is memorable for all of the wrong reasons.
I had a spring salad and my friend had a welcoming breakfast. Both of them are great! If they can use a bigger bowl for salad , it will be better because it is hard to toss the salad in a small bowl.

Best place to chill downtown, period. Amazing comfort food and an excellent little cocktail menu. Super dog friendly, too. If you don't eat fried chicken and biscuits, try their fried green tomato sandwich, grilled cheese (which comes with amazing tomato confit), or mac and cheese (with added confit or Brussels sprout).
Great little place. In a nice neighborhood, the best garlic chicken sandwich I've ever had. love the fries too. nice people.
Had a lovely lunch with my friends in this place. Very cool and nice place to eat. It has a bar open all day,and that what I liked the most. The food is good and the service is good as well.

Welcome diner is very quaint and incredibly unique, I haven't seen anything else like it in the valley. It's a converted house in the middle of a neighborhood, but it looks like it's straight out of a movie. The food is good and the menu is unique; I love the variety. My favorites on the menu are poutine and the mac and cheese, but I've heard good things about every other menu item! I will say, wait times can become incredibly long. The staff seems incredibly hard working, but they have a small kitchen and are very popular which makes for long wait times. If you're willing to wait, Welcome Diner is worth it!

I feel like I need a cardiologist on call after my delicious and greasy meal indulgence at Welcome Diner. The burger, fried chicken sandwich on a biscuit, fries with gravy on top and fries with bacon and cheese on top are all heavenly. Fried avocado Po' boy was also divine. Add a few hurricanes and I was a happy camper.

Scratch-made super delicious food!  Love the laid back vibe and the fact that we were able to eat inside and interact with our bartender and other diners.  We had the Koko, Fried Green Tomato sandwich with bacon and the pountine fries!  Yum, Yum and Yum!  Not to mention the awesome crafted cocktails!  We will be back!

Oh my Lordy, this place is great! The cocktails with fresh ingredients and yummy!! The food is awesome and the staff is so much fun, professional and great! The fried green tomato sandwich, the mac & cheese with chorizo AND bacon and the Carol - yum!!! We are coming back! The drive from Cave Creek is worth it!!!

First time in Phoenix so relying on Yelp.  Welcome diner seemed liked a good spot, and maybe on any other night it is but took us over an hour to get our food.  Kitchen seemed small to handle the volume, but mostly frustrated seeing others who ordered same dish after us get served before us.  Some food may be worth +hour wait but not this food - chicken biscuit, Mac and cheese, Brussel sprouts... Nothing to write home about, think you'll say the same if you've had any standouts of the dishes mentioned above. Can't give more than 2 stars for an overrated place that made me wait over an hour for food that didn't taste exceptional.

OMG! Their food is friggin' delicious! Ordered some sort of breakfast biscuit which entailed an entire fried breast of chicken, tons of bacon and topped off with cheddar cheese. Since it was my first time (and I was starving) I also order a side of sausage gravy and the grit cake. This wasn't a cheap lunch at about $20 with a sweet tea, but it did knock me on my a$$. I ended up splitting the entire sandwich with a friend and we were both stuffed to the gills. My only complaint (very minor) was that the grit cake could have been a teensy weensy bit larger. Other than that I was totally satisfied with the meal, setting and staff.  Thanks Welcome Diner! Happy to have you in the neighborhood!

Best diner I've been to. Nothing in Cali compares to this. Great service, intimate charming space with emphasis on out door seating. We order 2 drinks that they recommended, a stout beer on tap that tasted like coffee (yummy), and a wheat citrus beer . The food was on point, we had the Big Jim biscuit  (I think that's what it's called) and the bbq jackfruit fries ( amazing entree for vegans and non-vegan  taste better than pulled pork and it's cruelty free). This place is worth checking out!

Okay...I have been going here for a while and I love the place and the food!  I am surprise it hasn't had as many reviews as it should.  The truth is I come back to support local businesses in my neighborhood...I would come here anyday than go to a Fast Food burger joint..  The trailor that the restaurant is in is the cutest thing you will ever see...straight out of a 50's picture!  Its small but fitting...  The food is very fresh..I love their cheeseburgers and hotdogs..I sometimes even get some of their mango salsa/chutney on the side..they get it from this lady that homemakes it.. Not the cleanliness place but I guess thats what makes it tastes so great!!:)  Its the extra grease...I know that just sounds horrible, but true!  Anyways, support locals and their businesses...go go go!!!

This is my new favorite joint.  It is becoming quite the neighborhood favorite and I think it's because they just do it right. The setting is so...welcoming. With the lawn chairs and variety of mostly outdoor seating this is the perfect spot for a beautiful day or night. The staff is a bunch of characters who are very genuine and helpful. The food has clever names like "Holy Puerco and Captain Fantasy") oh and it is freaking amazing. Even the menu's artwork looks awesome (done by a local artist/cartoonist.)  I've been here three weekends in a row. The first time I had the Captain Fantasy which was endlessly delicious. Barbecued chicken on a fresh homemade biscuit with bacon, cheese and greens. I also had fries, wow a lot of food! The other two times I've had the Sunrise Sandwich with sausage and an egg over easy. It is also placed between a tasty biscuit along with some arugula. Yum! My boyfriend has had the welcome breakfast with chorizo and the Little Birdy. I had bites! I also tried their fried avocado, genius.  They serve drinks. Apparently on Tuesdays they have Hurricane Tuesdays, $5 for their famous hurricanes. I've also heard their Bloody Mary's are brilliant.  Well done Welcome Diner well done. See you all next weekend!
I had a burger and collard greens for a side. it was $17.   It was ok, but I expected better. Outdoor seating was nice. Too bougee imo

This place is great local diner open late good beer on tap great service usually and perfect ambiance especially the bathroom. All the food is good. I am partially vegetarian, yet I will  eats me some fried chicken here mm m m m mmmmmm

What a great dive! Welcome Diner has a Happy Hour. I got Carolina BBQ fries and a homemade ginger beer.  That beer had so much ginger it tasted peppery and it is strong! So delicious! The fries were a touch too salty with the mustard based BBQ and vinegar slaw. John got a Big Jim with was a huge biscuit with fries chicken, bacon, and covered in a yummy peppered sausage gravy. We also got sausage gravy and biscuits. For dessert we got beignets. Foods not perfect but VERY freshly prepared and pretty darn yummy!  This place is definitely worth a visit!
Burger was really good tried the fries they werent bad i like set up. Like that it didnt taste like a regular burger
Their idea of $8+ poutine is white gravy on a sad amount of fries? Pathetic. Don't waste your time.

This is my favorite place to take friends and family that are in town. It's my to go spot for late night food. Try some basil on your hurricane, that's my jam. Love the people and the food. Always good vibes.

My friend and I landed in Phoenix and came here for our first dinner. We loved everything from the outdoor seating, the food, and the drinks. My friend had the Welcome Burger and really enjoyed it. I ordered the brussel sprouts, jackfruit fries, and beignets to share. The brussel sprouts plate was large and filling and delicious. While the idea of jackfruit fries sounded appealing, I thought the taste got drowned out a bit by the barbecue sauce. We shared the beignets, and throughly enjoyed it. Overall a good meal at a super chill diner!

The staff here went above and beyond to make sure our experience here was out of this world. The best part? They treated everyone that way. Whether you were a regular, or were here for your first time! The food was mind blowing. My family of four inhaled everything on our plates! The only disappointing thing is there is not one in our hometown! I STRONGLY urge everyone to stop by, and enjoy the food and ambiance.

Super cozy diner.  It's small and doesn't have much of a street presence so it's fairly easy to miss if you aren't paying attention.  The diner is a classic boxcar that stays true to it's roots.  The outdoor seating area looks quite enjoyable for a late night snack, though I'm not sure if they are open that late.  Gotta love the outdoor ordering window.  You're best best inside is if you can catch a seat at the corner of the counter.  You not only get a great view of the chef doing the cooking but have a nice fat fan behind you to cool you off.    We arrived shortly after it opened and chatted with the cook to get his suggestions on what to order.  Very friendly and funny.  The counter's got various coffee table books full of quotes and handy worst case scenario answers.    I had the Garfield which was a fried egg sandwich specialty.  I can't really recall all the ingredients but the salsa in the sandwich was amazing.  My girlfriend ordered the grilled cheese and it was knock out.  Prepared with olive oil, it was by far one of the best grilled cheeses I've ever had.  The french fries were done just right and the seasoning on them really hit the spot.  The total for both of us including a couple of ice teas was under twenty dollars.  A great deal anywhere.  Just a friendly reminder that it is CASH ONLY!  I had to run to a couple of nearby gas station ATMs since the first was out of order.  Pretty embarrassing but the chef didn't seem to mind and trusted us to return.  Can't complain about any part of the meal and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Phoenix or any locals that have been snoozing on this gem.

The people here are very nice. Excellent customer service. The Welcome Diner is one really awesome place. The food was SO GOOD! I forgot the name of what I ordered, but it was essentially a pulled pork sandwich...I loved it. Their ginger beer is amazing, too.

I have never been disappointed with the food at Welcome Diner.  The food is locally sourced.  The salads are better than any other I have come across and the burgers are rated in the top 3 by my husband and myself.  As per usual in Phoenix, you don't get good food without paying a fair chunk of change, but I would take Welcome Diner over 90% of the places in Phoenix for the quality, Organic, locally sourced items and the chill atmosphere.
Great food!!!!!!!! I work at he hospital right next to it and love this Place!!

This has got to be one of the coolest places I've been to in Phoenix. It's hidden in the historic district of Garfield in between homes. It is a laid back, chill vibe. Reminds me of some of the hole in the wall places I've found on a tropical vacation out of the country. A perfect place to have some cocktails and spend hours talking with friends while sitting on picnic tables under string lights. I recommend going at night. The food was decent, but the atmosphere and drinks will keep me coming back. Also, they are dog friendly! You've got to check it out if your in the neighborhood.
You want amazing food try this place. The pulled pork fries are delicious. As is the ginger beer and take the recommendation of the staff you won't be disappointed!

What can I say that hasn't already been said? The only thing that comes to mind is PLEASE, for the LOVE of everything good and holy, open a location in the Bay Area...or give me the rights and I'll do it myself. =) Really love everything the Diner stands for - local, fresh, well thought out food that helps others understand the true passion that goes into each dish. The story behind both Welcome Diner and Chicken + Donuts will make you appreciate these places even more.  Go for the food, stay for a cocktail and leave with a smile....I always do! Thank you WD staff for being so bad @$$ - continue to kill it!

The Big Jim and the beignets have been on my foodie bucket list for some time and I finally stopped by last Sat.  The food was good (not great) but the ambiance was totally unacceptable.  They had a DJ playing music at an obnoxious volume. Not only was it at an unneighborly volume for being in a residential setting, but it was larded with the most objectionable vulgarities.  If I were a neighbor we would have a real problem.  As it is, I will most definitely NOT be a return customer.

*nom nom nom!*  Mm, this place is the perfect eatery for a lazy Sunday, or if you are skipping school or work as it's quite naughty.  One of those mimosas and bloody marys in the morning kind of days.  The Garfield is extremely satisfying and the french toast in a cup is genius, if a bit sticky.  But since we are being naughty eating here a little stickiness is probably appropriate!  It is tiny tiny, but I find it amusing rather than annoying.

Great find!!! The food is very good with a welcome unique flare!! The atmosphere is chill and comfortable! The staff is very friendly and really tries to get to know its patrons. I've had the Big Jim, Fried green tomatoes sandwich, and "back by popular demand" The Champion. All very tasty! It's my goal to try everything on the menu! Love, love, love this place. It belongs on a food network channel show, but because I don't want to have to wait in a line down the road to order food, I hope it doesn't...haha!!!
A very neat and little place!! Awesome fried chicken sandwich!!! and a cool staff. I will try again when I am downtown.
Favorite new spot: 1. Best biscuits in Phoenix. 2. Amazing food. 3. Delicious libations. 4. Great staff. 5. Reasonable prices. 6. Crystal's Hot Sauce.
Everyone who works here LoveS their job and it shows. The friend green tomato sandwich is my favorite. Pulled pork fries are a must and a whisky sour to tie it together.
This place is no joke. The biscuits are to die for. Pork Fries are unreal. I wish I had more room in my stomach to try everything on the menu. The service is top notch as well.
Great staff, great food. I get takeout from WD at least once a week.

Everything is amazing. Really one of the best all-around meals I've ever had. The burger was one of the best I've ever had, or maybe the best.. . Just the quality of the beef was so tasty. Even the pain fries were notably delicious. Portions are good, they serve the full menu until closing, and like... How can plain fries be so delicious??   Husband unit and I had Mac and cheese (plain, but still amazing). He had the welcome burger, I had a koko chicken and biscuit (good, but his burger was better), plain fries, coleslaw (vinegar based), and bignets. All. Amazing. So amazing that we're coming back here before we fly home, which is saying something because we typically like to try everying new on vacation.   There's 90% outdoor seating. It's definitely chill. Service is really friendly and casual... Like you're at an outdoor bbq kind of. Cokes are by the bottle, and there's fileted water self-serve from a cooler.   Working on crunchy, sweet, hot bignets right now... Must stop reviewing before husband eats them all.   COME HERE NOW.

My husband and I loved this place! It has a laid back ambiance and is so unique! The food is a mix of New Orleans style and is so tasty! I'd recommend the poutine fries and the fried green tomato sandwich.  Also they make pretty good cocktails, and even make their own tonic! You need to check this place out!

Get the Little Birdy, only $6 on HH! I have got it the last few times cause the Poutine was starting to get too filling for me as I'd almost pass out while I was still there lol The chicken is the juiciest chicken EVER! And you would think you'd need more than just a biscuit, chicken, and cheese to make a sandwich but thanks to this place you don't! It's so simple & perfect and pairs real nice with their $6 Old fashioned during Happy Hour!  An awesome (filling) meal and a fantastic drink for only $12 total, uh yeah I think that sounds good!! Always me to give them a much better tip, which they deserve and you should too!  Do It! Do it now! or wait until HH either way, either way!
Really 4.5 stars.   I love riding my bike here and I love devouring their share fries.....I NEVER SHARE!!!!!   Awesome neighborhood place!

I love Big Jim! I mean, I love the sandwich Big Jim here at Welcome Diner. Gravy, Fried Chicken, biscuit, glorious.  Nearly all of the food here will clog your arteries, but it tastes so damn good who really cares about that.  I don't know what the hell a Jackfruit is but it tastes as good as any bbq meat sandwich I've had. The drinks are made to order too and are quite tasty.  Only real complaint is I think it's a tad overpriced for the amount of food you get with certain sandwiches.  Sometimes the line can be ridiculously long especially on first friday so just, ya know, prepare to wait for that Big Jim.

Both chicken and donuts and the diner are two of my favorite places to eat in the world. Food makes you feel so good and service is always very kind. Try the jack fruit fries, they're my favorite. They make me sooooo gassy but I don't even care it's worth farting all night long to eat them.

The burger I got was scrumptious as well as the fries it came with. Cute cozy spot awesome for a late night bite. The grilled cheese was ok .. Would be better with maybe a bit less bread and more cheese .

8/10 on the hipster-o-meter. Really friendly staff. I had the big jim and my friend had the watermelon salad. Both were really good. 2 minor negatives would be the price ($9 for chicken bacon biscuit sandwich) and lack of seating.

My new favorite late night food spot. The cocktails were outstanding (do yourself a favor and get the whiskey sour) and the portions were large and delicious. My girlfriend and I split the Jim Bob and it was plenty for a late night snack. My only disappointment was that it took me almost 8 months living here to find the place.
I love this place! The food is so good. The chicken is so moist and have no bleaching, and fillers..a must try!

I never write reviews but welcome diner gave me every reason to start. I bartend and serve at another local restaurant and have to give it to them for their excellent service. The guy behind the counter was so enthusiastic about the food, and was patient with us since it was our first time.   I got the champion burger and shared the pork fries. WOW, definitely the best burger I've had in a while. Cooke perfectly med-rare and the flavors were perfect.   They also had a great beer and cocktail list..   It's a must try, and I'm looking forward to coming back to try the fried chicken.   YUM!
Cool hang. Killer food. Gives a whole new twist to what diner food can be. Totally playing to the strengths of Phoenix. One of the best burgers I've had in town. Killing it here!
Love this place. Awesome eats. Kick ass staff. Late night hours. Fabulous Tuesday night.
Such a fun place to eat and good food to boot!  Grilled biscuits and great chicken.  Try the fried green tomato sandwich.

Saw photos and reviews on yelp and we had to try it out. It was amazing! The employees were really really nice, they made us feel at home. I love the atmosphere. Would defiantly recommend it to anyone.

I'm giving it 4 solid stars for the unique and delicious food.  The chicken, gravy and biscuit was on point.  My girlfriend got a vegan sandwich that had a good acidity to it.  Know going in that the stereotypical hipster/dramacool crowd following is strong here and act entitled.  The guys taking orders and cooking, however moved with urgency and provided good customer service.  All in all a great late night spot with food options for everyone.

This place is a hidden gem! Love the atmosphere and the staff is always so friendly. It's a small place, but we always seem to find somewhere to sit. The fried green tomato sandwich has to be the best thing on the menu!

Incredible flavors! I'm usually one to avoid the hipster hot spots, but this place cannot be passed up. The burgers are just straight up impressive. Even my partner, who orders his plain, ketchup only, raves about them. Unfortunately for the burgers, the fried chicken is even better. The Koko is to die for! Perfectly fried, crispy chicken with a perfectly spiced chipotle ranch, served on a biscuit with arugula and a tomato slice.  While the food is great, what really has me coming back is the home brewed ginger beer. It's spicy and biting but all around refreshing. So unique and flavorful! Made of the exact stuff that makes this place so special.

This place has a place in my heart! It's not your normal sit down restaurant & it can be hard to find a seat when they're busy but it's all part of the experience! Every time I go, I get amazing service and everyone is so nice. One of the male employees there even knows my order. The food is amazing. I'm a creature of habit, so I always get pulled pork fries & a second generation drink, but the big jim & there jalapeno burger are great too. They have awesome happy hour deals too, and are opened late.

Loved this quirky place! Between the 3 of us we ordered the grilled cheese on a biscuit, the Carol (BBQ pork) and the Big Jim (for especially hearty appetites.  The flavors were amazing! Loved the mustard BBQ sauce on my Carol.  Really wanted to try the Beignets but they were out f them already. Cest la vie...a reason to come back for sure.

The Fried Mother F***ing Chicken. Damn. DAMN! Nice crisp crust with a juicy a** center. Damn. And that's where it starts.   Shut up because I'm going to talk about the biscuits. One: bread is amazing, but this bread. Damn. It has a soft crunch when you bite then a moist center.   So you have the juicy a** chicken and this bomb a** bread put that together and you know what you get... F***ING-OMG-SHUT UP I just had the best fried chicken sandwich in Phoenix. This is there speciality, so just order one. There are different variations of this sandwich. Doesn't matter which one you get they're all amazing!!!   The Must Eats:  Fries. Bomb. Burgers. Bomb.   If you get there for Happy Hour get the pork fries... PORK FRIES!!! I don't need to explain how good these fries are. Just shut up then unshut up and order them.

This diner came well recommended by the nice folks at the Phoenix hostel just a few blocks away. Easy walking distance in this cool little neighborhood from the hostel and the fun stuff to do on 5th street.   The old diner still has the 50's vibe with classic neon, but the food is non-classical diner fare (in a great way), is healthy and satisfying, and the folks working there are legit - down to earth and friendly. Just chill folks, no pretense, great food.   It's awesome to be back in the "south" and see iced tea on the menu. I kept requesting more, and the cool tattooed chick just brought me out a pitcher, a whole bowl of lemon slices and a smile.  That's hospitality.   I had the "KOKO", a hand breaded, fried chicken breast in a homemade biscuit with some kind of homemade remoulade, baby greens, tomato and a side of vinegar-based red coleslaw. Awesome. Friends had a deep fried avocado (vegan) po-boy and the other gad the fish po-boy, both of which looked great.   Definitely coming back.  Edit:  BTW, just saw on their online menu that they have a beer terrine salad, don't know how I overlooked that last night, but I'm kicking myself. Any place that has beets on the menu gets an automatic A++.

A friend brought me and some classmates here to celebrate the end of the semester and I was very surprised by the quality! There is practically no parking and most of the seating is outside, so plan accordingly. The decor is funky and unique, I had fun looking around.    I ordered a hurricane and beneigts and instantly  felt like I was back in New Orleans! Fresh and yummy! Everything we ordered came out within about 15min, which is quite impressive considering how tiny the kitchen is! I would go back for a fun night treat, as they are open late!

Discovered this place yesterday night for a late dinner(1am), and was amazingly surprise. The ambiance, the decoration, the friendly staff. It was happy hour and we had the pork fries ($7) the portion was huge and it was really tasty. It's also a full bar and they make great cocktails!  We will be back for sure!
Just awesome. The biscuits are buttery, the chicken is juicy. The food is simple, done well, and delicious; plus it's minutes from our house.  Can't wait to come back to try something else!

I've been a regular at Welcome for some years now and I can't get enough! Everything on the menu is amazing and so are the drinks. Hurricaaaaane! I like to sit inside at the bar. It's a nice cozy spot for a date night. I only wish they were still open for brunch on the weekends!!!
This is the homiest  most delicious place to visit. You won't be disappointed in the chicken, biscuit & gravy combo. I had to try chorizo, also delic! Nicest and friendliest guys around!

One of my favorite spots in town. This place is amazing from the staff to the food ist incredible. The Po'boy Fish sandwich is really really good I get that and the Kiko i think... something along those lines is a breat burger.

The fried green tomato sandwich is amazing! I had one last night for dinner, and it's the first thing I thought about when I woke up this morning. And the whiskey sour was delicious, too. Super friendly and helpful staff, to boot. I look forward to returning.

Coconut cream grits with collards and tomato sauce.  As vegan as it gets, and so full of flavor!  Had it twice...once on Thursday and again on Saturday.  Ran into 4 friends while I sat at the counter Saturday evening.  This place is the best.

This is one of those places that are so good and so small that the idea of giving 5 stars frightens me because it's bound to get busier.  But Welcome Diner unquestionably deserves all of them.    Not sure what to get?  Start with the Welcome Burger your first time there.  They are better than what you want when you're looking for a really great American burger.   Can't wait to try the biscuits next time.  Atmosphere is laid back.  Bathroom is tiny. Food is very tasty, classic honemade yumness.  Experience it!
Awesome place, great customer service and the foods is top notch! Would definitely come again and again without hesitation.

Love at first bite! The food(I ordered burgers and fries) was very delicious. The place is easy to found. Outdoor seating was available. Went to the restaurant by myself. And will come with my friends next time.
The food was not exceptional more average and limited menu and the staff could have been more attentive.
What a great place. The food is amazing, the portions are huge, and the atmosphere is friendly. I really enjoyed having the carol over fries, with slaw... yum.
Visiting from LA, looked for a place to eat late at night and found this place. Would recommend the Champion burger, pulled pork fries, sunrise biscuit, and beignets

Me and my family came to welcome diner had the no way Jose burger biscuits with goat cheese and jam and had the sweet beignets with local honey it was very succulent delicious and the bomb I give it 5 stars you got to get here

I am from out of town, but one place the locals recommended consistently was Welcome Diner so I figured I'd give it a try.  The ambiance and decor are very warm and inviting- lots of outdoor seating and strung lights. Tables were clean and kept, but we ended up sitting inside at the bar for the air conditioning. Staff is incredibly friendly! We went earlier in the night and it was a bit slow- so we were able to talk to the staff and ask for favorites and specials. The cook named Ryne was very helpful and had a great knowledge of the menu! I am a vegetarian and there were quite a few unique options for me. I ended up getting the fried tomato sandwich with a side of jackfruit fries. Both were excellently prepared and the service was great.  Thank you Ryne and the rest of Welcome diner for a great meal! I will be coming back every time I am in Phoenix!

Oh wow! Found this lil' gem by tapping around the Yelp map after arriving at Sky Harbor, and not wanting Mexican. Feels pretty sketchy en route, like there's no way there's a 5 star diner around this corner, couldn't be more wrong! Hands down, best joint in all of Phoenix. Quaint outdoor seating and the most incredible home cooked southern style dinning. Every single thing was delicious.

This place is INCREDIBLE. Any time I have friends visiting from out of town, I bring them here - the atmosphere, staff, and food are absolutely amazing. My favorite thing on the menu is definitely the PB&B Burger. UGH so weird and so perfect.   It's wonderful that such a unique place exists in the neighborhood - love having cool places to show people to prove that Phoenix really is a fun place to live.

Seems like everyone working here cares about what they do. That's a wonderful recipe for deliciousness and a great time. :-)  And they drink Fernet to celebrate milestones. That's a very good sign.  Oh, and everything I ate and smelled was insanely delicious!

I once thought of this place as far inferior to many restaurant chains such as IHOP, but after my recent travels here, I feel as if I have discovered one of Phoenix's true hidden gems. The service was excellent and the store had a very welcoming vibe. Staff is really kind and friendly to everyone! Great food as well!

This place is so cute! I can't get enough of it! They make their own ginger beer! Chicken and waffles! Biscuits! PBR! Huzzah! The poutine is a must try. The atmosphere is casual and friendly, not too hipster (but juuuust hipster enough to make people watching great), and the cocktails are tasty.
LOVE this place! Super friendly staff and super good food. Such a good time and dog friendly!

I ordered the pulled jackfruit po' boy and was disappointed.  The barbecue sauce and the cole slaw in the sandwich were too tart that they overpowered the jackfruit.  I'm not ready to write off this place yet. Will have to try other dishes.
We ordered food at 10:30 and it's 11:15 pm still no food. The company I'm with is highly irritated and has made the entire experience very bad. First and last time here.

Great place (the summary). I was in PHX to work for a few hours and catch a red-eye flight - of course used Yelp to find a place for dinner.  Welcome Diner - great concept, great execution and great food!  It took me awhile to figure out its location - I drove by it a few times before I realized - oh that's the restaurant and found a parking spot behind the restaurant.  You walk up to the to a window/counter and order from the posted menu and then grab a seat outside in the front yard/deck/patio area.  Had the vegetarian option (vegan po'boy) along with some biscuits and a tea. Great tasting food.    Loved sitting outside (it was around 800p or so) - a big table full of folks across the patio so I just relaxed at one of the counter/stool seats along the sidewalk - nice to just relax and catchup on emails/news/etc.   Crazy but I guess I never noticed that an inside for dining room also - I just assumed it was outdoor dining only.    Customers were walking, biking, and driving to get to the restaurant - which can make a restaurant an interesting people watching experience!   Highly recommended.

The Blue sky burger is delicious (Even without the bun as I requested) The guys there are super cute, sweet and courteous. I'm visiting from Cali and I most definitely will try to come back before leaving.

Out with my two boys,who, like me, enjoy exploring for great eats. Based on Yelp suggestions, I decided to give this place a shot. It was close to the art museum we were at, reasonable prices, and great food!  It is hard to find food that has great flavor, and makes you feel like you are eating a meal made by momma.  Staff was courteous and ambiance was hip. Thanks for the experience, we are definitely excited to come back!

This place is great but the food etc, but I will say the customer service is pretty bad. Not friendly and they walk around with attitudes. I have been here multiple times and the people are just not friendly. Other than that good food!
Welcome Diner is perfect, their staff is perfect, slurricanes are perfect. The end.

Ahhhh! The best burger I think I've had! (the champion?) This place has redeemed my first impression of Phoenix! My beloved and I were just passing through. Phoenix was hot (really hot), congested, and filled with erratic drivers, leading to stress and grumpiness. The Welcome Cafe took us in with open arms. Awesome food, awesome drinks, awesome people. We laughed and joked with everyone at the bar like they were family. We'd be here at least once a week if we lived here. Well Done!!
My cute bartender Jesse was the best  The food was amazing as well, get the fish Po'boy!
The food is amazing. The big Jim is awesome and the mac and cheese is so good !! Love it

We went to the Vig first for them to tell us that the kitchen was closed. One of the waiters came out to tell us that there was a restaurant close by with five star food, but not five star appearance. He also told us about a few more in the area, but we decided to try Welcome Diner. Omg, the food was amazingly great, the service was impeccable and the music was awesome, I am so glad we came here I ate everything on my plate

I hesitate to write this review because as much as I want success for some of these culinarily perfect grub spots out in Phoenix, I also don't want it to get any busier than it does. I like that they're placed in a neighborhood, it's just a little diner that seems like it's always been there. With the community dining, eclectic patio furniture and the always engaging staff this place really exemplifies what food should be. Good, local and comfortable. It's one of the few...actually ONLY respectable restaurants that I can walk into on a Friday and Saturday at 7pm without a 2 hour wait or calling ahead for a reservation. I hope welcome diner is preserved forever, it's definitely my favorite part of Arizona food culture.

This place is a darn GEM!!!!  Went here last night as I was told they have amazing burgers, and I'm a burger and beer kinda gal, and OH MAN!!  Literally the best burger I have ever had,  finally somewhere in AZ that actually cooks the burger how you order it. Plus they have brewed in az beers to top it all off. It's hidden in a kinda sketchy neighborhood  but the decor within the restaurant makes you feel comfy and the food is so worth it!  I will definitely be going back!

The food was better than acceptable and it was hilarious to see the expression on the window clerk's face when I ordered a Coke and no booze.  She was quite friendly though and the server also was for the most part.  The crowd seemed laid back and content to mind there own beeswax.  I'll definitely hit this joint up again at a later date.

Came here bcuz of the reviews on Yelp. I have had some amaaazing chicken in my life. I can honestly say, I'll always remember this place! The food is simply some of the best I've had-period. It's local, hipster, retro, and just that good!

Just went back for another Tuesday night dinner...  Romesco Cauliflower Gnocchi Soft Shell Crab Goat Terrine Lamb Loin Chocolate Chip Pecan Pie Olive Oil Cake Butterscotch Brownie Brioche Pudding  Ridiculous. Top five best dinners in Phoenix.
Great food, beautiful ambiance. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes to eat local food outdoor in Downtown Phoenix.
Hidden gem!!! We love this place!!!! everything on the menu is awesome!!!

Enticed by the rave reviews, we decided to try this place out. It was ridiculously expensive for what you get. Not great for kids as there are no kids menu options and they wouldn't serve a smaller portion of the $8 mac and cheese "snack" when I asked. Also no high chairs or booster seats. My husband had the biscuits and gravy which he said were tasty, but nothing special to warrant the high price. I had a cheeseburger ordered medium rare and fries. The fries were shoestring. Not my favorite, but fries are fries. First bite into the burger and bloody juices exploded in my face and all over. The burger was rare, at best. It was dropping and the bun got instantly soggy. Absolutely disgusting and a turnoff!
Peanut Butter Burger.  An event of world-historical importance.

I love everything about this place. Great food, great music jams on the speakers, outdoor patio, late hours, beer... Immensely satisfying biscuits and gravy. Cute Art Deco store front. Everything is perfect in the modern diner way as far as I can tell

I give a 4.5. This place is just plain cool. Here are the 2 things you need to change:  1) Open earlier than 5 2) Sell glasses of wine instead of just bottles  Other than that, it's always an enjoyable experience. The drinks are good. The hurricane is a sweet and refreshing cocktail, but my favorite is the floricita. I imagine the whiskey-based drinks are just as delicious.  For the food - the biscuit plates are always good, but it's sometimes hard to get myself in the mood for a biscuit plate. When there were rillettes on the menu I was a happy camper - the fat melts on your tongue and the pickled watermelon was the perfect yang to that yin. I have eaten a lot of rillettes and you guys do them well. I would personally like to see more entrees on the menu, and since you serve breakfast, open for breakfast? Or at least lunch... It's the perfect day spot.  Nevertheless, the food is amazing. Great job in the kitchen. Drinks are awesome. Prices great. Fun and social atmosphere, and good walkable location.

Amazing little neon diner with counter with stools inside and a large comfortable patio out, with umbrellas and heaters.  Sitting at the counter is the best, as its fun to chat with the bartender and watch the food being prepared in the tiny kitchen.  Best Old Fashioned ever and burger was specially good as well.  Beignets? Yes! Very fun place to go late night too.

This place is amazing! Went to dinner with a couple friends that have been here and recommended the place. The weather was beautiful so why not enjoy a meal outside. The scenery is beautiful, I love the string lights that hang outside. I ordered the Bumblebee biscuit, it had just the right about of everything on it and the chicken was cooked to perfection. It was phenomenal. I love that the side dish is watermelon, what a great refreshing side. We also got a side of poutine fries that were delicious. It's a little messy and sticky, but totally worth it. I am looking forward to trying more from the menu. The staff is super friendly and great customer service. We got our food in a decent amount of time. I will be returning and recommending this place.

Everyone has their go to places, and this happens to be mine, especially late night when no one else is open.    Every dish I have ever ordered is great, but my favorite thus far happens to be "The Champion" which is a burger, with BACON JAM!  Everything about this burger is amazing, but adding a fried egg to it makes it that much better! Another one of my favorites is their, Poutine, fries smothered in gravy. You have to try them.  I often hear people complain about the prices, but I don't mind paying that, as long as the food and staff is amazing, which they are.

Both our plates were wonderful and the staff was friendly. Solid biscuits, chorizo, and a well-cooked egg. My gin and tonic (ordered on a whim) was a bit weak for my taste. 5 stars for a better drink and a cleaner bathroom.

I brought my dad here a couple of weeks ago, just on a whim. I'd been once before when the previous owners still had the place, and I had been itching to go back.   We went for an early lunch so we were able to sit inside. The staff is friendly, and I think my dad enjoyed the fact that every time the waitress turned around, her rear end was right in his face. Dirty old men in close quarters. What can you do?   The food was great- I had the grilled cheese (minus pickles), he had a burger and we both had fries. I loved the grilled cheese- it was perfectly charred- and he had no complaints about the burger, which is a rare thing. The fries were perfection and I may have even dreamed about them that night.   I can't imagine eating here would be too fun in the middle of the summer, as most of the seating is outside, but it's a great little lunch spot, and they're also open late on First Fridays. Good to know, since getting food anywhere else downtown on a First Friday is next to impossible.   I'll definitely be back.

I don't normally write reviews... But this place is an exception!!!!! (I actually created an account just to review this place)  The atmosphere is worth the trip alone, cool set up with outdoor seating (nice lights at night) and a rad mural on the fence. Super cool staff, real friendly!  Anyway, THE FOOD, The food is amazing, I have been traveling the U.S for 2 months and I haven't tasted anything that would come close to this! I had the fried avocado po'boy and a side of Brussels sprouts. The Brussels sprouts were delicious, I think they were pan fried with oil and some herb, and the po'boy was probably the BEST THING I HAVE EVER EATEN! But seriously, it was delicious, And it's served with diced watermelon on the side, blends nicely, and whoever thought of deep fried avocado is a god dam genius!!!!    I wasn't sure what to expect when I got there, I was just going from the reviews on yelp. And they were right!  So do yourself a favor and head on down to welcome diner and hook in to some of there great food!!!   My only regret is that I leave tomorrow and only got to visit once :(

It's an old train car style diner. The food is amazing, as are the drinks(they make their own tonic and other cocktail ingredients). I am pretty sure that all or most of the food ingredients are bought locally. The wait staff are almost all local artists and musicians(as are a lot of the customers), interesting and friendly people, who are great for striking up a conversation with. The secret ingredient in Welcome Diner is love. Also, children's cough syrup. Anyways, it's an amazing place, get off your duff and go.

Do yourself a favor and eat here. Pick any item on the menu. Have a drink. You will not be disappointed. I don't care what kind of food you like, if you are picky or not, this place is amazing  and will leave you always wondering what the next item on the menu tastes like. Not only is the food stupid good, but every member of the staff is friendly and attentive. Matt is a master behind the bar and if you can't make up your mind he will help you choose something that will change how you view food.

Incredible place. You can tell the owners put a lot of care into their recipes. Seems like they opened it on a budget, since the restaurant is an old, small diner trailer put on a lot in a not-so-great part of town (area has improved dramatically since they started, it's now a decent area). There are some bar seats inside, but the main dining area is a patio. I love the character of this diner. It's unique and friendly.  My biggest complaint is that it could take up to 45 minutes for your food come out depending on how busy they are. However, the patio is a nice place to wait and enjoy drinks while you're waiting. Guessing this is a result of their tiny kitchen in the trailer and I hesitate to mention this complaint, since without that tiny kitchen Welcome Diner wouldn't be what it is.

We visited welcome diner for the first time last night. The food was amazing we tried the fried green tomato sandwich and it was delicious. The service was exceptional and the vibe was super laid back we are a fan and will be back soon to try the Mac and cheese!
I have had friends telling me about Welcome Diner for years. It is a fantastic and quaint dining spot. The biscuits are delicious and the drinks are tasty. I will be returning again soon!
The Jackfruit BBQ sandwich is the absolute best! I will travel just to eat that again!

The food here was great, and the servers were attentive.  We were visiting from out of town and the location was not all what we expected; kind of back in a local neighborhood.  But the place itself is lovely.  If we had had more time we would have visited again during our trip, the food was so good :)

First time in Phoenix, and we ate all of our meals at one restaurant - The Welcome Diner. The service is ridiculously pleasant, with various servers casually checking in with you and chatting you up during the meal. Dinner was probably one of the best meals we have ever had- to start: pulled pork fries smothered in tangy BBQ sauce and topped with homemade cool coleslaw. Then the Welcome Burger, which was moan inducing and gone in about 4 bites. We followed this with their summer salad of watermelon, tomato, ginger pickled rinds, and arugula surrounded by a delicious basil cashew pesto. Unbelievably refreshing. To finish we went with the honey drizzled beignets and basically licked the plate clean. Oh and also the cocktails here are amazing - heaven on earth. And we spent about $60 on all of it. Such a ridiculous bargain. Writing this from the lovely shaded patio waiting for our eggs and biscuits to arrive. We might never leave!
The burgers are delish fries are so good and the staff is friendly and helpful the spot is very hip and the vibe is chill I will definitely be back

The vibe of this place is a very relax feel but the seating arrangement is kind of uncomfortable. Inside on the bar I found to be the most comfortable but is very tight and  tight. Outside, there is a variety of seating but most of the chairs are not dining type of chairs, good for laying out, but not for eating. It is very much like a picnic feel is what they are probably going for with it.   Well onto more important things is the food. Now I admit, I am not a fan of their type of food, so I mostly ate breakfast dishes. Their signature dish is the big Jim. It is a huge, messy, and not the healthiest of dishes but is fairly tasty. The Chicken breast is well done, but the biscuit was kind of dry and the gravy was kind of cold. I have been to so many places and tried so many biscuit and gravy, and no one ever heats up the gravy beside a luke warm temperature. I just don't get it, but anyways, it was luke warm and kind of bland. Most of the taste came from the chicken and bacon really, rest was kind of there.   I also had their welcome breakfast with sausage. Again the biscuit was not flaky or tender in the middle but dry which was a disappointment. Sausage was one of the best I have tasted even though it was swimming in grease. Eggs and potatoes were okay, nothing really inspiring but very greasy also. So this is their basic breakfast dish which I try at different places to see if there is truly something different about the place. Nothing stood out, but the sausage.   All in all I have to give them a 3 star, the quality and execution of the food does not deserve a 4 star and definitely they are not that creative or their food is so much different  and outstanding that it deserve a 5 star. They are definitely a high 3 star, and I would go back, would unlikely right away or on a consistent basis, but once in a while is definitely in the cards.

We LOVE Welcome Diner! The dishes never disappoint, whether you opt for a biscuit sandwich, a burger, or a daily special. Definitely check the seasonal hours just to ensure you're going for the right meal. While we love the burgers, we prefer winter hours with breakfast and the killer coffee!!!

Had the Mac and Cheese with Chicken and the Biscuits and Gravy with fried chicken. Both were hands down the amazing!! The restaurant is unique looking and has mainly outdoor seating. A great place with character and its open late. A MUST TRY while you are in the Phoenix Downtown Area.

Just finished having dinner here with my girlfriend. The environment is very hipster, small area, not crowded, and clean. Price was fair, just like any other restaurant.   The service was outstanding. Very friendly and very courteous. I've worked in customer service for many years, and these guys sure know how to deliver quality service.  Will definitely be returning.

This place is amazing and worth the drive if you're not from the area. Everything we ordered was delicious and cooked perfectly. Fresh, local ingredients which makes this place even more awesome!!! Service is super friendly and the ambiance is very chill-like you're in an old friends back yard! We ordered the big Jim, fish po boy, and the poutine...if we weren't so full we would have ordered seconds!!! Definitely going back!
Delicious food, great drinks, and wonderful service. Not a lot of seating inside, though. Makes it mostly a non-summer place.

Oh my, I just have to say that this place is a knock your socks kind of meal.  I had the Big Jim, the flavor and and taste is insane..... This reminds me of one of those spots you run into in California.  Trust me, you will not be disappointed....

Such a cool atmosphere! Small diner-car walk up with lighted outdoor seating. The PB&B burger was amazing, and my wife had a sort of fried chicken biscuit sandwich that she loved. Our cocktails were yummy too! Pretty pricey though! Be prepared to drop at least $40 for 2 people, $50 with booze.

Was very happy here . I travel a bunch for work, so I haven't been able to check our many new places . This place is a hidden gem that I don't believe will remain hidden for very long . I can't believe I was able to get one of the best classic margaritas I've ever had for $7 at happy hour . Food service was a little slow but I expect that will improve in time . Food was tasty and simple with classics.

Great atmosphere.So relaxed. Burger was super delicious. Fries could have used a bit more crispiness. The ginger beer is made in house and is sweet, sharp, and very gingery, one of the best I've ever had!!

Here in Phoenix for business and since eating by yourself is not fun....I wanted a local spot to enjoy dinner.  And oh boy did I find a GREAT spot.  Welcome Diner provides a unique atmosphere and the weather was awesome.    I highly recommend the KoKo - Chicken Biscuit Sandwich with a creamy spicy sauce, fried chicken, arugula, tomato and some other stuff with a side of watermelon.  Absolutely delicious!!!  I also treated myself to the Beignets which were so good and I wish I could have finished them all but I was stuffed.  And get a Hurricane; fresh and perfect too!  Staff was great, friendly and if I am back in Phoenix again, I will definitely come back to the Welcome Diner!
A true delight with a short and thoughtful menu filled with well prepared grub.

This place is amazing! Went for some late night chow after a show. Service was great food was soooooooo good! I had the delicious best ever vegetarian jackfruit sandwich and my friend had the Mac n cheese. Recommend!
This place is wonderful. Very unique diner with a variety of different salads. The ingredients are always fresh, and the quality is apparent from the first bite.

This place is so unassuming but it will punch you in the life with deliciousness! I just think about the biscuits and the gravy and the chicken! I have only gotten my food to go because we have several kids and it looks like a cool place for date night. The hours are hard to remember. But it's yum!
Called them on 2 occasions to place a to-go order and they did not pick up their phone.

Amazing food! We had the fried chicken on a biscuit sandwiches  one was with the sausage gravy - and the other was the  buffalo one both very good. We had the Hurricanes also very tasty. Definitely going to be on our list of favorites!

Looking for a place that is so off the beaten path that you need to drive down a neighborhood road to get to it. Well this is the place. Great food, friendly owners and a diner you will want to come back to.
Food is good - hours are great...  little pricy but I walked away full.   Not my every night choice since two of us cost 45$ but a great once and a while place for late night snacking

Came here based on the reviews and we weren't disappointed. The staff was very friendly and attentive, the food was excellent and the drinks were tasty. Topping it off was the outdoor seating and the crowd, a perfect Arizona night on our road trip through the area.

Their red bean and rice are fabulous and the portion is super generous!  I also had the Kentucky Thoroughbred cocktail and it was amazing.  There's something about sitting knee to knee with strangers at a nine-person diner counter talking about food and life and watching the chef's work in the teensy-tiny kitchen.  But don't worry - if you need some space and want to enjoy the amazing AZ weather there's a HUGE patio and fun little order window... something for everyone!  For dessert I got the homemade biscuit with goat cheese and apple butter.  The biscuit was warm but the cheese was cold and that was a weird combination.  But overall everything was delicious and I will totally be back!!!

Ordered a po boy sandwich and a pie and they forgot the blue berry sauce that goes on it. If you're going to blow the order at least try or want to fix the problem not say my bad. After coming back twice on the phone and not being able to resolve the issue you've lost a customer especially if I'm going to spend 20.00 plus and even tip on a to go order. Next time attempt to replace and coach your staff.

So excited this diner opened. It's a neighborhood diner in a historic district.  Awesome food and great service. Small bar seating inside and patio outside. Had the catfish on Friday for like $12 with a little bit of watermelon pieces on the side.  Catfish was a great portion well worth the price.

Amazing food and a quaint little spot.  Can be confusing to order, but we figured it out.  The food was delicious!  After a concert it hit the spot!  My only dislike was bottled soda...I just love a glass of ice.  If I'm in the neighborhood I will come back here for sure!!!
First time eating here late one evening on a whim with my work peeps. Delicious, unique, delicious. We sat outside in august- only downfall. Looking fwd to going back in the fall.

Chose this diner because of all the rave reviews and wasn't disappointed! Five stars for atmosphere, five stars for the awesomeness of food, and five stars for the friendliness of staff. Try it out for yourself, you will not regret it.

The welcome diner is such a cool dive! I love that it's one of the few places serving awesome food at night. The outdoor seating and lighting is perfect to come hang out with a bunch of friends. One time I accidentally tipped them $100, which was TOTALLY embarrassing, because my card company texted me asking if it was a fraudulent transaction. They were cool and we laughed about it, but if I was wealthier I would definitely have tipped them $100 because it's a great place. :) Their mac n' cheese is bomb. Check this fine establishment out.

Overcharged drinks. Specifically asked if a whiskey and soda would be the same price as a gin and tonic... ended up 4 dollars more. 8 dollar whiskey and soda the whiskey and sour ended up being 18 dollars. Total should have been  14 bucks. After asking the mgr what had happened, he explained that since it was house made ginger soda, it's a 4 dollar extra charge. Ended up just settling the tab and then my girlfriend ordered me a drink. Half a hour later and everyone at the table has their drink... Except me. Asked the manager again what was going on and it ended up in a verbal altercation with him. The summary of the argument was that I asked for my drink, then the whiskey and soda was brought up by him again. Eventually just let him know that I will be posting a review on google due to his behavior. Quote unquote response from the manager "Google? Never heard of it.". Keep in mind this is with a whole line of guests behind me and they're listening pretty intently by this point.  Waited a couple more mins, my girlfriend at this point just goes to get the money back. Guests behind definitely took note as their first question "was the service that bad?" Yes. Yes, it was.   Childish at best. Will not frequent this location again. What sucks is that I've been going here since they were running out of the food truck years and years ago.
Get the BIG JiM. Biscuits and gravy with fried chicken, bacon and cheese. Basically everything amazing into one dish. I took off one star for the wacky hours and lack of (good) seating

I had a great time dining at this place. Loved the casualness of the establishment. Order from the walk up window and the food gets delivered to your outdoor patio table. The food was comfort, with a twist for the better.  Opens late and serves beer & spirits. I can see why this is a local spot that's gone mainstream.  No doubt, a great hidden gem of Phoenix.

Best Restaurant in Phoenix! Even if this establishment wasn't within walking distance from my house I would drive 50 miles for the Chicken biscuit sandwiches and amazing burgers they serve. The service is outstanding, the ambiance is mellow, friendly, and casual. A perfect place for a first date, group gathering, or drinks with friends. The hours are phenomenal (they are open super late or super early). Check them out!
Went here during first friday and it was a madhouse. I'm assuming things run a little smoother when the line isn't out the door so I give them the benefit of the doubt. Food is amazing all the way!
Lurvvv this place and their artichoke mac. Also cute and quaint with a hip vibe.

Coolest place downtown! I'm sure them staying open for food until 2am has something to do with it. My sister and I shared a burger after a concert and it was so good we wanted more! Next time we will not share, that's for sure! Thanks guys for working so hard at 2am at night while everyone else is having a good time! We were so thankful you were open because we were starving! Awesome place and great food, will recommend to everyone and can't wait to go back and try the fries with gravy!

I highly recommend this place...the food is mostly locally sourced...it's fresh...tasty...reasonably priced...outdoor seating available...a laid back vibe...started by 5 friends with varying artistic talents...very friendly and accommodating...

Awesome spot! It's like a permanent food truck/ diner combo with plenty of outdoor seating. Strung up lights and eclectic furniture help create a cozy, relaxed atmosphere. Most important, however, is the fact that everyone working here is nice, attentive, and helpful in providing drink & food recommendations. I can personally recommend their old fashioned, house made ginger beer, biscuits, poutine or pulled pork fries, and watermelon salad. Oh and the slaw on the pulled pork fries and some of the biscuits is amazing! Come check this place out!
This place was amazing! Excellent service! Superb food! I see myself spending lots of time here with friends and/or family. Thank you!

This is the first restaurant I have eaten at in Phoenix, at the recommendation of a local, and it really set the tone of the rest of our food-ventures here in Phoenix.  the ATMOSPHERE is amazing. You drive up to this old, tiny diner with a variety of seating in front of it, and strings of lights hung up around the eating area. The vibe is very chill and feels like a funky neighborhood joint. You definitely feel at home, and I love that everyone feels welcome.   When ordering your FOOD you go up to a tiny window of the trailer and after find a seat. Once your food is ready, they call your name and bring your food over to your table. I was deciding between the Bumblebee biscuit sandwich and the Fried Green tomato sandwich. The guy at the counter said I should try the green tomato sandwich, so I did. AND IT WAS AWESOME.  It is seriously  a perfect combination of the crispy battered tomato plus the sweet corn and the savory spread and the crunchy sourdough bringing it all together. Such a genius sandwich! We also shared a poutine which was just gravy and yellow cheese (just different than other poutine that I have had). The gravy tasted really homemade and delicious.  The SERVICE was great. Everyone was friendly and very laid back and they really made you feel at ease.  I would say that the ONLY NEGATIVE is that once you get your food, the flies immediately sense it and are all over it. It just gets annoying, but it's not like anyone can control mother nature.
Ordered a grilled cheese at 5:15 pm with 6 people there.  Took a longer than expected, but was super tasty by the time we got it at 5:45.  The whole menu looks really good.

They have limited non alcoholic beverages. So if you want a Diet Coke, best bring your own.  The food took awhile. If it wasn't so dang good, I would have been mad. Lol. We ordered the bumble bee with the mustard on the side. Omg!!! It was actually delicious!! The chicken was crispy the biscuit was soaked in honey. It was awesome. The Brussels sprouts were crispy and yummy. The poutine was good (nothing out of this world but good). The big Jim was delicious and savory but not as delicious as the bumblebee. The beignets were thicker than what I'm accustomed to but so so good. I'd get everything I ordered again. It was all superb.   As soon as I burn off these calories, I'm coming back! It just might take me a couple of weeks

Wife and I just flew in to Arizona and stopped here because our flight got in around 10pm and this place was nearby Sky Harbor and open late (kitchen open until 2am).   Ordered the Welcome Burger, medium well, raw onions, no pickles (because they were bread and butter pickles and I don't like those). It came with a choice of side and I picked fries.   The burger was FAN. FRIGGIN. TASTIC. I can say the same for the fries. My wife tried both and agreed with my enthusiasm. In fact, I can say without exaggeration that this was easily one of the top 5 burgers I've ever had in my 30 years of life. Can't speak highly enough of the burger and also the fries. We'll definitely be coming back here on our way to the airport before leaving Arizona.

This place puts out some darn good quality food and in BIG portions for the price! I got the pulled pork bbq biscuit which was huge and so flavorful. My husband got the bumblebee which was a biscuit sandwich with extra crispy fried chicken, honey, and mustard. He said he loved it, but not before he finished it because he didn't want to let me have a taste. We also shared the macaroni and cheese, sooooo creamy with great texture and crunch factor on top! Plus, we got to add chorizo which made that dish my husband's all time fave. My favorite was the pouting fries that we shared. Gaahhhhhh lee that is comfort food at BEST! I'm a ketchup girl but these fries hit all the right notes without any added condiments. The only con about this place is that seating is outdoors. The entire time my husband and I were fighting off flies and picking out debris falling from the tree from our food (it got really windy.) I'm sure the ambiance is much better when the weather isn't so annoying, but this was kind of a turn off for us. However, the food was SO worth fighting a fly army. Would visit again!

Drinks are amazing and the jackfruit dishes are wonderful. I wish they had more vegan options and more inside seating but this is a super tiny diner so you have to take this into consideration. They make their own tonic water for gin and tonics, oh myyy!

We were looking for a late nite bite. Although nobody called us dude (sir) it was only because we were old enough to be everyone's parents. No matter, the service was enthusiastic and personal, the food delicious, the atmosphere authentically hipster. I had the fried green (red) tomato sandwich which was positively nuclear, the way I like it. Health food no doubt. What a great place. Wish we could have had some drinks because they had interesting ones, but my companion had Hurricane Juice and said it was the best juice he ever had. A mix of fresh juices would definitely benefit from rum.

FUN! FUN! FUN! GOOD! GOOD! GOOD! Need I say more? OPEN late 2am even during the week. Good food and low prices. Really can't beat that combination! A little bit of a sketchy neighborhood, but safe enough. Give it a try.

This place is awesome! Drinks and food were delicious. We had the little birdy and the pork fries. Yummy! Their hurricane drinks are the best. We also had an old fashioned and whisky sour. Bartender (Zack) was very friendly. Very small inside diner type seating and lots of outdoor tables. Highly recommend this place!
Awesome! Great home cooked food. The watermelon salad with pickled rind and goats cheese is a gluten free DELIGHT!

On a recent trip to Sedona Az from LA Ca, stopped by in Phoenix to grab a bite. Came across the Welcome diner on yelp & was intrigued by the retro / hipster look & did my food research . Definitely recommend the Champion burger   like many others on here. You will not be disappointed! My lady bug ordered the Mac n cheese & loved it. Overall an amazing spot to get a quick bite and just hangout outdoors. Would come back when in Phoenix for sure.   Oh & all staff were masters of their crafts without a doubt.

YUMMMMMMMMMOOOOOO! I've been wanting to go for a while.  I wasn't disappointed at all with my Big Jim ~ fried chicken, sausage gravy, cheddar & bacon!  Other orders in the group was the Carol~ kiltlifter  braised pork, carolina bbq sauce and coleslaw & Sunrise~ bacon, andouille, fried egg, cheddar, arugula & aioli.   I want to go back very soon... so many things sound like I need to try them.

This place is unanimously beloved by my friends and I. If I ever have friends visiting from out of town, I always take them here for great drinks and delicious food. My go-to drink is Whisky Sour and my go-to food item is the Little Birdy- MUST TRY! Either the Litte Birdy, or the Big Jim if you are extra hungry.

I saw this place a few times passing by, but never thought to stop by until I saw it on Check, Please Arizona. I went out with family to give it a taste. We shared a No Way Jos burger, beignets with local honey and powdered sugar, and a biscuit with preserves and goat cheese.  Let me tell you first of all: if you come here complaining about the wait, just remember that good food AIN'T fast food. Be patient and your patience will be rewarded! Every morsel of that food was delicious. The biscuit reminded me of breakfast at Grandma's house. That burger was juicy and full of flavor; even the bread was good. The beignets were warm,  crispy, chewy, and paired well with the local honey; finger-lickin good.  That was a good little taste, but I definitely wanna come back and try some more.  Get the ginger beer, you won't be sorry!

This place is darling. The patio is gorgeous with lots of comfy, welcoming, and uplifting touches. The service is always upbeat, fun, and inviting and the food... holy moly. I'll gladly gain a few pounds for you Welcome Diner.   If you want to go somewhere different, escape this silly life for a moment, and enjoy a delicious beverage I highly recommend you stroll over to this diner, order yourself a "Hurricane" and find a seat on the patio where you can relax while the desert sun sets. In fact, I just might head over there all by my onsies tonight. Yes, I'm going to drink alone. I'm ok with it.   Everything I've ever ordered off their menu has been delicious. They have lots of southern food options and they change up their specials menu about once a week. Anything you order will be divine. I promise you. Don't question me, I have the pounds to prove it.

Probably one of the neatest places I've been to, from food to atmosphere! Been here several times with friends and my fianc, and we haven't been disappointed. My go-to item on the menu has been the fried green tomato sandwich (a waiter suggested I added bacon to make it a BLT, and I LOVE it)! Crispy bread, zesty corn relish... it's awesome!  Last night, we tried a new menu item: the jambalaya.  I've been to New Orleans a few times and tried cajun restaurants across Phoenix (unfortunately, few can get those flavor profiles right). But this jambalaya? Damn! I think cajun-foodies will be extremely pleased! The taste is like homemade New Orleans cooking, yet the dish is still unique. It's a lil smokey, a lil spicy, and super flavorful. I hope they keep it on the menu, because I'll be coming back for more!

Amidst a dusty, but up and coming neighborhood, there's a corner of red paint and light which is Welcome Diner. Love the quaintness and the neighborhood feel (I'm worried they will lose some of their charm when they move locations). Arrived on a Saturday night and there was such limited seating; the place was packed! Ordered their arugula and watermelon salad: fresh and tasty, but honestly, not worth the hype. Also tried the "Koko" and the "Carol". The Koko is a fried chicken sandwich with a chipotle ranch sauce-good and a bit spicy! The Carol was better; pulled pork topped with somewhat spicy coleslaw--this dish was a great, complexity of flavors that melded well together. Will have to return to try more of their dishes!

Love the biscuts, love the bacon, love the people & of course love the hurricane. Welcome diner has a kicked back attitude & comfort food that's oh so yummy in my tummy. My only wish for summer is that they had more indoor seating. I'm looking forward to the rumored slip n slide though. Can't wait to get back again. Thanks Welcome Diner!

I love this place and am proud to support their business. I feel the love and hard work they put into everything they do when I eat there; it comes through in the consistent and soul-satisfying food because of they people they hire and continue to empower. So proud to have this little, amazing place representing the culinary culture in Phoenix and Arizona.
Good Food, fun atmosphere. Happy Hour is great, Love to come here late at night
Definitely my favorite diner in AZ. Such a friendly staff! And the Hurricanes... BEST DRINK omg! This place is a must if you are in the neighborhood!

Came here at the end of a First Friday, and it was worth the wait in line. Fun atmosphere and delicious food. Jack fruit fries and Mac&Cheese were great. The guy taking my order was super nice. I was stuck between the Mac&Cheese and the brussel sprouts, and he informed me that he could request the kitchen folk to mix the brussel sprouts into the Mac&Cheese. I went with that, and it was heavenly. Would definitely return and bring others with me.
