I love food, and this is my favorite food in the Valley.   Always fresh, with creative salad options and the BEST vegetarian options.   They make some "Pulled Jackfruit Fries" which are bomb. They cook the jackfruit the same way they cook their pulled pork... beer marinated and what not. It's totally divine.   The late-night hours are great and the outdoor seating lets me take advantage of one of my favorite things about living here - the cool Phoenix nights. So in to it.

Part of the charm of this place is that it is in a poor residential neighborhood in downtown Phoenix, not far from 7th St.  Also, you could easily drive by and not even notice it exists.  So charming and the loveliest of dives you will ever visit (or shizzhoels as I call them).  Now, about the food and experience.  When you walk inside there is only about 8 or so counter seats in what looks like a converted studio home/living room.  The feeling when you walk in however, is that someone beamed you into the 1950's.  Authentic and totally retro.  Now, the best for last... the food is not your typical diner food.  Much more creative and original than any diner I have ever been to.  And being from NY I KNOW diners!  Practically grew up in them.  This diner, while having a VERY limited menu (when compared to any NY diner), each and every dish is incredible.  Try the Big Jim!  It will wow you... Fried Chicken breast  with cheddar, bacon, homemade biscuit buns and gravy.  Wowah!  (Oh, and definitely not the dish or the place to be if you wanna eat healthy!  More the once in a blue moon calorie splurge place... at least for me.)  Oh and order off the menu the "Cannibal Fries".  Simply off the chain.  Fresh cut potato fries with caramelized onions, cheddar and homemade russian dressing.  (Deep Breath!)

Not too many diners get good reviews but this was a well deserved. Happy friendly staff.   Locale is not the best but the food makes up for it.   This was right of the plane and hungry place- good choice. They have a bloody merryish beer drink. Interesting!

When I got the directions to this place I was certain I had been led astray because I was going into a residential part of the city. Low and behold the diner was there, random in the middle of this Phoenix neighborhood. There are a few seats inside but the real experience is to sit out front. Do not expect to sit down at a normal booth and keep to yourself. The seating is basically lawn furniture and a few picnic tables giving the whole experience a backyard barbeque feel. As far as atmosphere "hipster" would be the greatest understatement of the year. I could have ridden a bicycle made of mustaches wearing the first black rimmed glasses ever made and I would not have been hip enough among the patrons. The menu is small but efficient and the food we received tasted great. I recommend the fried chicken sandwich with bacon and a hurricane to drink.
solid solid burger and solid fries! the place is awkward but fun! the people are great and well nothing to complain about. price was good too, plenty of parking as well!

Found out about this place via a Yelp email that was advertising places in my area. After checking out the reviews and the menu, my wife and I decided to grab a late dinner here on a Friday night. As soon as we arrived I noticed this place just had an awesome vibe to it. Friendly staff, laid back patio seating, and the food is beyond amazing. We had the Fried Green Tomato sandwich, Little Birdy fried chicken biscuit, Fries, and a glass bottle Coke (the kind sweetened with real sugar).   In a nutshell: Love this place. We'll be going back again and again.
Excellent burgers and house made ginger ale.  Dinner came along with entertainment - police raid next door.

Me and my boyfriend just tried Welcome Diner the other night, we wanted to go to a place that both of us have never been too. It was an awesome choice! It may not look like much from the street but you definitely have to give it a try.   We both had burgers and an appetizer and all the food was great and prepared well. It is nice to go to a place that focuses on buying local food and contributing the the community.   I would recommend this place to everyone and anyone.

Came here for a late dinner and absolutely loved their food. I got the Big Jim (fried chicken on a biscuit with gravy and bacon), added an egg and split some of their pulled pork fries. It was excellent. I would highly recommend.   I've also been to their sister location, welcome chicken + donuts. I have to say I enjoy their fare here much more.   The location has odd hours, 5pm-2am and is strictly outside patio seating on a sandy yard in the arts suburbs in downtown Phoenix. It's got an incredibly hipster vibe to it which may or may not be your cup of tea. The friend I was with described it as "A bunch of stoners setting up shop in a run down house making really good food". His assessment may or may not reflect my own.   I wouldn't go before 9pm personally unless the temp is under 90 degrees because of the seating and how heavy the food is. But this is definitely one of the best fried chicken and biscuits I've had in Phoenix so I definitely recommend checking this place out when the weather is nice.

Like everyone else, I loved this place. There's qualifiers as to why we liked it so much,so hold your horses and read on.   We shared the chicken honey mustard biscuit. I thought it was good but would try something else next time. My husband ordered beignets. They were good and the closest thing to NOLA I've had outside of the real thing. I probably would've liked them more if the honey was served on the side instead of under the beignet.   Before you think I'm crazy, trust me on this-the Brussels sprouts were awesome! They're not your mamas Brussels sprouts! My husband, not a big fan typically, thought they were great too. Every meal since then when we discuss what veggie to have with our home meals I ask for Brussel sprouts. Not any but THEIRS. I could probably go vegetarian on these things. Flat out YUMMY!  5 stars for just the brussel sprouts? While they deserved it, the 5 stars comes because it's a seriously cool business. Everyone who works there is incredibly friendly.   Basically it's a bunch of really cute guys, most in bands, who not only have great personalities but they are awesome cooks. They are very aware of local (when possible), quality, natural/organic (when possible) food and are creative with their dishes. I'll be back and I'm bringing some GFs next time. ;-)

First time in after eying this spit for months. Was absolutely CRAVING a burger and I have not found a decent burger in PHX in the year I've lived here. And I've tried them all...  The Champion is just that, super juicy & flavorful & cooked to perfection. This is my pick for the BEST BURGER IN PHOENIX HANDS DOWN. This is where you go when you actually appreciate a good burger, and by good burger I mean; medium rare, savory, and not overloaded with toppings like hopdoddy & zinburger... the focus is on the meat & that my friends is how a good burger turns into a great burger. Gtfo with the double well done patties & fancy toppings. Roomate even said it was better than Gordan Ramsays. Cannot wait to try the poutine & the biscuit sammys
This little diner is so beautiful at night. Love the service and the food here!
some of the best food in downtown phoenix hands down & fantastic customer service!! i love the consistency of this place, and i constantly crave the pulled pork fries. keep up the good work! :)
This place is awesome! It totally remind me of hole in wall joint in San Diego. The vibe is great and the food is amazing. You know it's a great place to eat when the line is hitting the street.

This place is really good. Everything I have had which is a huge variety of things has honestly been delicious and amazing. Their jackfruit is especially good. But really all of it is good. The catfish, the chicken, anything. Super good!! Their drinks are on point too.

I've never had anything here that wasn't amazing. If you want a burger, there's is by far the best. You can't go wrong with any options. Vegetarians (and carnivores) will love the Jackfruit. Plus it's got a laid back atmosphere that's perfect when you want a low key dinner without compromising for low quality food.

The atmosphere was amazing here.  We ordered our food from the food stand area, which felt a little weird at first, but we quickly got used to that, as when the food came out it came fast and high quality.  Then we got a free piece of pie! Shit was yummy!!

A true hidden gem , in the middle of a neighborhood in downtown Phoenix . My boyfriend and I have been here now let's say 7xs and I'm shame to say I'm finally writing a quick review. There food is delicious and fresh. Check out my pictures I definitely recommend this outdoor diner to everyone you won't regret it. My favorite is the koko; crispy moist fried chicken in between delicious biscuits with a spicy cream sauce and fresh tomato and arugula with a side of sweet watermelon !
By time my food arrives my friends are done eating wack services . I was the first one to order too lol had get my money back
Can't give this place enough stars. Granted I live two blocks away so I usually get food togo. The food is always phenomenal!

If know about the Welcome Diner, chances are you've heard about it by word of mouth or just stumbled across it by chance. Regardless, this place is one of my favorite places to eat in Phoenix. Everything in the place feel like you stepped into David Lynch's mind while having happy thoughts. The place is super small (8 seats) but that just adds to the authenticity of eating in what might one day be a museum piece of 1950's culture.  The food is incredibly good and surprisingly cheap. If it's the right day, be sure to see if they're making veggie burgers and ask for a float too. The staff is also really chill and make sure that you're satisfied. They offer everything: good food, good atmosphere, and a good experience.  I just wish they had later hours....

Today has been a downtown hipster kind of day. This was my first time eating here.   Prepare yourself to be outside, the seats are limited so pretend like you're on a cruise. Sit with strangers and make a new friend.  I got the beignets, I'm practicing for my trip to New Orleans, which were super YUMMY. I also got the poultine fries but because of the wait, my friend waited about 30 min for the Bumblebee, the fries came slightly cold.  The people were great and I made new friends. The staff was friendly and apologetic about the wait for our food.  I probably won't come back

What's better than a night of drinking than jackfruit fries and peanut butter on your burger? But for real, late night or even just a casual evening, welcome diner delivers amazing burgers and fried chicken sandwiches with a chill and cozy outdoor patio or a small diner feel inside. A favorite spot for sure

You just landed at the Phoenix airport.  The desert sun is beating down your neck, you're feeling hungry, and all of a sudden, your stomach starts growling!  Well, thanks to yelp, good food isn't too far from the airport.    3.1 miles away from the airport is a piece of heaven called Welcome Diner.  So don't be confused that you are driving in the middle of a residential area, and bam, you see this red and white building and bright red umbrellas everywhere!  Next to the building is another bright red object (aka the fence), but this time it's a red painting of a little boy eating what looks like bread.  I'm a bit confused but I'm already getting a good vibe from this place!  So now unto the food.  Mini-me is a sucker for orange juice, and luckily they had freshly squeezed OJ.  This is a minor detail for some folks, but I'm a sucker for freshly squeezed OJ.  I had the holy puerco, and it was sinfully fantastic.  Imagine a layer of sliced polenta, a layer of carnitas, and then a layer of eggs over medium, and finally it's sprinkled with crunchy chicharones.  Yes, it was a stack of deliciousness!  The hubby had the burger with a bacon jam, and I think he enjoyed it since he had no crumbs left at the end of the meal.  Honestly, I was so pleased with my holy puerco that I ignored the entire family.      Phoenix peeps, check this place out.  Don't forget to check out their daily specials and drinks and desserts.  I will definitely stop by the next time I'm in PHX.
Super good. Took a midnight trip to flavor town. This place is always really good with a fun environment.

Too little food for the price. Not really worth it. I wouldn't recommend the biscuit cause it split so easily that I don't think it's good with fried chicken ( I got Bumblebee) . But it's just my opinion. PB&B was good but still a bit too pricey for the amount we got.

Love love love this place!! I've been here for brunch and dinner and everything was amazing!! My bf says their burger is the best burger he has ever had and I have to agree. Super juicy!! The bumblebee is on point too!! I can't wait to go back and try the bacon cheddar fries :) I recommend this place to all my friends when they ask for a awesome place to eat downtown. And they are open late!!!

This is probably my favorite place to grab a casual dinner in Phoenix.  It is usually pretty busy on the weekends so be prepared to wait a while unless you can find a spot at the 8-10 seats inside.  Unless you are a veg I expect you to try the fries smothered in pork and slaw.  Hands down the best thing I've had there to date.  The PB&B burger is great and so is the Bumble Bee biscuit.  If you live in the downtown area or you hit up RoRo often, stop into this gem of a diner.  The staff is really hip and really friendly.

I can't stand 50's retro but this place is the cuteness. Well...I haven't technically been inside. Now, I knew this was a hipster hangout, but I wasn't expecting the cute girl in the apron or the boy with tattoos to actually be working on the other side of that window. They didn't seem to mind that I was slightly drenched in sweat having walked there under the sun of a blazing March afternoon. They were quite nice and gave my sister and I a bowl of water for our doggies. Tattoo boy said he would even make us more fries if we wanted. The fries ($2) were not the best  and neither was my grilled cheese ($4) with tomato (yum!) and pickles (?). However, the food had a nice home-made quality to it and was all ready in about a minute. Peeps are right about the high-quality ingredients and the food is inexpensive. Holler.  P.S. Don't forget the Ca$hM0nayyy or to borrow from a sibling!

I love the food here. This is one of my favorite places in Phoenix. I've been here multiple times and it has never failed. My favorite is still the "Big Jim". Biscuit, gravy, bacon and a big-o piece of chicken. Fire!!! Today I had a mixed drink too and are always on point. Old fashion, whiskey sour and the Palomas are a must try. Over all good experience and will always recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and good service.

Absolutely delightful. The overall set up is slightly small but it gives it a homey feel. The cocktails were to die for. Love the homemade tonic. I enjoyed the Paloma and The Last Word. We sat at the bar top inside since it was so crowded, and it was awesome to watch the chefs and staff work. Whole team seemed extremely stoked to serve us and be at work which is always a positive. This was last Saturday btw, and there was a line out the door.   I got the Honeybee sandwich and the Brussels sprouts. I tried my friend's jackfruit Po Boy and regular Po Boy. The food was perfect. The exact right amount of home style food with a bit of a twist.   My friends and I also shared a bottle of Provisioner white. We sell it at my work for $12 and I was pleased that they sold it by the bottle for $15. Paired deliciously with the food.   I will definitely be back on Tuesday for all night happy hour. Being in the industry, it's hard to find a spot with amazing drinks and food late, but Welcome Diner pleasantly surprised me!

Oh my very favorite!  Poutine! Not at all like the traditional, but oh-so-good and imo, so much better! Sandwiches served on biscuits?!? Heaven! I only wish this place was open for breakfast.  Oh yes, and service? Top notch!

In every good television show, the characters have a local eatery where the ambiance is prime and the characters seem so at ease.   Well, if my life ends up being like The Truman Show, I could see Welcome Diner being that place.   The location and diner evoke an old-school sense of belonging. You feel like you're part of a real community when you sit outside (even in the 100+ degree weather) sipping on a great cocktail amongst old houses and the typical noises of a neighborhood.  The food is a perfect harmony of fresh culinary vision and traditional greasy spoon deliciousness.  So, get here soon; I am sure you'll feel welcomed too.

I love the vibe and location of this place!  Nestled within a neighborhood in downtown Phoenix, outside patio dining (there's never any room in the small trailer, whenever I've eaten here), and a great view of the stars are just some of the great aspects of this particular diner.  It's definitely a departure from the typical dingy diner, that has mostly artificial lighting; and is surrounded by hipster patrons.  No, wait! Hold on a sec!   Except of the latter comment; it truly is a breath of fresh air - literally!  The food isn't spectacular, but that isn't the allure of this place. It's just an awesome place to hangout, and enjoy a decent meal. This particular time, we had the Welcome Burger and Fries; as well as, Grilled Cheese and Watermelon with a side of Jackfruit fries.  Definitely a unique meal with an allure all its own. Particular notables were the juicy hamburger, crispy bacon, yummy jackfruit fries, and the sweet watermelon!  The weather outside was just perfect, and everyone working here were so friendly and chill.  The place is definitely "on fleek!"   There, that's my first and final homage to the urban hipsters that were seated next to us that basically used nothing but words found in the hipster vernacular dictionary.  Nonetheless, I love this place!

We hadn't been to Welcome Diner since they stopped being a breakfast/lunch spot...so who knows how long ago that was!  I enjoyed the second generation cocktail - vodka, fresh grapefruit and lime juice, passion fruit and mint...well mixed and so tasty!  I also had a little birdy biscuit with fried chicken and cheddar and a side of roasted brussels sprouts...the serving size was so large I ended up taking half of my meal home.  Definitely get their early so you can get a seat at the counter inside...it is totally worth it!

Went on late night and had THE MOST AMAZING BISCUIT AND CHICKEN. Do yourself a favor a visit this place.  It's super hipster and people are really nice.  That all being said,  the poutine fries were weird.  It was fries with white gravy.  Not at all what I thought I was going to be getting when ordering poutine.

Walk up window to order, patio tables to eat.  Service was great, the guy at the window introduced himself, welcomed us and then made some great recommendations both on and off the menu.  Food came out quickly and was delicious!  -PB&B Burger Med-rare was fantastic (tip: you can upgrade the side to poutine for $3(off menu))  -Big Jim was Very Good, gravy was great but the biscuit was a little dry. Still very good though. -Poutine was fantastic!! Hands down Fantastic!! -Mac & Cheese side was good, but I feel like it really could have been better. It was a very classic dish and didn't have the flair of the rest of their menu. -Ginger Beer is homemade and is VERY GOOD, strong, tart, good.  A few reasons for the missing star: 1 the chairs, I had to swap out a broken chair and then sat in another one that had a bent leg that almost broke before I traded it in too. 2 the dry biscuit on the Big Jim.
Breakfast here is awesome. Who cares if it is hot outside, you won't be able to focus on anything else besides the incredible food.

Delicious. The food is bomb. It's tiny but you can make friends. I throughly recommend the big Jim. The chicken is the best. The greens are traditional and great. I bring everyone here to eat. Do yourself a favor and get in here.

This place is the Real McCoy!!! Most items are made in house and you can tell when you eat their food. The fried chicken that comes in any of their chicken n biscuit sandos is on par w the best Ive had anywhere. Its white meat but soooooo moist w perfectly crunchy breading. It is served w their biscuit that matches up w some of the best Ive had,  even in the Carolinas.  We also had the poutine, the PBB burger, the grilled cheese, mac&cheese (you can choose toppings; we had brussel sprouts and confit tomato), and the beignets(served in a dish of honey and powdered sugar). They were all outstanding you can taste the love thats put into making this food.  Its picnic/family style seating in an outdoor patio that lights up nicely at night. If youre travelling to this place to eat, we already have something in common so i dont mind sitting w strangers.

The Korean BBQ sauce chicken, always get the breast and whatever bacon donut is available, paired with a cold brew for an amazing lunch! It's been quite a while since I've been, will have to come back and make sure everything is as it was; delicious.

I've been here before but missed the point. Who would've thought a truck stop -looking place with po' boys and fried green tomatoes would serve organic veggies, grass fed beef burgers, free range organic chicken?  All well disguised as post-soul food.  Wow. Gin and tonic made with their homemade lemongrass infused soda water-- oh yes

The only bad thing about Welcome Diner is that I always crave it on Mondays when they are closed! This is our go-to late night spot when we need some comfort food. But Welcome takes comfort food to another level. They use local QUALITY ingredients and I am a firm believer that this makes ALL the difference in food. We have tried lots of things on their menu: all of their biscuits and gravy. The Big Jim with fried chicken is my favorite. ALWAYS add a fried egg. Burgers. Poutine. The shredded pork fries and jackfruit meat vegan fries. We've tried a number of their specials. I ALWAYS get an order of their brussel sprouts. Beignets. I have never ever been disappointed here. Thank you for being you, Welcome Diner.

We met our daughter and her wife on the patio on a beautiful January night. The actual restaurant is very small, but plenty of space outside. Great vibe, very community oriented. Not a huge beer selection, but had a number of good craft beers available, and wine and some interesting sounding mixed drinks. The burgers we ordered were excellent. Everything on the menu sounded great. Looking forward to our next visit to try something different. Maybe one of the Jack fruit entrees.

The Big Jim is right! I was recommended by the staff and the locals. Specially made biscuit, smothered cheddar cheese, lots of crunchy bacon and a big slab of fried chicken with lots of gravy!!! To top it off with refreshing watermelon to cleanse your palate!

If they had a better seating situation (for AZ) and to go containers for drinks, they would get a 5....and maybe if they were open at lunch. But either way, if you don't mind sitting outside and waiting until diner it's more than worth a trip! My fav is the champion!
Best place in phx! I love the jack fruit sandwich! It's a fun atmosphere with great people.

I was in Phoenix last week looking for a cool place to eat and decided to try Welcome Diner based on the other reviews.  I was not disappointed!  It was an amazing experience!  It is in the middle of a residential area but they have a lot of property and plenty of seating for guests outdoors.  We were fortunate to be able to sit inside.  They have 9 bar seats inside the "trailer".    The menu offers lots of delicious options - Waldorf Salad, Poutine, Fried Chicken on a biscuit, Fried Green tomato sandwich, fish, burgers, etc. and during happy hour, they offer reduced prices on some menu items!  Everything is made-to-order and if you are inside, you can see your meal being made.  They also have unique drink options and they are very tasty!!    The staff are really upbeat and friendly.  We got to chat with one of the guys who worked there.  He seemed really nice and genuinely cared about each guest's experience.  It is a really cool place.

Great food, great drinks, great price, and great service. The patio is fun and people watching the neighbors as they walk by just adds to the uniqueness of this food truck turned restaurant. What more do you need?

What a treat! The Welcome Diner really encompasses the Downtown Phoenix "feel". They had the actual old, historic diner building shipped from the east coast, completely renovated, and plopped right in Downtown!  Come here for the righteous chicken sandwiches and greasy burgers! A PBR will sweeten the deal, if the laid back, back-yard ambiance doesn't do it for ya.

Amazing, been twice and would go every week if I lived downtown. The food is incredible, the environment is chill, and the proprietors are super friendly. It's only open Sun.-Tuesday and will close for good 4th of July. Go while you can!!

My kids and I love this place! The chicken biscuits are out of this world. So far I have tried the Captain Fantasy (talk about a kick) and the Bumble Bee (made with locally sourced honey) both have been fantastic. I have also had the Carol which is Kilt Lifter braised pulled pork on a biscuit, smoked in the back of course.   The service has always been really friendly. The atmosphere is really laid back.  You will want to eat outside, as the inside is really small.  Pretty much the opposite of the Tardis (a little geek joke, nod if you get it).  My Step son recently got one of their burgers, and he said it was one of the best burgers he has ever had.  Definitely on my list to try soon.  All in all, its a place you have to try. You will not be disappointed in any way. oh did I mention that they are locally owned and locally sourced? So not only can you get good food, but feel good about it to.

Let me cut to the chase: the flavors here are absolutely superb. If you're looking for robust and full-bodied comforting flavors with original pairings at a budget-friendly rate: this is a fantastic choice. I'm in love with this location and their menu and I've barely made a ding in their menu! As an undying sweets foodie, I tried two of their desserts first: the tepary bean spiced custard pie with cornmeal crust and a hibiscus whip, and a salted bourbon caramel chocolate chip pecan pie slice.   ...there's a reason why I don't have photos. I went in for a sample and couldn't stop! I ate both slices in the time it takes to breathe two breaths and they were stunningly good!! The salted caramel chocolate chip pecan pie was really the standout if you like thick, decadent, heavy flavors (so for many, consider sharing with a loved one!) The tepary bean spiced custard pie reminded me a lot of a version of pumpkin pie with both texture and flavor...which has everything to do with the "spiced" component of the pie. There was also included a hibiscus whip which actually separated and added a sweet essence that enhanced the flavor and separated the textures of the slice. Definitely something unique and try-worthy, but maybe not a repeat buy (it isn't for me).  Cons: parking is difficult and all street oriented, and the hours...this is definitely not a location good for pick-up around end-of-work day, it's a commitment to an evening at the restaurant type of place. Heads up of menu changes: sometimes they are last minute (via Instagram posting) and shortly lived (don't always plan on offerings being available multiple days in a row)...for someone driving from Peoria, I appreciate a greater heads up so I can adjust my schedule to drive down for the exciting eats...  Will I be back? Very likely and next time I'm hoping to dig into some savory plates! (Pb&j burger, I got my eye on you!)

Do you love good food? Duh. Do you love good drinks? Of course. Do you love good people? Who doesn't?! If you've answered yes to any of these questions (and we both know you did), you need to get down to The Welcome Diner. The cozy quarters and kitchy decor make it easy to fall in love with, and the staff makes you comfortable enough to stay for hours. AND THE FOOD! I have yet to try something that didn't make me smile. It's hard to pick a favorite dish but personally, I love the Kiltlifter braised pork biscuit. The carolina mustard sauce that's made in house, is probably the best thing I've ever tasted. And the made from scratch biscuit it comes with, is too good for words.  Beyond a fantastic, locally driven food concept, they also make one of the greatest cocktails I've ever enjoyed; the Hurricane. And even though you clearly hear the bell dinging from the kitchen and everyone inside scream, "HURRICANE!" each time you order one, you just can't seem to figure out how you got so tipsy; they're sneaky little guys.  So, next time you're out and about downtown Phoenix on a weekend, you should go say hi, and then eat your face off. You'll be glad you did.
I have eaten almost everything on the menu at least twice I think.  Bloody Mary, hurricanes are well done and there is a good beer selection. High quality food in a relaxed setting.

I'm not a hipster but I still fell in love with ambience of this place. They have a bigger outside dining area than the inside. My go to is pulled pork fries and chicken and biscuit. They have a sweet HH deal too!

I received an invite from a co-worker to meet here for dinner and had no idea what to expect. Having "Diner" in the name is misleading. It is an old diner and has lots of character. But the name is more appropriate if it references the patrons.  The food is amazing and creative. I am not the kind of person who seeks out locally sourced anything, but it really sets this place apart! They make their own ginger beer for crying out loud...  If you're near downtown and not afraid to go a little off the beaten path, you will not be disappointed!

Staff were super friendly, the decor was kitsch & cute but the rest of the experience was underwhelming. I don't understand the hype.  Drinks were standard but the food was bland. Deeply offended that their idea of poutine includes melted cheddar over fries - nope... Just nope. Curds or bust. The watermelon in my salad was unripe and left much to be desired. Burger fell apart and was an absolute mess.  Gave this place a second shot and it fell short again. Disappointing.

everyone employee was super personable. very nice, very laid back. great drinks, great food. dinner for 2 was like $30 + tip. my partner and i are new to the area. we felt very welcomed here at the welcome diner!

Absolutely love every single food item I have ordered. Delicious PB burger, Pork fries and "Big Jim." The wait for food is very slow, so make sure you have time but it's just a part of the casual atmosphere.
Went there again today with family from OOT, they loved the food and the atmosphere. Just a fun, cool place, come on down.

Awesome atmosphere! This place has such a weird/ funky vibe with its red and white diner, mismatched patio furniture, and staff running around yelling out customer names. Each time I have come the food has been great but the wait is usually long. As expected, I stood in line for a while last night to place my order. Occasionally, the person taking orders will slide the window closed and the line will have to wait. While this seems a bit annoying, it gives the cooks time to catch up and the staff time to get hot food delivered to tables.  Upon his return, the guy at the window was upbeat, kind, and open to offer suggestions. The food took a bit under 10 minutes to come out but was VERY good and obviously fresh. We had a salad and the Koko chicken sandwich with a side of brussel sprouts. I would definitely recommend this place as long as you have time to hang out!
Awesome! Mac n cheese with bacon was insane!  Couldn't believe how much bacon they put in it.  Portions are huge!  Had to wrap most of it to go.
"If it's savory, throw an egg on it." -Guy w/ the galaxy hat. Also I highly recommend trying the Kentucky Thorough Bred drink #Superb

Favorite place in the valley. Hands down. I really wish they were closer to where I live so I could indulge more. I'm a total weirdo and LOVED their PB&J burger. It satisfied every pregnancy craving I could imagine. After I had my baby I enjoyed their wonderfully strong hurricane...so good! This place is best to be enjoyed on a hot monsoon night! Sticky air with the smell of rain and an ice cold hurricane..so much yes.
Absolutely love this place. Great vibe, phenomenal food, vegan friendly, amazing burgers, good beers.

I live one block away. I've been going there for years now. There's a reason why they are always busy. The food is always delicious the wait staff is courteous and everything you would expect them to be. I would recommend this hidden gem to anyone.

Got in late on a flight and was famished. It was either the Welcome Diner or a fast food joint. This place was amazing! So many awesome dishes to choose from biscuits to burgers to the specials of the day. Definitely a place to frequent - you won't be disappointed.
Best ginger beer in town!!! Food is all incredible.  Try the whole menu. Always fun to sit inside.  Hurricanes are delicious and I vote it best place to be on new year's eve!

OH MY GOSH  we've been meaning to go here for a few years now and honestly I'm sad we've waited this long. The Welcome is super casual, a little hidden gem in down town Phoenix. There is bar style seating inside but we chose to sit outside, we got there at 7:30 and our wait was super short ! By the time we left, crowds were picking up, and it gets busy fast !! We shared poutine fries ( which were so yum ) my husband had the jambalaya ( talk about flavor town) and I had the Big Jim biscuit which was incredible. I had a drink and my husband had a beer. The food was so fresh and from scratch, and made with lots of love.  We want to come back and brings lots of friends to enjoy the easy going atmosphere.

I've never actually eaten here, but this place is the best because once a year they put on a local 24 hour movie festival where they challenge local film makers to go out and make a movie in 24 hours. The have to use a line of the organizer choosing the script as well as a prop of some kind. It's so much fun when they have the viewing and awards party the following weekend. I highly recommend this place.
Delish Bumblebee  and  Big Jim biscuit and the Hurricane, YUM!!!  Such a cute atmosphere.  Great part of our trip to Phoenix.

Don't really see what all of the buzz is about. Decent atmosphere, but the menu items are majorly overpriced in light of the quality on the day of my visit. Plain biscuit was $4 and about the same quality as a Waffle House biscuit that sells for 1/3 of that.

First time here and I have no problem giving them five stars.   We had wonderful service provided by Mikey and Drea.  Clayton was the chef and man can he cook. Wonderful food, fun and personality.  Highly recommend the big Jim!

The food is outstanding. I saw this place on the local news TV station. And wanted to try it out. I went with my sister. It's located in the middle of a residential neighborhood. It's a quirky place with outdoor seating only. The small building looks like a diner. The employees were really pleasant and helpful. I ordered the Big Jim, my sister had the Fried Green Tomatoe Sandwich. We had fries on the side. The fries and dip that went with them were fantastic. Something in the dip gave it a tangy flavor. The fries were nice and crisp. As soon as I bit into the Big Jim, I thought how heavenly it was. The chicken was so tender and juicy. The combination of fried chicken , bacon, and gravy on a biscuit was fulfilling and scrumptious. The Big Jim was almost too big. I could barely finish it. My sister said her sandwich was fantastic and tasty. I would highly recommend this diner to anyone. My only beef with this place is it doesn't open until 5 pm.
Great comfort food...happy hour Tuesday is awesome.  Go hungry and then don't eat the next day to make up for it.  Pork fries were just awesome.

In the din of a South Central Phoenix neighborhood lies a throwback gem serving up some of the most creatively constructed southern comfort dishes this side of Paula Deen's mint julep soaked dreams. Run by a bunch lads that seem to be the progeny of a hipster-hippy relationship gone incredibly right the place has a great atmosphere and spot on service to match their menu.  A definite must stop when you make your many forays in the increasingly attractive downtown corridor.
A brand new Welcome Diner location where you can actually sit inside during the blistering Phoenix heat! and the women that attend me is too friendly, her name is Ana
Love the old diner feel. This place was absolutely delicious! I had the welcome burger & fries & my bf had the big jim. Both perfection!! I can't wait until next time so I can get the biscuit ;)

Best comfort food in the Valley! Absolutely nothing fancy and the wait is sometimes long, but WELL worth it. I've tried almost everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. Reasonable prices and a friendly hard working staff. Hate to share this and risk more people going but this place deserves every bit of great exposure it can get.

I can't say enough great things about Welcome Diner.  It has my type of feel. I've been a few times and I love bringing guests from out of town here. The counter service outside is outstanding. The guy, I forgot his name, generally works the window and is patient and helpful. He's cool. Like the hip friend that knows about good and drink and can guide you around a really fun menu to get you what you want.  Went with the peanut butter burger, one of the fried chicken biscuit plates and a jackfruit French fry dish that just murdered my expectations.  There's a cool inside spot but it's always full when I get there. I have sitting inside at welcome on my bucket list. The bartender is always entertaining a fun crowd.  Keep opening up fun places and turning around Phoenixs food culture!

To whoever established this place: thank you.  The food is amazing.  And not just for food that is available late at night or compared to other "diner-type" establishments, but truly high-quality dishes that stand on their own.   The outside setup is perfect.   The lighting creates a pleasant and relaxed atmosphere.  This is not a fast food place.  You will have to wait for your order, so don't expect miracles.  Because food this good requires love and attention, which the Welcome Diner provides in abundance.

Wonderful brunch today! I had the Sunrise sandwich and my husband had the Holy Puerco - they were both delicious. I loved the homemade biscuit - light and fluffy and not dry at all. Everyone in the staff is extremely friendly - very positive and relaxing environment. Highly recommend it!

I ordered the Welcome burger with the mac and cheese (highly recommend the mac&cheese!!!!!!) Also had the dessert biscuits with the goat cheese and jam - amazing! Def worth it for my first time in Phoenix.

Wow. WOW. WOWWWWW!   Man. THIS PLACE. Fantastic. Utterly awesome inside and out.   The patio scene here is great. The food is great. The jams are great. The people are great. This is an all around great spot to grab some delicious food. I tried the fish po'boy, the PB burger (name?), and the fries with pulled pork. All were choice. Hell, even the coleslaw is pretty damn tasty. Check this place out, sit back, take it all in (the neighborhood adds a little bit of sketch to the whole thing, but it makes it feel kinda quaint), and get stuffed. Oh, and be sure to put hot sauce on everything.    Jesus, I am still in a food coma...

Hello, I am so glad to be home in Phoenix for a few days!  Of course I stopped @ Welcome Diner my first night. I haven't had a true burger in about six months so.....I splurged with the Champion plus onions and it did not disappoint!!!  Fresh, juicy, with crunchy bacon jam....HEAVEN!  The side of fries was delicious as well....crispy/hot. This place has literally the best burgers in the Phoenix metro area!  If you are here in Phoenix and you eat meat this is the place to get your burger!!!!  If you do not eat meat, this is the place to get your fried green tomatoes sandwich!   this place!     Sent the husband and my daughter to the new digs for some takeout. Old location was definitely an eat there kind of place. The new location is too!  My dinner was yummy, but my family came home with stories of employees that were a little rude or stressed????  I have alway experienced kindness and respect at the old location. So...I am not sure what happened tonight. Plus, the menu has changed a little. Where is the peanut butter burger???  I love you Welcome Diner. Please get it together!!!  I NEED you to be as good or better than the old location!!!!

Not your ordinary diner food , but with a great twist on food and drinks. A culinary find.  They use only the best and freshest local ingredients. Daily salads are a work of art.  Great people serving great food.

Found this AMAZING little Gem while looking for some street art in the Phoenix Art District. A MUST try and MUST visit for good home cooking, we had the Big Jim. Went on Saturday the vibe was super chill , they had a DJ playing a dope mix and all the people super nice. Would come back here for sure my next visit back to PHX

I would like to tell you how terrible the food is here... that way you'll stay the hell away and leave it all to me.   Seriously though, I don't even know how to explain how amazing the food is here. Best biscuit, best gravy, best mac & cheese.  After the person sitting next to me at the counter left, I ate his leftovers right off that dirty plate (not kidding). That's how good it was.
The old Welcome Diner is closed, but it is now (temporarily) inhabited by Chef Payton Curry. Check out the reviews here: http://www.yelp.com/biz/payton-curry-at-welcome-diner-phoenix
fried green tomato sandwich will always have my heart

I really wish that I had never eaten here because I can't stop thinking about it!  I constantly think about the amazing earthy flavor of the peanut butter burger!  And the bbq is the most legit bbq sauce I have had since I moved here from Memphis!  Try this place out before the prices soar and it gets inundated with hipsters and yuppies!

Classic diner food and drinks with a twist. We came here on First Friday to try out something new as we're typically inclined to hit Angel's Trumpet. This place is a true diamond in the rough that you would end up passing by if you didn't know what you were looking for. I got the Chicken Philly which was on special that night. The chicken was perfectly seasoned, the bread was toasty, the peppers and onions were super tasty, and the cheese sauce was on point. Everyone else loved their food as well, apparently the No Way Jose burger is a must order. I had a great cocktail as well to top everything else and 4 others split 2 bottles of wine. Line to get food and to be served was a little slow, but expected on a busier night. And if the prices were a tad cheaper I'd rate this place 5 stars.

Holy shit!! You must eat here!! I live in the Bay Area and I still get cravings for that sandwich with buffalo sauce and blue cheese on it!! Why can't they be here in CA?! And that front porch tho!!! So sunny and warm! The staff and the customers who come here are awsome!

Down home southern style cooking in downtown Phx. The fried green tomato sandwich is a home run. Also recommend the mac n' cheese as a side to share with your friends, it's a large tasty portion. There's a bartender inside that makes great a great old fashioned. The seating is first come first server and there's no table service (unless you sit inside at the bar which seats about 8 people). Have one person wait in line to place your order an another hold down some spots during busy hours.

Meh.  As someone who lives in Louisiana, I'm very Leary of any place that sells "Louisiana" foods. The food lacked seasoning/flavor. Very underwhelming. Atmosphere was nice with pretty lights and outdoor seating. Staff was kind.
There aren't words... Just go. Like... Stop what you're doing and get here. Get chicken or burgers or pork fries... WHO CARES?! It's all so f*ing good!!!!

The Koko Biscuit deserves an award. Whenever we're out in Phoenix, we always have to drop by for a bite.  Many reasons make this place so great and always packed. 1. Their food. They don't serve anything here that isn't noteworthy. They just GET IT. Comfort food with a modern twist and yummy drinks. I'm always in. 2. The atmosphere is very welcoming and homey. Definitely embodies the "Welcome" part in their name. Their dining area inside is tiny. Basically a bar top and that's it. Most of the seating is outdoors, but they made it a cozy spot with the decor. This is quite a nice social/dining spot. 3. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They're very casual as if they're your friends lol. Again, treating you welcomingly with none of that extra restaurant server etiquette.  4. THE KOKO BISCUIT ALONE   Just come. If you're in the area, you might as well. I really wish we had one of these in LA.

I don't know why it took me so long to find this place but I'm so full of regret that I've missed out.  I don't know how they make their fries but I know it's the best fries I've ever had. I also loved the ginger beer that is house made. It really spicy but that's what makes it so delicious. I also had a perfectly cooked burger that was so juicy. The staff are equally quirky  and cool as the menu as I found myself dancing in my seat at the bar.  I will definitely be back and I am so mad I've been here so long and never knew this amazingness was here

Visited Welcome Diner last week during their happy hour and got a few dishes and a couple of drinks. My wife got the fried chicken sandwich and I got the pulled pork fries. Chicken sandwich was really good. Nice texture on the piece of fried chicken and a really fully biscuit. Great job on this sandwich guys. Add a little bit of Crystal hot sauce and that makes it even better. Pulled pork fries were good. The fries are smothered in pulled pork and then dressed with some kind of mustard based sauce which gives it a really nice tang. I think the fries could have been a little more crispy since they have to hold up to so much stuff. Also, the coleslaw on the fries give it an extra layer of texture. I wasn't too crazy about the old fashioned. It was way to sweet for me. Other then that, great food and I will return for that chicken sandwich especially.

Perfect weather this time of year to enjoy this unique little outdoor diner. Good spot for late night eats if you get hungry. As much as I like this little restaurant the food wasn't amazing. With all the great reviews I had higher expectations. Maybe after you've had a few drinks it would be amazing. Completely sober, it would not be something I would go out of my way to visit! Still like this place though.

The Welcome Diner was a difficult place to write a review about and you'll see why in a second. In order to capture my whole experience here, I'll interview myself (not at great detail or this post will be too long). Here it goes: WHAT DID YOU THINK ABOUT THE APPEARANCE OF THIS PLACE? When we pulled up to the restaurant at 9:00pm on Tuesday night, I was somewhat perplexed. There were about 20 people in the "patio," which was comprised of various picnic tables, patio furniture, and what appeared to be a bar table that sat atop the fence that enclosed half the perimeter of the dining area. There was an eclectic mix of people. I noticed people of all ages and walks of life. Included in the mixture were some nurses, kids that looked like they were on probation (one of which was spitting tobacco), and one guy who kept alluding to his belief that he made his living doing stand-up comedy. As I started parking my rental car, I noticed this place is in the middle of a somewhat shady neighborhood. Not too comforting when I had to park a block away and walk past a house with a man smoking some substance on his porch. HOW WAS THE FOOD? The food was awesome! We ordered the Fish Po' Boy, the mac and cheese with chorizo, and the beignets. The sandwich was perfect. The whitefish was grilled nicely and the slaw was great. The mac and cheese was fantastic. I couldn't stop eating it. And the beignets? Those were a good end to a delicious meal. WOULD YOU GO BACK? Well, given the nature of the location and layout of the restaurant, I would typically say no. But the food was so good, I am interested in trying everything else on the menu. I guarantee we will come back. Specifically to try the poutine fries and the Champion burger. And the biscuit sandwiches. And sausage gravy. I would ask more questions of myself but I think I'd end up writing too much about food on the menu I didn't get an opportunity to eat...

I'm one of those Yelpers who passively reads reviews but rarely writes one. I only write reviews when A meal is inexcusably terrible, or when a meal ..... Hold on I have to eat these beignets before I finish my review.... Ok I'm back...... Or when a meal is so delicious that it makes me moan with ecstasy . As you may have guessed, this is a  review inspired by the latter.  I'm usually a silent eater , but I was literally moaning and groaning the entire meal.   Generous portions, very friendly (and cute) staff, and ummmmmm. ..... Secret menu desert selections. I won't even attempt to try to put the meal into words because the description wouldn't do it justice. So just check out the pics below. I was almost hesitant to write this review bc I didn't want more people to come to this place, but these guys deserve all the credit ! Good job Welcome Diner! I am a believer !   Pictured: the big Jim, PB burger, poutine (the one Canadian export I enjoy), and super secret beignets with peanut butter, honey, and raspberry pear preserve.
Delicious food. Small and casually intimate atmosphere with friendly cooks.  Really loved the beet salad!

I am from out of state and was here on yelp looking for a good restaurant. This restaurant came up first on the list. So I decided to go and have dinner.  It was extremely packed! Waited for half hour to give my order. No! I will not give a lower star because they were packed and I had to wait.  I ordered the white fish sandwich, pricey but delicious. Met a young couple. They were extremely nice and allowed me to join them and talk to them. No, this is not Los Angeles, where people are antisocial!  Enough of my rant! Place is awesome, food is tasty, and people and customer were extremely nice!
This place is both fun, hip and cool to be at AND the food is just phenomenal. I can't wait to go back again and again to try everything!!

I tried Welcome Diner after a co-worker recommended it. It's definitely one of my favorite spots to go to now if it's cool out at night or if I'm in the downtown area.  FOOD: I had the Big Jim Fried Chicken Biscuit Sandwich which was heavenly perfect comfort food. Biscuit was perfect and so was everything really. The side of watermelon is unique yet complimenting to most of their dishes. My friend got a side of fries and one of the burgers. I helped destroy the fries, they are seasoned and fantastic, especially with their special dipping sauce! On a second occasion, I tried a Coconut beer they had which sounded weird, but they give tasters and it was actually really good.  SERVER: No server really. Just go up to the window after reviewing the menu and order. They've always been friendly when I've asked questions and after you seat, someone will bring your food and condiments as needed. Pick your beer up at the window, though, the server can't do refills apparently.  HOSTING: No hosting, just sit yourself down outside where most of the seating is at, under the night sky. There is space inside but it's very tiny -- maybe 6-8 people max.  AMBIANCE: Outdoor seating mostly that's fenced off with patio / outdoor style tables. It fits perfectly with the trailer-diner vibe. Also, the string lights above are perfect. Excellent for chilling with friends or for a casual romantic date.  PARKING: I usually park on the East side across the street; There's a Water Mill station with some parking and late at night, that seems to be where other people park as well. Otherwise, down one of the side streets works too.  Albeit a bit of a hipster crowd every time I've gone (to be expected in the Downtown Phoenix area), it's still a pretty awesome neighborhood spot. Love the overall vibe of the place. Reminds me a lot of what they have in New York City -- a small place on the corner amongst a residential area.   Best to come here when it's cooler out at night! I'm only giving 4 stars because it's primarily outdoor seating, which poses a problem if it unexpectedly rains or if it's summertime because even at night, anywhere from May-September it's still 100+ degrees out and can ruin a date night. Otherwise, this is highly recommended as a unique restaurant in Phoenix.

Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful! The ambiance was perfect and the company was even better. I only had a beer, but the staff made it an awesome experience. They were all very knowledgable and took the time to give us a background on the diner and what their thoughts and inspirations were for the Welcome Diner going forward. I am so excited to come back this weekend and try out some of the grub, because it looked and smelled amazing! If you are looking for a cool vibe, amazingly gracious staff and a chill place to have a beer (or 7), you should absolutely check this place out! Congrats guys, you are off to a great start!

There was a little blurb of a review in the Arizona Republic newspaper over the Thanksgiving weekend about the Big Jim Sandwich and the Beignets here. Beignets, you say? Yes please.  I thought it would be a good place to take dear papa for lunch; turns out they open at 5 pm. So we made our way through rush hour traffic from north Phoenix to this "middle of nowhere" place on a Tuesday night. I expected small but I didn't expect teeny tiny. However, the warm and genuinely friendly service- YEP we felt WELCOME - more than made up for the close quarters. Our fish po'boys  and beignets in local honey were SUPERB! Totally worth the adventure.

Had a great meal with the wife and kids. It would have been a great night to sit out on the patio, but we were happy we chose to take up 4 of the 9 seats inside this charming old and very small diner.   The staff were very friendly and we all enjoyed watching their team get the food out of that tiny kitchen. We were made to feel very welcome and in speaking to the staff it was obvious that they had great pride in the restaurant. They passed along some history on the building, formerly from Winslow. We loved the fact that we were sitting in a piece of genuine Americana.   Ordered the andouille corn dogs and pulled pork topped fries for a starter, they were great! The Mac n cheese, burgers and chicken biscuit that followed were also excellent. We washed them down with pumpkin porters and bottled cokes. And the beignets we were served for dessert were equally delicious.   Bottom line. We left stuffed and happy. A very memorable meal produced by a great team. We will be back.
What can I say....you must check it out. Friendly staff, great food and fun outdoor eating area.
Extremely limited menu, extremely limited parking and you must eat outside in 100+ degree weather. We left without ordering.
This place is amazing!  I had the whitefish po-boy and ice tea.  My friends had biscuit sandwiches And a couple cocktails, rave reviews all around!

Probably my new favorite place ever. No seriously   1) I would come here purely because it's such a comfortable atmosphere, this place has an eclectic vibe that makes any person feel comfortable in their own skin  2) I have no words for the service. It's been so long since anyone in a restaurant has treated me like a person, given honest recommendations and put time and effort into their craft.    3) The food is decadent in moderation, creative without being threatening and amazing in my mouth.    The only disclaimer I have is that you need to remember that good things come to those who wait, this place gets really busy and has a tiny prep area and bar but they make it work with grace and expertise. Just enjoy the scenery and your patience will pay off .

What a little gem this place is. I really loved the cozy feel of the place. Mostly outdoor seating or you can eat inside at the bar. The food was amazing and the staff was super friendly! I got the PB & B which turned out to be really good. Who would have thought peanut butter on a burger would taste good , but with the bacon and pickles it all came together very nicely . My fianc got the  Koko which was a fried chicken a homemade biscuit with chipotle sauce and that was also delicious! I definitely will be coming back .

If you avoid the chain restaurants in downtown Phoenix, you won't have a bad meal.  Welcome Diner is no exception.  The burgers are amazing, and they have great cocktails to boot.  I really wish I could get food like this in my hometown.
Great late night spot.  Food is awesome!  Staff is chill and personable.  Drinks are yummy!  Only bummer is the longer ticket times.  BUT it's well worth the wait.  Always coming back to this spot.

I have been here 3 times. 2 times to eat and once I forgot cash. The first time was not great the fryer was down and the fry's sucked.   The 2nd time was a little better. Except the food inspector was there. Normally this is a non-issue but in a diner car that serves 9 you hear and see everything.   We ordered 2 doubles and 1 fry and a bottle of coke. One burger was made incorrectly as they added grilled onions to both. I was feeling generous and did not ask for a new one. (I should have though, I do not care for onions on the burger) The fry's were good, in fact I could have eaten another order.   The cook Andy and the waitress were so frazzled by the inspector they kept forgetting things like opening the bottle of coke, ketchup, other peoples meals, the "regular" got a double when he ordered 2 singles and made sure Andy knew it was 2 singles...  The other "regular" looked as if she rolled out of bed, smoked a J, slapped her over sized headphones and Ipod in her PJ pocket and rode her bike here. She totally dumped her bike in the front, like she owned the place. Andy asked several times for her to move it but pot head didn't get it.   Andy asked the other regular to do something for him discreetly since the city guy was there, not sure what but he was outside for a while.    I like Welcome but with 2 issues in 2 visits I dunno If I will be back.

I think I'm being nice with three stars...but I seriously had high hopes for this place! My friend and I came here so pumped to try this hidden treasure.  Our drinks were on point. I got the Hurricane and my friend got a Whiskey Sour. Then the food came out fast. Maybe too fast.   We both got a burger. One was the one with the jalapeo slaw and the other one with peanut butter. I kid you not, the biggest concern was that the middle of the burger was practically raw. There was no grilled crisp to the burger and even the outside of the burger wasn't very hot at all. I'm hoping they were just busy and this was an off night because that was really disappointing.  To give them the benefit of the doubt, I did order a burger with peanut butter on it and it was the first time I've ever tried something like this but not only did I feel underwhelmed, my friend did also.  To top it off, the bill was over $20 and the food was sub-par. Will I try this place again? Possibly with some liquid courage.
Great food. Great little whole in the neighborhood.  Great people.  Recommend to anyone looking for good food in Phoenix.
Magnificent food , love the Plant based options ! Great service and an even better atmosphere , lots of history in this kitchen and it continues to produce amazing exsperiences and amazing food !

Awesome cool place...great place to hangout at night....I got the burger...medium...was yum toasted bun...the fries a little small but I ate everyone they were so good...cool relaxing place super friendly helping staff...a go to for relaxing hangout

Quaint little place. My hipster friends love it, and I thought it was good, though it didn't quite live up to the hype. I do dig the look and locale, but the was a major bee issue the day I ate there. It was very hard to enjoy the juicy burger they cooked up for me while I was constantly ducking and dodging the damn bees. Though good, I felt it wasn't a lot of bang for my buck. $10 and some change for a burger and a side of hashbrowns (plus they ask for a tip on the tablet from which you order before you get served, which is kinda out of order). I'll still give it a 4 because this little place has heart...and character.

This place is great! Great vibe and food. Had a burger with a jalepeno jam. Wife had a chicken biscuit. Both great. Sat inside at the counter by the swamp cooler and made friendly conversation with the bartender. Nice service. The Last Word cocktail was spot on. Had a delicious custard pie for dessert with an apricot compote. Will be back.

We visited Welcome Diner on a Thursday evening and, in all, had a good experience but I can't say I plan to return. Though on the pricey side, the food was good (I had a BBQ pork plate and my guest a burger) and the menu selection seemed adequate. We sat outside and enjoyed our meals, sipping on hurricanes, while appreciating that Welcome Diner is, for lack of a better explanation, a hipsters diner done absolutely right. The food, the service, the facility...all are within a clear and well executed vision. And while I respect that vision, I think that, for me, it was just too much. Specifically, the outdoor seating is more stylish than properly relaxing as their comfort food is. Sitting at a picnic table or some old outdoor furniture that looks like it just came from the back of an old shed is too hipster for me. I get it. I get the theme. I get the execution. It just doesn't work for me. But I would definitely eat their grub if I were in the area looking for take out.

I've always been more than satisfied every time I eat at Welcome diner except today. I had the Koko and my BF had the no way Jose with a side of fries for take out. Serving was smaller than if we would have had dined in. Chicken was dry. Will make sure to dine in next time instead of getting it to go.

This place was off the hook!! As I say, "hella good"! Like hella gooooooooooooood! I strongly recommend this place especially with a group of friends around sunset to kick back at this chill establishment with cool outdoor lighting and throw back some drinks before your meal.   By the way, if you gotta whizz...prepare to step into an airplane sized bathroom literally right next to the kitchen...so hopefully you will not need to DO anything else there...haha  Great eats tho, everyone in my party loved their dishes. Cheers.  JP@
Still the best place! I had the jackfruit po-boy and it was awesome! also, the dirty beignets were Delish. In fact, I wanted to take a picture but we ate them too fast. Just go.

I have had this place bookmarked forever and ever and was very excited to finally have the opportunity to try it out. As we all know, that can lead to much disappointment but that just was not the case. The food here is as legit as my fellow yelpers have given it credit. For dinner, my wife and I tried to Poutine, the Big Jim, and the PO Boy Sandwich. Here our my thoughts:  Poutine-fries, gravy, and cheese....enough said. The gravy here is amazingly good. My only regret is not having my daughter with me to try it, as she loves a good gravy.   Big Jim-This dish is what one would expect from a five star dish. It was so dang good!!!!!!! Homemade biscuit, gravy, fried chicken, bacon, and cheese. Come on, how could it be better? It couldn't.....this thing was awesome. If you check out my wife's future review, I guarantee she will mention wanting this dish as her last supper. Perfect in every way!!!!  PO Boy- Good dish but not the Big Jim kind of good. My wife liked her sandwich and it was good, but not great. The fish and bread were very fresh. Our only thought, and what do we know, but thinking a dipping sauce of some kind would make this dish so much better. Solid four star item.  Staff here were very outgoing and friendly. The outside seating was comfortable. We were fortunate to have an outside heater near us to keep us cozy.   The diner was all I was hoping it would be and glad I finally had the chance to go. Just wish the hours were more accommodating for their new west valley fans. Will go back for sure if in the area when they are open. A must visit.

This place is not my type of place to dine but a friend invited me so I went. The food was so-so to me. It was crowded and the service was a bit slow. All seating is mostly outside which made for fun people watching.  I would go back again but won't be a first choice.

Out freaking standing.  Great food.  Good service...VERY TIGHT INSIDE...but eh, I like the diner feel.  I had the welcome burger and he cooked it perfectly.  The poutine was delicious.  Very very good find for us.  Burger, Pabst, poutine and beignets.  Wow.
Literally the best Mac and cheese in town. I journey from very far just for that! I'd write more, but I'm too busy eating it right now.

This place is amazing!!!! It is so quaint and delicious. Southern cooking in downtown Phoenix. Everything I have ordered was fantastic. They have the friendliest people that work there. I also feel like I am just eatting at a friends house when I am there.

I love my Mac and cheese with extra sauce and Brussels sprouts and don't forget the second generation. It's phenomenal. For the most part the staff is super inviting and "welcoming". I've only had a couple experiences where I've felt like an inconvenience to them. Definitely not everybody there is like that!
I love this place. All items on the menu are worthy to try them. My favorite one is the Koko (biscuit with fried chicken). The service is a bit slow but they are so sweet and cool that who cares?

Had dinner here last night. Really interesting menu.  I had the Koko, a biscuit with fried chicken with a great chipotle ranch sauce. I loved it and would defiantly get it again. My husband had the burger with bleu cheese and bacon, it was a bit overdone and the bun was burned but he's willing to give it another try.  Shared an order of Mac and cheese...definitely a winner with that recipe, it was delicious.  Ordered the beignets for dessert. They may have been the best I've ever had and that includes the originals from Cafe du Monde in New Orleans.  It's defiantly a young crowd and it gets busy but it was nice to just hang out and enjoy a beautiful warm night. The cocktail list is innovative and they know what they're doing.  Highly recommend.

Every time I stop by the experience exceeds my expectations. The food is quality, unique flavor pairings and the customer service is genuine, groovy and welcoming. When I have guests flying in town this is always my first stop after the airport! Welcome diner is life!
Peanut butter, BBQ and burger. Who knew? Treat yourself to this fun little diner and you will find yourself laughing and talking to the other guests like we did. Great food with a great staff.

It's a cute little trailer/hipster restaurant in Phoenix (walking distance from ASU campus.)   My friend took us here for a late dinner when I was visiting and I'm glad he did.   The cashier was really nice and helpful especially when I asked what she recommended for food/to drink.  I ended up ordering a beer with the Carol which was a biscuit sandwich with pulled pork. It was a really big portion (ended up taking half home). The biscuit was nice and fluffy - a little too thick for me personally. The coleslaw was surprisingly good (I normally don't like it but found myself liking this one). Good place for a quick meal/to hang out outside.

They don't believe in customer service at the Welcome Diner.  Just hipster beards and mediocre cheeseburgers.  Sitting at an 8 top and the food runners can't take an order for us at the table and want us to wait in line?  This place is a hell hole.
Good food! good fun! Shout out to the ladies jumping rope late hours!

Food is great. Brunch is a time I go regularly on the weekends.  Bloody Mary's? Yes please!! Some of the best in town. Dining al fresco?  Yes please!! Picnic benches and people watching. Wonderful southern style grub? Yes please!! Food is GREAT! Just perfectly greasy and flavorful. That's a compliment!!  Service? Excellent, friendly and knowledgeable. Prices....? A tad high, but sooooooooo worth it!!

My family was driving through Phoenix and told me they were stopping here. I was confused at first, as I had never seen this place, and it appeared to be I. A neighborhood. Don't let that fool you, just go.   Everything was delicious. We got various different chicken biscuit sandwiches and burgers. Fries were great. Cole slaw was good, and I don't even like cole slaw. Very heaven food, may die after, but worth it at least once.

Good food, attentive service, great ambiance. Hip but not unwelcoming to middle-agers like me. It was a little more pricey than I was expecting but the food is locally-grown. The "Carolina" BBQ sauce on the pulled pork is mustard-based. Pretty good but not what I (or most people familiar with the typical Carolina red sauce) would have expected. Maybe the mustard-based sauce is more common in SC. Hamburger and lemon meringue pie were yummy. All around pretty good.

I'm so glad I tried this place after a friend recommended it to me. I ordered the Champion burger with fries. The burger was so good. It was perfectly juicy and the bacon jam was JAMMIN!  there is mostly outside seating. When we went the inside seating was all taken. They have really friendly staff, too! I can't wait to come back and try more of the food.

This is a food truck experience but the food truck doesn't move. The ambience is very causal, perhaps a few bar style seating inside and a picnic style outside dining area in a downtown neighborhood. Expect to wait 20 minutes or longer waiting in line to order at the window, it's worth it! We ordered the pulled pork biscuit and the fried chicken biscuit with honey and pickles, Poutine, and beignets. The hurricane(house made fruit punch) was delish! The biscuits are huge, fresh, and the perfect compliment to the fried chicken and pulled pork! The Poutine had the right amount of gravy and cheese and a very nice portion. The beignets were hot, moist, crisp and a great end to the meal. We are looking forward to going back and trying more awesome food, including the burgers that looked very tasty!
Both Welcome restaurants are delightful. It's a little hip, very trendy, and super delicious. It's a little off of the main Roosevelt Row social areas, but is worth making it there. Thumbs up.

The Welcome Diner is truly welcoming. I love sitting indoors at the counter. The drinks are great and of course, the food is da bomb!! Love the chicken/gravy/biscuit sandwich.  Just be ready to be very very full and very satisfied after you're done eating.  Get the Kentucky Thoroughbred drink...so delish and I have the Welcome Diner to thank for turning me onto Four Roses Bourbon again!

I had the chance to get into Welcome Diners new spot on opening night-- Wow! I could not believe how inviting and "Welcome" the new place is! The patio is still comfortable and inviting with that order at the window vibe! I cannot wait to bring my dog to the new place!! Inside they kept the same vibe at the trailer just bigger! The open kitchen concept is fun to sit at the bar and be a part of the action! The low booths are super comfortable and allow you to take it all in-- not to mention a Disco Ball!!! What?!?! So fun!!  On to the best part of 2.0-- THE FOOD!! YUM!! There are still my favorites from 1.0 (the amazing No Way Jose Burger and the Bumblebee!!) BUT NOW There are some new dishes that are too good to pass up: The Pickled Shrimp Toast is a must try!! Light and airy foam on toasted Noble bread-- ummm yes please!!! Seafood etouffee-- the rice was perfectly cooked and had the right amount of acid to balance the whole dish!! Chorizo Meatloaf: if my Nana made meatloaf--this would be it but better! The sauce on this dish is the right balance of flavors to leave an empty plate!! (I would have licked my plate, but people were watching!!) The desserts are just as tasty as before!!  The last mentionable is the cocktail menu!! The classics are still there - Hurricane!! (cheers from across the room) and then there are some new amazing drinks to help you settle into the comfy booths!!  Kudos to the whole Welcome Crew on the new spot!! I am craving another Welcome Diner fix!!!

whenever we are in the area, we love to visit the Welcome Diner. Great Food. Great atmosphere. Some of our favorites are the Mac & Cheese, the sunrise biscuit, cheeseburger and the jambalaya. yum, yum, yum!!
Awesome food, awesome staff, awesome scene! Get the pulled pork fries and fried green tomato sandwich! Don't think twice about this place, go now, go often! Your Chicago friends!

I love this place! Bad for my cholesterol but who gives a damn! The proprietors are very cool, great ambience in "the hood." It puts the soul in soul food; can't wait to hang out there again soon as my Lipitor digests; just cool as it gets in Phoenix

Hipsters unite lol (so many hipster here I thought I was at some basket weaving gathering, or watever they are into now). Anyways place is relaxing and staff are friendly. Food was great and they are open late!

This place couldn't be any cooler if it was renamed "Jules Winfield's Welcome Diner"  People.  Just take a gander at the picture offered here on this page and tell me what would stop you from going there to eat an unbelievably delicious basket of fries and burger, each such perfectly seasoned to compliment one another, its as if this stuff was made from the craftsmanship of a gastronomic grill master.  The burger easily beats out even cult-status places like Delux or In n Out, and their handcut fries are subtly crunchy and salty.  Their salsa burger topping absolutely rocks the block.  And I don't know if their ketchup is made by the Magical Man from Happy Land who lives in a gumdrop house on Lollipop Lane, but something about it slaps a toothy grin on my head.  The picnic tables outside make you feel like you are doing something productive while you gorge yourself.  Like its okay to ingest a thousand calories as long as you are given the impression that you are on a hike or something.  But whatever.  Its all class.  My only beef (Heh.  Pardon the pun.)  is that Welcome Diner is closed on Sundays and that they force me to battle the tweakers at the 7th and Roosevelt Circle K as I spring for a pack of P-funks and a $20 bill due to their 'no cards' policy.  It would also be in my best interest if they started serving micro-brews from Oregon or Happy Land.  That would be right good.

Welcome Diner, there is a reason why you're so loved! The food, its delish!  I had asked the boys to join me many many times at Welcome Diner and each time just poop pooped on the idea, but this time I had them both in the car and they were hungry, so down the street we went and before they knew it I had already parked near WD!    They went kicking and screaming as I lead them to the order line, I shoved menus in there hand and soon the fighting was subsiding, and before I knew it they were already giving their orders....  I went with the Koko. It's a biscuit sandwich that has fried chicken topped with chipotle ranch, arugula and tomato, I bet your thinking this must be a small sandwich, but you would be wrong, the biscuits are almost bun size, they are cut in half and grilled in the middle, they have the perfect texture of a biscuit and hold of a bun, oh and that fried chicken, oh sweet lord, this was a great sandwich!  One ordered the PB&B (Peanut Butter & Burger) it was crunchy peanut butter, B&B pickles, bacon, cheddar on a burger, dude this was delish as well, don't think about it, just order it and try it out, I promise you wont be disappointed.  The other ordered Mac & Cheese, and well I can not personally testify for it I can say it was a hit, before I knew it, the bowl was empty and the kid had a smile.  We also ordered 2 orders of Beignets drizzled in local honey and powder sugar, 2 orders split among 3 gave each of us 2 perfectly fried pieces of dough heaven. This was the perfect way to end a great meal!  The boys are already hitting me up wanting to go again, since it's their area I'm sure we will be back before you know it!

Back in 2005 I came to Welcome Diner and would enjoy really tasty breakfast sandwiches.  I loved the husband/wife team who took care of the customers and made the place pretty darn awesome.  I know in the past few years there've been a few different concepts that hit Welcome Diner... I didn't patronize the place since back in 2005/2006, but went back last night at about 9pm to check it out.  I took some of the pictures that are up on this Yelp review back then when I was DowntownGirl.  With my man and a friend of ours, we stopped over to the same quaint trailer that seemed to be a bit more polished up with a more bold "Welcome Diner" painted on the front, but pretty much looked the same from back when I used to go.  There was a special on the board and they had menus with some eclectic items.  Two of us chose the South Carolina-style pork sandwich on a biscuit and a side of fries while our friend grabbed the peanut butter bacon burger and some Sweet Republic ice cream.   We sat outside instead of in.  We also grabbed some wine and beer.  Local WINES!  So glad to be able to go to an establishment in downtown Phoenix where they offer local wine.   We got our food after a short wait and dove in.  Top notch delicious foods all around.  I know they have a brunch menu... guess we'll have to ride down some Saturday or Sunday morning.  Tasty food, friendly staff... we'll be back.

Came here after work for a drink and a biscuit. The food is great, but it's the setting that makes this place awesome! It's very low key with limited seating and Christmas lights hanging in the trees. It's the perfect place to chill in a small group!

Outdoor fun!!!! This little place knows comfort food BIGTIME!!!! Its a laid back atmosphere so if your looking for something fancy this maybe not for you but if you can humble yourself into appreciating good comfort food and a backyard setting then this is the place for you! Also, a great spot to stroll into in the morning after a huge night out on the town their Bloody Marys will make you feel just right again!!!

Well, it finally got rented out again - to a troupe of really enthusiastic chefs and they're growing their hours. Worthy successors to the chefs who came before them, another tribe of locavores.
