Unbelievable that they seem to have a full beer/wine/liquor license.   GO NOW before everyone figures it out! However, be warned it is no longer "cheap, under $10" - but not by much - excluding our wine our shared meal clocked in at $15 each.  We each had a glass of Arizona wine labeled, merely, "red". Went wonderfully with our shared Roosevelt Growhouse salad [the beets, my gawd], cheeseburger [the mushrooms ...] and fries. Good decision, to share - we couldn't

After an action packed Sunday Funday, Welcome Diner was just what was needed.  The unique food makes you wonder, at first,  if it's actually going to be good.  This is one place where not just the food speaks for itself...the service was great and the best part is how they actually bring the food out to you even though you order a food truck window.

We had burgers, fries, and a salad and everything was perfect and delicious. This is a thick burger with fresh toppings. Really yummy fresh salad with an amazing cheese on top -feta? Better than any feta I've ever had. But the real show-stopper for us was the fries. Very likely the best french fries we've ever had. They're not fancy, not dressed up, just perfection. The service was also fantastic. This is an order at the window mostly outdoor diner, but there was a guy who kept coming out and checking with each table, so it felt like sit-down service. We loved the friendly, casual vibe. Made for a very relaxing evening. I'll go out of my way to go back again. *My only wish is that they'd serve milk shakes. :)  Update 3/18- We've been back a few times and every time has been fantastic. This last time we tried the mac & cheese and now understand what everyone raves about! Yum! My husband says it's the best he's ever had, but that's the way with everything here.. best burgers, best fries, best service. I have no debate on this anymore, this is the best burger in the valley. Crazy good. And when's the last time you went to a order at the counter place where they introduced themselves, the cook, and assured you they'd be taking care of anything you need? And they do! Really wish I lived closer!
Get a grapefruit Paloma and a burger to split; our favorite place when we visited Phoenix

If you just landed in PHX and this place came up, just go.  Stop reading and get fed right.  Fried chicken on a fresh biscuit with a refreshing salad, served outdoors in what looks like someone's front yard.  Heck, I pulled up and almost pulled away but something told me to stop, give it a chance and boy am I glad I did.  Great service, to die for food.  You can really tell the chef loves what he does.

My family and I went to Welcome Diner last night. So, there were several different items ordered and EVERYTHING was so good!  I had the fried avocado po'boy. The bread was toasted the perfect amount. There was a great pico de gallo and kale topping the fried avocado. That fried avocado was amazing! It was so creamy yet crunchy! Yum! My husband had the champion burger. He said it was really good, especially the bacon jam. My brother in-law has the big Jim. It was huge! A biscuit, giant piece of fried chicken and the thickest gravy ever! I tried some and it was so good! Creamy and sinful! The last thing I tasted was the Brussels sprouts. Omg! Goooood! They were crispy and tasty! Only downside was the fries were a little salty. I would definitely go back. The atmosphere is exactly what downtown Phoenix is all about! I loved it!

First off, the food is incredible. The menu is very simple and to the point. Don't let that fool you.   I got the sausage corn dogs. YUMMY. A must try. Also the fried green tomato sandwich. The bread they use is quality and so tasty.   I gave it 4 stars because I feel like the staff could be friendlier. And eventually, I'd love a bigger beer selection.   Try. This. Place.
The best place I have been with all of my roommates. Definitely as good as they say! This is such a perfect, unique place.

My boyfriend and I are so utterly in love with this place.  Their menu is genius and you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu.  The poutine and the mac n' cheese are my go to's whenever we go here.    The seating is open and we love sitting in the 6-seater counter top in the old trailer they work out of.  Being practically an arm's reach away from the kitchen stove is awesome because you get to hear and smell the food cooking which is phenomenal. This is exactly what comfort food should be; greasy and flavorful and rich!  Another draw of coming here is where it is located.  Sitting on the street corner in the midst of older craftsman style historic homes and strung lights about their patio is so charming.  I love coming to this part of Phoenix, always great people-watching and fun atmosphere.   The staff here are so awesome and friendly and make the experience here that much greater!  I highly highly recommend this place if you are looking for amazing, local, FRESH food.   Just come here, period. You won't regret it.

Welcome to AHHH-mazing.. at this cozy Welcome Diner! My exact words as I tried my first bite was, "Ok.. this would be my last meal on earth if I had to pick one."  That is saying a lot considering my love for good food.  I'm not sure if I truly meant it or I was in a food coma  Either way, it's on a top favorite list now.   This place has charm and is sure to impress your tastebuds.  We sat outside on a rustic picnic table with white lights, heat lamps and ate some seriously good grub. The hubby got the "Big Jim" which I'm not sure I can find words to describe. A home made biscuit with the best gravy you could ever ask for, fried chicken and bacon under it all. One bite of this thing and you will be hooked.  I can't say enough about this dish.. just GET IT.  I went for the healthier grilled fish sandwich, which was loaded with flavor.  An extremely well seasoned piece of fish and some slaw on top.  We also got a side of fries smothered in the famous, fabulous, unforgettable gravy. This Diner also serves mixed drinks if you'd like to visit and kick back a while.   The Welcome Diner should be bookmarked on everyone's Yelp!  I'm not sure about the other items on the menu but I imagine they are outstanding.

Sheer deliciousness! Had the sunrise... It was in a biscuit, absolutely delightful, very filling and superbly made. To add to that, the atmosphere is relaxed and laid back, and the experience is very different from the normal fare.  The staff was pretty friendly and checked on us several times. (I guess it helps that you add the gratuity while ordering+paying, instead of after the meal?)
I'm beyond impressed with my experience at Welcome Diner. The food and service was impeccable! If you haven't been I would highly recommend trying it! Thanks Aaron, Zach and Jose!
Great service!! Very friendly!! We came on a Friday night so the kitchen was a little backed up but it was worth the wait. Definitely recommend!!
Waited a long time to eat here went after leaving celebrity theater was amazing had the chicken biscuit and some drinks with the Brussels sprouts was delicious

Went here with some friends on Saturday for brunch. Ordered the Big Jim and sunrise. The big JIM was a little salty and the sunrise just didn't hit the mark. The chorizo was excellent.  The holy puerco was the best dish, I highly recommend.   I will return for lunch and dinner to see if it gets better. I would recommend going at least once, don't be afraid of the neighborhood.

Dear fucking lord I am not going to eat again until next Thursday.  A friend took me here for lunch today, in exchange for a little 'puter help. The cook is a friend of hers, he just said, don't worry I'll make something you like.  Next thing I knew I had a Scheiners freshly made hot dog, grilled, split open, on a bun... with a fried egg an some of their pepper concoction on top. One of the best things I have ever ever eaten.   As others mentioned, the fries are sliced to order and fried to a super crisp.  The eggs are organic. The menu is tiny, it's diner food, but the food quality is very, very high.   Has a few bites of a freshly made pear pie.... oh my.  I will be back, but not that often, otherwise I'll be a lardass. (again)
love that its open so late. the food is really good and the hipster vibe is hilarious...

Delicious! Their jackfruit po' boy was amazing. It can be really hard to find good vegan food in the valley but this was a pleasant surprise and also my first time trying bbq jackfruit. The Welcome Diner is a new favorite!

Not exactly in a good appealing neighborhood. It was like a house in a corner converted into a small diner with tables set up in the yard... however the food was great and affordable. I ordered a jambalaya while my friend had the little birdy, fried chicken with cheddar... we both enjoyed the food and will be back for more

The Welcome Diner was super WELCOMING, living up to its name! It was our first stop after landing in Phoenix. They treated us like old friends and made sure we knew the best spots to enjoy on our stay here.   The BBQ Jackfruit sandwich was bomb (NY slang for AMAZING!)   Really wish I could take the whole staff and restaurant back to New York with me. Thanks guys =D

Honest comfort food in a sweet ass, remodeled RV and plenty of outdoor seating. Wayne (owner/manager?) said "thanks, we try really hard" when I complimented them on the food and experience. Yet, one of the greatest things about this place is they don't inundate you with being those people that try too hard. They don't force their efforts unto you, it just happens organically. Watching them work behind the bar and in the kitchen was a thing of beauty... so fluid, every movement and each interaction is performed with meaning and genuine care. It makes you feel at home while also being right in the middle of the action. Food and drink were fantastic and well priced ($6 old fashioned at happy hour??). Got the No Way Jose burger and fries, girlfriend got the same but with Brussels sprouts. The biscuit sandwiches and the poutine made my mouth water watching them pass by, but I didn't try them on this trip. Pecan pie . Recommend eating inside at the bar if there is seating, so you get the full on experience of the hustle and bustle behind the counter. Then, grab another drink and head outside if it's not 120 out. This place is a great way to start your evening. Compliments to Wayne and the rest of the staff!

Visiting from Tucson and found this diner, here on Yelp. Driving to this place was interesting as it is in an old section just east of downtown Phoenix, could describe it as 'The 'hood', but as we drove up and saw the place and patrons lined up to order outside, I told my wife, 'we gotta do this' and it was very good! Try the 'Big Jim', it's delicious, my wife had the 'Welcome Burger' and she said it was one of the best burgers anywhere. They do have Craft beers and a bar, but you better like it 'kozy' 'cause that bar is inside this little trailer-like restaurant; seating for eating is outside. You really  should try this place, it's a cool, little place that will surprise you! Oh, save room for the Beignets!

YOU.MUST.EAT.HERE!  Everything is to delish but the burgers are to die for. The blue cheese burger is by far my fave but on our last visit we found it had been removed from the menu because they rotate the burgers out. Hesitantly, I tried the peanut butter burger....and oh.my.god! The oddest concoction, but delicious!   Ps....please bring back ol' blue!!
Amazing food, great drinks, and serves food till 2 am. Definitely recommend the jambalaya, sooo bomb!
Food is  an A-. Service is A+. Environment is A+++. My suggestion is to have more items in the menu.

When you see the building you might be like ew gross but then once you try the food you're like yummmm! I've been here a few times and always like my food! Drinks are good too! I would use the restroom before coming here though, the restrooms are somewhat hidden and I have heard they're not the best.
I finally have a great late night place. Perfect for late summer nights hanging out outside! I don't even live nearby and its still worth the drive.

Wow what amazing food and fantastic service. My group got 2 big jims, a bumblebee, poutine, and the welcome burger along with 3 old fashions. The drinks were served right away with the food very shortly after. All of the items were amazing and we will definitely be back many many many times.
Love love love this place! I can't say enough good things about it. My cousin lives in downtown so whenever I'm in the hood this is where we always choose to go. Food is to die for!

A couple friends took me there Saturday.  It was very tasty and affordable.  It's a very small place and they cook right in front of you, if you sit inside (like waffle house but not as greasy and more delicious) and very friendly staff and atmosphere.  We had beer and mimosas with biscuits and gravy (comes with bacon/sausage or mushrooms and an egg), blackberry ricotta lemon pancakes, and a chicken sammich with cheddar, apple butter, on a homemade biscuit.

We had just left the Arizona Science Center and were starving and looking for a nearby place to eat.  Welllll...my friend had this place bookmarked for some time and it was only about 5-7 mins down the street so we said hey why not  The restaurant itself is literally a little van of a diner with patio table benches set up. The line was pretty long to order and there are menus at the front to look at.   The food was different from what I normally am used to but I am open to new things so my friend and I shared two dishes. We had the sunrise and also the fried green tomato sandwich. We wanted some poutine fries but they were out of fries for the night.   What I highly enjoyed was their house made ginger beer! Honestly the best ginger beer I've had by far!

BEST BURGER SPOT I'VE COME ACROSS!! I was out one night craving a burger and jumped on yelp and happened to be driving down roosevelt. This was the first place that came up. I drove down and stopped by. This place is really cool. I like the open setup outside. There's benches for you and your friends to chill on while u enjoy your meal.  There's a dinner car that seats about nine people that's cool to sit in.  The service is GREAT!!! All the people there are super cool. A very friendly atmosphere that anyone can enjoy. When your foods ready they always check to make sure everything's right before giving it to you.  Now.... The burgers and catfish sandwiches are AMAZING!!! I have had the welcome burger, the peanut butter burger and the Friday night catfish poor boy!!! All left smiles on my face wanting more. You have to try this place out!!! IT'S A DEFINITE MUST!!!

Man oh Man!!! What a GEM!!! Found this spot about a 1 1/2 years ago...L O V E their fried green tomato sandwich! Have taken my friends and foodie, adult children (runs honest in the family) And everything we've had has been fabulous.   How can you not enjoy such a unique spot - a 1945 Diner with 8 stools and fantastic outdoor seating?!!
I love this place. IDK what Brentski is talking about. lol, I love the hurricanes and the pork fries.

This tiny neighborhood spot virtually looks like either a converted food truck or a small food trailer. Outside on the front lawn are many tables and chairs, as inside you will find only 9 seats at the very retro counter.  The menu is southern comfort food. Super greasy, generous portions, all cooked grilled and prepared in what is probably the smallest kitchen in the valley.  This is the spot for a behemoth burger, biscuits smothered in gravy, and even fried green tomatoes.  With a "biscuits" menu, featuring fried chicken drowning in country gravy, cheddar, and bacon - it is a bypass waiting to happen.  However, there are lighter healthier biscuit choices that come topped with sauteed Kale and fried egg...but this place truly is a destination for abandoning healthy choices and diving head first into fat and calories.
Great food! Had the Big Jim and it lived up to the BIG part, bacony and gravy-y and delicious. The coffee was good too. This is a great brunch spot.

Came here for brunch with my girlfriend. First time in Phoenix , she wanted to take me to Braggs since she lives downtown but the wait was crazy. I had the welcome breakfast and it was the best breakfast I've had in a long time. The biscuit, hash browns and bacon were amazing, my girlfriend got the grilled cheese w the tomato confit and inhaled it .. guess it was pretty good! Loved it! Perfect new years day brunch!

A friend of mine introduced me to this gem last week, and I can't believe I didn't know about it! Welcome Diner is adorable, with friendly staff and a cool atmosphere. We went after work for happy hour, and it was a great experience. Highly recommend the koko biscuit and the hurricane! Will be back soon :)

Absolutely loved our food and the atmosphere. The service was amazing as well. Also loved fact they buy their food locally.  I got the champion burger and it was the best burger I've ever had anywhere. The bacon jam is really a hidden treasure. We'll be coming back hopefully every weekend. Thanks welcome diner for providing an awesome experience.
It's kinda southern comfort food with a hipster twist.  I'm a fan.  I hear they have an awesome "after-hours" scene on weekends.  When I'm in that kinda mood I will try it.

I got on a plane in Boston, landed in Phoenix, and went to the Welcome Diner.   There were a few other reasons for my visit, but retrospectively, there didn't necessarily need to have been. I'm not going to get into the particulars [see all other 5 star reviews], let me just contribute my humble "YEEEUP" to this wonderful little joints' reviews and be on my way.  Summation: Do you like food? GO HERE.

Hearty diner food with good flavors. Nothing extraordinary. Limited menu. Was hoping for an Acai bowl or green drink but that's not this type of place. The real downer was the small dining space which was super noisy and not cozy. Hipster place with a rustic industrial/farm decor. Overhyped but super popular with college crowd.  Friendly service:)
Strongly recommend the cheese sandwich.  Love the heavy cream with smooth Blue House coffee.

Getting to Welcome Diner during rush hour traffic (5:30pm) was a bit of a hassle but was worth it. Upon arrival, situated randomly in a quiet little neighborhood on the edge of downtown, there was the most legit old school diner. With plenty of seating all out front and outdoors (avoid during the summer) the atmosphere was very hip and trendy.  The food was not that of the typical diner but had a nice menu with salads, vegetarian items (fried green tomato sandwich), burgers, and their signature fried chicken and biscuit sandwiches (the bumblebee was delicious). The price was pretty high but can't complain about anything else. Can't wait to come back!

Hipster divey spot down on Roosevelt. Good vegetarian options but the menu changes so call ahead. The fried green tomato po'boy we had was super tasty. Brussel sprouts were pretty good. There are only 5 or 6 inside seats. Great outdoor patio area, grass, lighted with string lights...gives it charm. It's not the right spot when the weather is iffy...but that's almost never in Phoenix. Smoking can be an issue sometimes.

Man but this place kicks ass.  Incredible, inventive, decadent food.  BITCHING cocktails (try one and you'll see).  Open til 12 on Sunday night.  (Yes!)  Totally savvy musical selections, always. Straight up & personable folks making and serving everything.  The real locals deal.  Feel like I need to go here as much as possible, before it totally blows up and there's no getting a seat.  Big love.

The first time I saw this place, I felt so curious and decided to give it  a try. This place is a labor of love, from the mountains of delicious comfort food to the impressively functional bar squeezed next to the griddle. I love this place and it loves me back. You must check this out!

Remember to suck in your gut when entering and exiting this place. It doesn't bode the largest establishment around, and if you show up at the wrong time you might be sitting outside in the sun in anticipation.   I have been to this place several times and have not been disappointed once. I would suggest something for you to try, but I can't decide on any specific thing that is better than the other. The cup of sweet toast is a must try. My face literally melted off in delight. The burgers and fresh-cut fries are in my personal epic category. The egg sandwich is ridiculous. Really the only knock to this place is it's size. If I didn't need a crowbar to get myself out of the building each time I go, then it might be better.   Seriously people, go here. Eat here. Revel in your trip to the land of gluttony. I love this little cramped trailer and it's treasure trove of goodness.

Wish I could base my rating on more than my short experience there. I went in this afternoon to meet a friend for an early dinner. I had seen a picture on IG and the food looks delicious plus I love supporting local businesses, so i was excited to try it.  I went inside and there was 1 table available so I asked the girl cleaning the table If I can seat myself or if they seat the guests, she asked if it was just me & I let her know I was meeting someone.  She said she couldn't give me a table until the whole party was there so I'd have to wait outside -- TOTALLY understandable. No problem with not being able to give me a table. So I said, "oh okay. Is it okay if I wait here?" -- I was standing by the door/server station.  She replied, "sorry, you're going to have to wait outside"   Ummmm okay....? It was 104 outside. Sooo I went outside and saw my friend across the street & decided to just eat at Cafe Gallo instead since I really didn't like that interaction at all. I don't have anything to say about the food because the service was horrible.

Good late-night spot in a residential neighborhood. Came here after the Suns v Warriors game and had ourselves the poutine fries, Mac and cheese with chorizo and I got the Big Jim and my gf got the Bumblebee. The poutine fries were decent. We both loved the Mac and cheese with chorizo! You can usually add any toppings you want to the Mac and cheese. My gf didn't like her bumblebee. She said there was too much seeded mustard and too much honey. But she did say the chicken was moist and tender. My big Jim was pretty good although I wish it had more gravy. Gravy was delicious, chicken was tender but overall I felt it was a little too "dry". But then again I like sauces with my food and in this case if I'm getting gravy, the more the better. Some might disagree and say too much takes away from the flavor of other ingredients. True. But IMO I wish it had more gravy. Without it, the biscuit was good but a little dry. Overall, food, service and ambience was good. Cool, hip place. Would definitely come back for Mac and cheese and maybe try a different biscuit "sandwich"

Nestled in a residential area, you will find the "Welcome Diner"not only do they welcome guests, They are all super friendly and passionate about what they do! The food is incredible, especially the fried green tomatoes ! Can't wait to visit downtown Phoenix again and the Welcome Diner!
The biscuits and gravy is my favorite. It's so good I could cry.

Although a little pricier than I'd prefer, I'm giving Welcome Diner 5 stars for the delicious locally-produced food, relaxed and friendly atmosphere, and the outgoing people who work there. You know a restaurant has something good going when a college student is willing to pay $10 for a watermelon salad. Or $5 for french fries with an egg on top (seriously, you have to try it. So delicious.) Welcome Diner has a unique operation--in the warm Arizona months, Welcome Diner operates from 5pm to midnight, and during the cool Arizona months, it's open for brunch and lunch. Whenever you happen to visit, you'll be greeted warmly, offered delicious food, and given a wonderful starry opportunity to enjoy the night (or morning) with dear friends.

How cool is this place? It's definitely in a 'transitional' area of town, but the clientele when we were there was fully gentrified: skinny jeans, back tattoos, and beards all around. We didn't get any food, but the drink menu is awesome and seriously affordable ($6 for specialty cocktails?!). I love how you order at the window and they bring your order out to you. I'm all for a good-tasting drink over a booze-y one, but these actually seemed to venture to the weak side - FYI.

Writing this while we're still at Welcome Diner, because it is THAT good. We're traveling through Phoenix and found this place just a few miles from our Airbnb. After a long day of traveling, this place was everything. We loved the community feel, the twinkly lights, and the locally sourced ingredients. We split two burgers--the Welcome burger and the Blue Sky burger. Both were delicious and came with a side (we tried the cole slaw and the side salad). They have a cool retro bar and solid beer list, but we opted for the homemade fruit punch (which was so good). I wish we were in Phoenix longer so we could come back again!

Finally got to try this place and it did not disappoint. Amazing burgers...   The PB&B (peanut butter) was insane. The special was the champion burger with caramelized onions and it was great too, but I would definitely go with the peanut butter one again..and again.   Also had a a homemade biscuit with honey and it was crazy good. Prob try a fried chicken biscuit sandwich next time.   Place has a lot of character. Old RV converted into a restaurant. Minimal indoor seating but not a bid deal. Wish I lived closer... Great place.

This place was the only Thing within walking distance of where we stayed. It is mostly outdoor seating and the menu is pretty limited. The $4 whiskey sours were pretty good. The sandwiches were original. Fried green tomato for instance but they were 9-$10 and not all that filling.  The pulled pork fries fro $8 was a large portion but my girlfriend and I had indigestion all night, something that hasn't happened since I was a kid...just too much fat.

Tucked away into an old central (and scary) neighbourhood, it was a bit hard  to find in the dark. Glad we did, though! Got a lemonade (made with fresh lemon juice), the fried chicken with cheese biscuit sandwich and split an order of bacon cheddar fries. The chicken was perfectly cooked with a crispy outer breading, thick and juicy meat inside. The biscuit was really tasty and flaky. It came with a few cubes of watermelon but I don't like melon so those went untouched.  We sat inside at the bar and everyone working inside was super nice and friendly. They have quite a few regulars and I could see why. The prices were a bit higher than I expected but they use totally local sourced ingredients and everything is prepared fresh so you're paying for the quality just as much as the quantity.  An order of cheddar bacon fries, a biscuit chicken sandwich with watermelon side, lemonade, and tip totalled to just over $21.

This is my favorite eatery! End of the review.  Ok starting with the food: The salads are awesome, although a bit pricey but the owners explained that they grow most everything themselves or source it from small organic farms. They are worth every penny.  The sandwiches are some of the best I ever had. Jambalaya is amazing. The list goes on and on.  I've been here a couple dozen times and never had a bad experience. Yes this place gets busy at times but for a reason.  The happy hour drinks are a great deal too. Only the best ingredients for a more than fair price. Same for the food.  It's always a homey and welcoming and there are some great and very passionate and authentic people working here which truly reflects in the food.  If you haven't done so please come here and check it out. By now they have legendary status in the area already anyways.  Thanks for all the good moments I had there.

The BFD isn't Payton Curry. its not the food, either, its the floorshow. Payton and his wife manage to make this tiny space feel cavernous and fabulous. Their banter is hysterical, and Payton somehow manages to hear everything said on the floor from his outpost cooking. The words fly fast, but you'll laugh hysterically.    And the food? Inventive, fresh, reasonable and fast.

OMG. A must visit when in Phoenix !!! Maybe it is just because I love real food and of course real drink. So my second visit to the Welcome Diner was much delayed with conflicting travel schedules that did not bring me here in time for a masterful dinner sooner. My loss... Check out the pics this time around. Biscuits Gravy - Fried chicken - Yes FRIED EGGS (2)- Brussels Sprouts with Bacon and of course red slaw. Well cardiologists you must be jealous. Drink order:   "Black Cat" = Bourbon rocks +  splash of Absinthe. Drink of the Kentucky Gods.     Only request would be that they stock some Old Smokey Shine in a Mason Jar of course.

Thank you again fellow Yelpers!  I tried this place based on your reviews and I am happy that I did!  Tonight I had the PB&B burger.  Crunchy peanut butter, B&B pickles, bacon and cheddar.  I selected fries over coleslaw.  I also upgraded for $3 to Poutine fries.  Add on tasty beignets dusted in local honey and powdered sugar for desert.  What are Poutine fries you ask?  They are the staple food in the Toronto area.  French fries smothered in country gravy and melted cheese.    A little to crazy for your taste buds?  No worries.  They have normal food too.  Welcomediner.net

This is my go to spot for a casual hang out. There usually is a line, but it's always a pleasant wait. You order at the counter and find a seat. There is counter seating inside, but not much. I've ordered mixed drinks inside. Not sure if they are available on the outside deck/yard area. Check their Instagram to keep up with whatever new creations they have to munch on.
Who doesn't love this place?! Try the ginger beer. I wish they would bottle that stuff so I can start hoarding it.
The most incredible place to take someone who is visiting. The food never disappoints and service is generally perfect. Never a bad experience here, but it can be pretty packed at times!

While driving around town my friend and I came across the welcome diner. I've seen it before during an art festival but never had the chance to eat there. Remember that day I told my friend we should try it. When we arrived to the window where you order food the customer service was horrible and very unfriendly. The guy that was taking our order was just rude and not happy at all. It seem like he was upset about something and was taking it on us. It was our first time being there and I would of thought that the guy would of mention the daily special or even recommend he's favorite dish but instead was so commanding and rude. To make matters worse; we did not get our food until an hour later. The burger was dry and not tasty. There was no love to the burger. I don't think I'll go back or recommend this place to my friends or family.
Fun and delicious dinner spot. Get the home made ginger beer. Good for vegetarians. Great atmosphere and friendly people.

I feel I am an expert on fried chicken, and I had the Big Jim today with a side of eggs.  Fresh squeezed oj and LUX coffee.  The biscuit was unbelievable and sliced in half and put on the grill for an extra crisp; the fried chicken breast on the sandwich ... well, watch out LOLO and Mrs. White and f**k Chick Fil-A and the Hate Chicken, I will never EVER miss that again, knowing this place exists.  I can't describe the extra crispy not at all greasy breast - and the bacon and cheese and gravy was amazzzzzing.  Hipster waitress and they kept coming around to refill my coffee on a lovely chilly sunday morning at 1030.   I'll be back, but my waistline will suffer.  GO, puts MATT's big breakfast to shame.    My minus one star- Needs a booster or something for small kids to sit in.

Came here for happy hour on Friday evening. Their happy hour ran from 5pm (when they open) until 7pm. They have a good mix of drink deals (like $1 off draft beer and $6 cocktails) and food specials. I had the little birdie and the pork fries. The little birdie sandwich was very good, but I wish the batter in the fried chicken had a little more seasoning to it. The biscuit was great though,  nice and soft. The pork fries were great, the cabbage slaw on top of them was just the right topping. Overall, this place is definitely worth checking out. It has a great trendy atmosphere and their menu items are wonderful!

Fun, hippy, eclectic yet completely off the charts kind of place. Been coming here for three years now and the menu items are all to die for. This time I got me an old fashioned, and that drink is very well made here. For my dinner I got the mac and cheese, one of my favorite dishes here. Very creamy, cheesy dish that makes you want more. I also ordered a side of hand cut fries and those were amazing as well. Definitely recommend this place and I'll come back again. Have low expectation for seating and be open minded, you'll have fun.  Another update.... The new location is amazing. They moved and have a larger indoor seating area and even larger outdoor area. Food was still amazing, I got the grilled cheese and it just was AMAZING.
They source local food and try to find non-GMO the people that work here are also really cool beans; as is the crowd usually.  This place has a bit of a laid-back hipster vibe if you.

I had the Mac and cheese. Very good choice. They torch the top so it has a crust. The wife orders the PBB which is a hamburger with peanut butter and pickles on it. Sounds weird but was very good. She also poutine which was very delicious. We topped it off with beignets. All after midnight. Fantastic! The only thing that was disappointing was the decal in the restroom degrading my president. I won't be able to support them anymore.

Came here for an interview.  First time in Phoenix.   Nice outdoor scenery setting.  I often like this as indoor restaurants can sometime be stifling.     However, food was just ok.  Tried the fries.  Too salty.  Too fatty feeling.  Portion for fries was huge, but you pay for it...would not get it again.  Was not able to finish.    Burger was also just ok.  Nothing memorable.

Let me start by saying from the time I pulled up to the place, walked in the courtyard, stepped into the diner and took a seat on one of the 9 stools at the corner of the counter, I was a fan.  This tiny place packs a big punch.  The employees are super friendly and upbeat. There is a sense that they want you to have a great experience while you enjoy eating.   It's got some super items on the menu and they are working on creating a full bar.  They have large multi seat tables that look similar to picnic tables outside under umbrellas so there is more seating of the weather is good. There are several items on the menu I will return to try but on this particular trip, our first, we had the Holy Puerco & the Peanut butter Bacon Cheddar Burger.  Both were amazing.  I felt a bit like I was back in New Orleans with the fried cheddar grit cake, cracklins, & Crystal sauce.  Not to mention the burger reminds me of one of my favorite burger joints in NOLA, Yo Mama's Bar & Grill. They also have a Peanut butter Bacon burger.   I like the list they have on the wall behind the counter that names all the local businesses they purchase there produce, meat, and goods.  It shows the intent to buy local and support other local businesses.   I will be back, I witnesses the making and devouring of a sandwich named Big Jim, a fried chicken breast, country gravy, bacon & cheddar on a large homemade biscuit.  I have got to try that for myself.  So my recommendation to you is to go, eat, experience this little diner for yourselves.  There is soul in the food they serve.   Here is a link to the diner's website:  http://www.marthaandmary.net/welcomediner/welcome.html

I'm obsessed!! Me and my two girlfriends came by here for a late night dinner and we were blown away! What amazing hospitality and food! The pineapple beer is flawless and the fried green tomato sandwich was to die for. Thank you for taking care of us so well, can't wait to come back!!
The next Nobuo Fukuda event will be at Restaurant Noca on 8/27. Warning -- link to PDF.  http://www.restaurantnoca.com/Menu/Specials/NOCA_Nobuo_August_Menu.pdf

What an awesome place! Hidden in a neighborhood, we would have never found it without our friends recommendation. We had the Peanut butter and bacon burger. It was delish! My husband also had the ginger beer, was very gingerly. The location was really cool. Outside seating mainly. I was in awe. Food was great. Somehow I felt it would have been even better with milk shakes on their menu. We will be back! Give it a try! You will not be disappointed!

Pretty amazing every time I've been here. First time I went with a Clever Koi cook and he knew the people that worked there so we got free samples. Can't really go wrong with anything but the fried green tomato sandwich with bacon is probably my favorite.

Fantastic hole in the wall (hole in the trailer?) restaurant. Great relaxed vibe, with good old bluesy southern music as a backdrop to the even better tunes of familiar conversation. I loved how hometown it felt. This is definitely a place where strangers become friends.  Fantastic service! Our server was Brandon, who was so helpful in making sure my meal was vegan and describing every delicious detail to us. Upon leaving, every employee waved and thanked us for dining. So nice!  On to the food...fantastic. I had a veggie burger with fried avocado on the side. Life changing. My boyfriend had the classic burger and fries, and loved it. I can't wait to come back and try the vegan po'boy.  I'm really excited to be a frequent patron of the Welcome Diner. So happy we found it!

Welcome diner has been on my bookmarks for a long time. After such long anticipation and procrastination my boyfriend and I went to grab a bite. Unfortunately i wish I would have waited ... I am the type of person that sees Mac and Cheese and I MUST order. I ordered the M&C ($8) and additionally added tomatoes and jalapeno ($2). My boyfriend ordered the Big Jim and the fries and gravy. I tried everything we that my bf and I ordered and nothing blew me away. The m&c was just okay, possibly not worth the $2 extra dollars i paid to ad so little vegetables. The big Jim was not the best, maybe a factor to that was that my bf ordered the patty medium well and it was not to my tasting. The fries and gravy were not bad, but i would not reorder.  The ambiance is very relax but very crowded. I was with a group of 5 and we had difficulty finding where to sit, so if you would like to dine there keep your eyes peeled for a good table. Also keep in mind I went on a Saturday night , so it may be busier compared to weekdays.

I've been coming here for years and I haven't had the chance to actually distill on the crowds of Phoenix and beyond how wonderful this place is.  The menu depending on how hungry you are is accommodating to any appetite whether you're just looking to munch or full out grub.  If you can beat the 2AM cutoff the drinks here are prepared with care, precision and outright thought to the discerning palate.  In this day and age just utilize your smartphone to find this place or jump on a bike from the many rent a bikes in the DT PHX area to get here on a pub crawl or meander on through the colorful and eclectic neighborhood.  If you have a chance to sit inside and chat up the staff they are welcoming as the name implies, humorous and always accommodating!!!  A go to spot for me for sure!

Bienvenidos! Always wanting to try new places, my brother and I came here for dinner one evening for their happy hour. It was too humid outside so we snagged two seats at the bar inside. It's a small trailer-like spot with a bathroom reminiscent of one in an airplane. It was cooler inside but a bit cramped of course, and I didn't appreciate being around alcohol and the smell but it was worth it being indoors.  We ordered the jackfruit fries from their HH menu to start and I got the Bumblebee biscuit. My brother got the Koko biscuit, which he enjoyed. I thought the fries were great, shoestring topped with purple slaw and jackfruit, such an interesting and tasty food. I loved my biscuit, the fried chicken was done right and the sweet and savory flavors of honey and mustard worked really well. Topped with pickles for a nice crunch and change of texture.   There are several vegan options as noted by the V on the menu. Definitely a great spot for dinner and open late.

Three of us stopped here for a late dinner on a Friday night. This place is right in the middle of a downtown Phoenix residential neighborhood and it doesn't look like much from the outside. There are several communal tables outside as well as 8 or 9 stools in a very small area inside. We found a spot at one of the tables and started chatting with our table mates.  The menu is small but has lots of foodie offerings. Our group had: the PB&B, the fried green tomato sandwich, biscuits and gravy and poutine. Everything was fantastic, although the poutine is untraditional. The gravy on my biscuits and gravy had some of the best, yummy, flavorful, salty gravy I've had. And the biscuit was cut in half and grilled so it was a bit crispy. The tap beer list is also pretty impressive considering the building is pretty much a trailer!   It was a great atmosphere with legit eats!

This place is AWESOME!!! It's a laid back, casual, hole in the wall, neighborhood gem.  LOVE that there is this historic looking little diner in the middle of what appears to be a residential area.  Reminds me of the historic district back home.   I picked my husband up from the airport at 11pm and thought, "Hey...why not?! Let's try it!".  I'm SO glad we did.    It was PACKED.  I asked if they were always that busy and he said "Yep.  Often busier.  We use fresh ingredients and make good food.  It makes a big difference."   I felt like a newbie ordering, asking for a receipt, etc. (because they were so busy), but they were as patient as they could be.  My husband and I both ordered biscuits and gravy to go.  He ordered his with two over-medium fried eggs and I ordered mine with a side of brussel sprouts.   While we were waiting, he had a soda and I had the Ginger Beer.  The Ginger Beer was knock your socks off spicy, but I'm sure it's what saved me from a night full of tummy troubles (eating rich biscuits and gravy right before bed is probably not a good idea).  It was definitely homemade and packed a TON of ginger punch. It will make your throat burn in a good way.  The food was outstanding.  The biscuits were sliced in half, toasted, and accompanied by the super thick, rich sausage gravy.  For us, the gravy had a bit too much heat (excessive black pepper, perhaps cayenne...not sure), but...it was still VERY tasty and we both ate every bit. His eggs were perfect and my sprouts were fantastic with just the right amount of caramelization and oil/butter.   We will definitely be back and often.  :)
The outdoor scenery is very elegant. the food was really enjoyable and pleasant. I really enjoy the fun feeling it has to it. very classy to go to and have a great dinner and drinks!
Vegan Po'Boy. Oh my gosh!  Fried avocado! Everything here is a yes! My mom still talks about this place years later!

My family and I were drawn to this place because of the great reviews and how close it was to the game we just watched & open late. We got there around 9:45 ordered the Poutine fries w/ gravy on the side, Mac and cheese, the carol, big Jim, and the welcome burger.   The seating was spread out and basically just a hangout spot for a bunch of hipsters. We didn't know if they were doing orders in order or just unorganized because we literally waited an hour before we asked when our order was going to be done. No one even asked us how we were doing or if we needed anything during our waiting time. I'm all about customer service and the lack of it turned all of us off.  We got our food at 10:50, probably because we didn't look happy when we asked when our food would be done. The dishes were good but not worth the hour wait, mind you today is just a Wednesday. We will not be back.  What made us even more upset is the fact that one of the employees brought out the couples food next to us, within 20/30 mins of them being there AND gave them free drinks. Maybe it's because we're Asian and we were the minority at the diner.

Let's just say that if this place had a basement I'd live there. the food is amazing and the service is friendly and prompt. it has a well established reputation of excellence. Thanks Yelp for this hidden gem.

Decided to walk over to Welcome Diner from Chase field after a Diamondbacks game last night.  I personally would not recommend that walk late at night, but my fiance and I made it just fine. No frills and kind of odd is the way I would describe this place. I got the Big Jim and it was legit. Pair that with my favorite beer from the brewery I used to live next to in Tucson (Dragoon)? Win win and win. Anyway back to the Big Jim, it was really good, especially considering my sobriety level, the gravy and chicken was just what I needed to carry on last night. The wife to be got herself a Bumble Bee which she deemed quite delicious. You'll have to take her word on that, as I was not able to procure any samples for my taste laboratory. It's a really strange place in the middle of a neighborhood, in the middle of Phoenix. Some people will really love this place and some won't get it.
Fun and delicious! The car shows they have there too are a great way to fill up and have some quality time w/ loved ones.

One of the best spots to go after a night of dancing/drinking. Food is good! I've had a few burgers and they all were awesome, even the peanut butter pickle burger lol. Wanna come back to try their drinks.

REVIEWER #667th:   Well first of all I want to start this review off by saying that I'm honored to be The one to move us past the 666th review. I would like to thank all my in-laws for bringing me to the welcome dinner to make this all possible.  This place is actually pretty nice and the food is actually pretty good. I'll be honest I wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was. Their homemade ginger beer is a must. I pretty much ordered half the menu all the items on the menu were super solid:  Luxardo Salad 5/5: They did a great job on this one the go cheese was not overwhelming and it was balanced out by the apples they offer a dressing on the side which there really was no need for and I never used.  Jumbayala 5/5: probably the best jambalaya I have ever had. My only qualm about this one is I asked if it was spicy he said no. I'm kind of a wimp when it comes to spicy food and it was in my opinion decently spicy. But the texture was amazing perfect balance of chicken.  BIG JIM 5/5: The key to this being so good is 100% the biscuit. The biscuit is moist and a perfect complement to the gravy and chicken. The portion is definitely enough to fill a person.   Beignets 4/5: The beignets  are pretty good but they are pretty deep fried as well. I like my Beignets  a little bit softer on the inside.   Goat cheese and preserves 2/5: this was probably the only downside to my meal. I think they should've made the preserves a little bit sweeter as it is a dessert. The goat cheese overwhelmed the taste and made it kind of sour.     Summary: we went there around 10 PM, outside seating was nice nice ambience to the place the table we sat at had not been cleared and we had to go ask somebody to clear it, or we could've played it ourselves but they didn't have a place for that. There was a drunk lady that was smoking next to us that I had to ask her to put our cigarette, but she was fairly kind about it. But then 20 minutes later another guy lit one up a feet away from us.   The smoking is the primary reason I gave it 4/5 stars. I would've liked to of seen management be a little bit stricter on that. Nobody wants to breathe in your nasty smoke when they're trying to enjoy a meal with their family. They do have bicycle parking, and you can rent some on the street as well. They're open late which is nice as well. Overall I really enjoyed it and would go back! :)

This was an excellent adventure. The service is super friendly and the food is unique and deserves more praise. I ordered the fried chicken biscuit with gravy and cheese and bacon. That was the best choice of all the meals I tried and will be what I order when I return. We started with pulled pork fries that were BBQ flavored with a mustard twist. It was bold but I would try something else next time. The burgers were great and the fries were too. Great late night food, I would suggest this to my yelper friends.

GRREAT place!  The burgers and fries are great (although as previously stated the burgers are a little small but the quality makes up for it) ... (I've posted a picture)  **** note they don't take credit/debit cards ****  The neighborhood isn't the greatest but no biggie.  I have to say best part was the service!  After ordering and telling them I'd eat outside they asked if I had a dog, I said yes, and he said "I'll get you a bowl of water before anything else."  SOOOOOO cool!  They CLEARLY take GREAT care an food prep ... they wear latex gloves and unlike other like places .... when dealing with the money part they take off the gloves!  Highly recommended!!!

This place rocked. We were a little hesitant at first to try it bit it worked out. The location is right smack dab in the middle of a residential area and the diner literally sticks out of a house or possibly used to be a house but the food was phenomenal. All the seating is outdoor with a walk up window to order. The staff and the food choices definitely had a little hipster vibe. The collard greens were freaking amazing and the rest of the food was up to par for sure. Only complaint probably is that the drinks were a bit on the pricy side, $3.50 for a tall can of Pabsts. All in all, I would definitely visit again and again.

Amazing food, amazing staff. Only one time did I go where I wasn't impressed. Top of biscuit burnt and chicken dry. Other than that food and service has been superb. Great comfort food and a nod to the south with the fried green tomato sandwich!!

Finally! A brand new Welcome Diner location where you can actually sit inside during the blistering Phoenix heat!   Okay. Well, that's not necessarily true.  My girlfriend and I stopped by after they had been open for about four days and were disappointed to find ourselves relegated to the patio. Of course, it was prime dining hours, so you can't really knock them for being popular, now can you?  What I've always liked about "Welcome" is the simplicity of their menu. The options are not overwhelming, the quality is extremely high, and the food is sourced from all the right places. While not everything I've had here is perfect, it's very difficult to go wrong with most of their options.  Once I point out a handful of hipster clichs to my girlfriend, I always feel a little more at ease once I see that we're not the only people in their thirties dining here. Everyone can come here - even if you don't own a fedora or have facial hair! It's true!  As for the food, classic staples are still present, such as my all-time favorite grilled cheese sandwich in all of its smokiness. The spectacular chicken biscuit sandwiches, burgers that put most places to shame, and those damned poutine fries that everyone seems to crave.  Desserts are tough. You might find yourself thrilled with something, but might end up damning other customers to hell for depleting their inventory of something you were hoping to try.   Anyway, I still give Welcome Diner high praise, but will probably give it a more in-depth review when I can actually sit inside and not have to eat my bowl of grits while simultaneously shooing away flies.  Until then, go visit them, but please don't eat all of the pies!

Delicious food, unique setting, and completely chill staff. I had the fried green tomato po'boy. It was so tasty and the tomato had an excellent crunch. My husband had a chicken biscuit which he loved. We split the mac and cheese.The mac and cheese is in my top 5 for Phoenix.  The outside seating area is a great place to relax and eat delicious grub. My only complaint is there was an excessive amount of aggressive flies. Probably something they can't help but it was still annoying.   I can't wait to go back and sample more delicious comfort food!

These guys definitely colored outside the line on this place. You order at a walk up window and find somewhere to sit. Seating is open and you'll like be sharing you table with strangers. Which is cool. You get to meet new folks and swap foodie stories if you're lucky.  The food here is terrific. I had the grilled cheese sandwich. This was really good. It wasn't an over the top massive gob of gooey cheese. This sandwich was a savory treat on rustic sourdough bread. Very well prepared. My wife had the Koko. A biscuit sandwich with fried chicken breast & arugula topped with a creamy sauce with a little snap. We got a side of Bignets and a side of roasted Brussels sprouts. Both worth the price of admission.  If you like a good Bloody Mary, you have to try the WD version.  This place rocks. Once again, my fellow yelpers were spot on.

Definitely off the beaten path! Loved the big joe so much I had to try the carol. Then the no way Jose burger, then the grilled cheese and fried green tomato sandwich! Loved everything but the AZ heat. Go inside! ALL the staff is friendly. A must visit in Phoenix

The food is amazing.  My favorite dish is the Bumble bee, delicious fried chicken on a biscuit with honey and honey mustard.  I dream about that chicken.  The location is quirky, in the middle of a residential neighborhood. Almost entirely outdoor seating, stand in line to order at the window and then find a seat.  Expect a decent wait both to order and to get food (approx 30 min each).  Staff is friendly and helpful.

My fianc came here for a late anniversary dinner around midnight. I ordered a special burger they had called the Jose I believe and my fianc ordered the Carol. We both absolutely LOVED our food. The burger I ordered had a jalapeno relish with onions and it was just amazing. The Carol was also really delicious and unlike any other pulled pork sandwich we had ever eaten. The staff was very friendly and it was lit cutely with string lights. We are so happy to have a late night spot to dine in Phoenix that's not a fast food restaurant. I absolutely love this place and we will definitely be back!

Absolutely DELICIOUS. The food did take a little while but the quality of the food and the taste of the food made up for the wait. I had the Pb&B burger... it was heaven inside of a bun, it had peanut butter on it with pickles, this would normally be an odd combination but the sweetness of the pickles and the salt from the peanut butter made for a great duo. The atmosphere was very lively and happy. The service was good but when you order there is a small window that you order through and the woman/man who takes your order sticks you drink through this tiny window. This is a great Establishment and I will definitely be coming back.

The new location is so much better. The counter seats kept the diner feel but much more space. The food was on point. The patio is still the best seat in the Garfield area. Definitely stop in if you are downtown.  Hidden Gem!!

WOW! Great experience! I am new to AZ, so I am enjoying trying new places. Welcome diner is all around awesome.  I would like to see more vegetarian options, but aside from that, everything was amazing. We chose to eat inside the diner at the counter, good call on our part. The staff served up great service, delicious food, with a side dish of humor to make the evening even more fun. Looking forward to my next visit and bringing friends to experience this fabulous establishment.
Chicken and donuts are awesome!!! love all of their sauces. The only negative is the place is so small, every time I visit them my clothes get stinky.!

Super hip outdoor eatery. Headed down at 12:30 to try their food. Had people coming and going the whole time with a great patio area and lots of seating    We ordered the Big Jim with an egg, the PB&BB, poutine and mac and cheese with bacon.  They have great sausage gravy.  The mac and cheese was amazing and portion was very large as was all the food.   Great friendly staff and a wonderful experience. I'll be back.

I love love love this place! Old Diner turned modern with a retro vibe! Super super super nice employees. Everyone was so helpful, friendly, sweet and passionate about this place and their jobs here. It's not just a job it's a community of people. I felt like I was picnicking in the south on a hot summer night in downtown Phoenix! Farm to table delicious food and drinks.

Tried Welcome Diner for the first time tonight.  We did only try the Hurricanes but will definitely be back to try the biscuits. The place is very unique.  We sat outside and it was kind of like sitting in someone's backyard.  They have a walk up window if you chose to sit outside or you can sit inside at the small counter. It was happy hour all day since it was Tuesday.  Awesome!! Service as polite and quick. The Hurricanes were refreshing but not strong. Don't let the neighborhood or decor scared tour away. Can't wait to come back and try the food and other cocktails.

Cute little diner right in the middle of the neighborhood. Stopped here real quick before taking my sister to the airport. We each had a biscuit sandwich: she had the chicken and biscuit with bacon, cheese, and gravy and it was great and I had the one with chicken, honey, mustard, and pickles and it was excellent.  2 sandwiches and a coke to split was $21.

All you need to know about coming here: GET THE BEIGNET This is such a great casual place to go for dinner! The atmosphere is nice because it feels super casual, yet at the same time can be romantic (just depends on who you go with I suppose). All the workers are so kind here and the comfort-style-food they sell is so seriously bomb! Parking can be a pain, and yes you'll probably have to wait a good half hour to an hour to eat, but it will all be worth it because you have to wait to get a good seat anyway.

My fish po'boy ain't so bad. My husband's PB&B was worthy of a recounting of the crunchy peanut butter anytime someone says something related to burgers. The poutine was tasty. But the one item that made us say "We must come back." was the mac and cheese. Not greasy, not disgustingly cheesy (he loves cheese. He likes to quote a commercial routinely: Great love needs more cheese.), and perfectly done.   I enjoyed sitting outside in this fairly quiet neighborhood at 8 on a Saturday evening. The employees were friendly and engaged in our playful banter. One very kindly spent way too long trying to light a heating lamp for us until we all agreed it must be broken. Warning: their bathroom is a tiny little square with a folding door directly next to the kitchen. Hold your pee until the next location, ladies who are wearing tights under your dresses/skirts.

The only place in town I can be sure to have a good time. My visiting friends loved it. Every portion is right and tastes consistently hearty and like a happy person cooked it. I love the way they do barbecue, meat or vegan, and even basic things like french fries are special when they make them. You can see the happy people that make your food from quality stuff when you get there, since they're pretty visible.

LOVE WELCOME DINER. Their food is absolutely amazing. The service is wonderful. I have been there multiple times and have never once had a bad experience. I tell all my friends about it and love to take people there. You truly cannot get better biscuits. Welcome Diner cannot disappoint.

A colleague highly recommended this place. Its a gem of a place. There is a full bar along with the menu. I tried the fish po boy and let me tell you it was very good. The fish was not breaded but grilled and cole slaw was added to it. This place is open till 2am. You need to give this place a try.

Had an amazing fried green tomato sandwich along with hand cut fries. My bestie got the Bumblebee Biscuit-- a sandwich that consisted of fried chicken, honey, mustard and pickles. Seriously cannot wait to get back here!   Also, the service was top notch!   I highly recommend to anyone looking for a fun atmosphere, amazing food, and friendly service.

What a disappointment. Hipster place trying to appeal to people that have no children and plenty of time. They took way too long to make a grilled cheese sandwich.  We ordered at 10:10 pm according to my receipt, and the food finally arrived at 11:10pm, 1 hour later.  Very disappointing to see all the customers that were in line after myself getting their orders ahead of us.  Our friends were finishing their plates when my order finally arrived, small, burnt and nuclear hot on the inside.  What really capped the disappointment was when the waiter came by to ask how all the food was tasting and I told him I don't know because we have no food to taste, it had been 50 minutes on a 30 min promise and our food still was not here.  He asked what our name was and went back to check, then came back and said they have started working on it now, to which I replied, "What were they doing for the last 45 minutes if not making our order?" to which he had no reply.  The Welcome burger looked big and nice and I was really excited to see what I was going to get for a grilled cheese with 3 different cheeses.  When it finally did arrive, it was burnt on the outside and cool to the touch, but Scorching hot on the inside.  They must have used a microwave to re-heat the sandwich, because I can still feel the burn on my mouth the next day.  Not only was the grilled cheese hot, it was also extremely small.  I was thinking something substantial after seeing the mac and cheese on the "Snack" menu the size of a small child's head, but the grilled cheese sandwich was more like an appetizer for one, not an entree.  If only I could give them 1/2 a star for the unlimited cold ice water, and the outdoor patio dining room, which were the only good things about the restaurant.
OMG this spot was the best! My bf and I went and got chicken biscuits, I can't remember the name of the sandwiches but they were fire!

What a gem of a restaurant.  Found this on yelp after a concert down town and I'm not sure what I enjoyed more, John mayor or the biscuits and gravy.  Do yourself a favor and grab a group of friends, some drinks, and amazing food.

Welcome Diner is dead. The new location has lost all of the charm and ambiance that drew people to eat there in the first place. I feel like they should have named it Millennial in a Quarter Life Crisis Diner because this restaurant is having an identity crisis. It seems like the interior decor was designed by a 55 year old who looked at a Buzzfeed list of things millennials like and then just crammed all of them into the building without taking into account that they don't all go together. In the diner there is old milk cartons turned into seats, disco balls, pinatas, plants in hanging macrame holders, and your receipt comes in an old book. And yes while all those things can be neat when used well, that is not the case here. Additionally, I feel the food quality has gone down. The portions seemed smaller and the quality of the meat just wasn't there. Previously, you could taste the high quality meat in the burger. Not anymore. The patio was fine. However, the lightning could be improved. It was too harsh. All in all this now feels like a restaurant you would find in Downtown Gilbert.

I've been here a couple of times with some buddies of mine. The menu is pretty small but Its something you kind of deal with. It'd be nice if they expanded menu options but I still come back because it's a nice little hang out spot when you just want some fresh air.. somewhere to just sit, relax, and chat in a nice setting with a friend. Love the vibe that's set here. Whether it's the restaurant it's self, or the variety of different ppl that enjoy this establishment it's definitely so intriguing. I still want to give this place 5 stars because the food is still very flavor filled and the staff is SO SO nice. Will be back again soon

I had the pleasure of (finally) eating at Welcome Diner today and it was amazing! I can't wait to go back.   I had the fried chicken biscuit sandwich and a side of fried avocado, both of which were great. Fried chicken was juicy and biscuit was flaky and tasted fresh. The fried avocado was awesome and like nothing I have had before.   My friend got a collard green sandwich with a fried egg on top. She smashed it and then raved about how great it was. Each sandwich came with a side of fruit which was the perfect side for the heavy sandwiches.   Like I said before I can't wait to go back!! Highly recommend, this is a local gem that I would love to see thrive.

What a fun concept for late-night fare in Phoenix!   Dude and I popped into Welcome Diner after an evening at The Nash, and it didn't disappoint.   You'll walk through a quiet neighborhood, and bam! There's the small, ecclectic trailer.   You can certainly sit inside; however, it gets packed at the bar - Walk up to the window, order and pay, then sidle up to one of the picnic tables and wait.   Our first trip in, we ordered   1) The Koko Sandwich 2) Poutine  3) Can of Biltmore Blonde for me ;)   The Koko was the highlight of the night.   Think a baseball sized biscuit and a larger-than-your-fist sized piece of juicy, delicious fried chicken. I'm not sure what all is in the batter. It was crispy and delicious, but there was also a very creamy element to it. Perhaps buttermilk? Who knows.   Dressed with arugula and a thick tomato slice, and some of the most delicious chipotle ranch!   No problem splitting this between two people, but next time I ain't sharin', sorry Dude It was that good.  We also got an order of the poutine, which wasn't anything remarkable. The gravy seemed bland and uninspired (minus the ridiculous amount of saltiness, even for poutine) and the bacon and curds weren't that memorable.    Gone are the days of IHOP and Waffle House, Welcome Diner is THE place for late night fare in Phoenix.   I can't wait to come back and enjoy that PB&J Burger with a cocktail.

OMG best biscuit sandwich I've ever had!!! You don't need anything to go with this sandwich!! I had to take a piece of pie to go I was so stuffed!! Great ambiance & met some great people while I was there!! The staff was awesome & there's seating outside & limited seating inside. I was able to grab a stool inside!! When I come back to Phoenix this will be my first stop!!

I love this place!  I just wish it was closer to this Tempe resident.  We both had a WHISKEY SOUR!!!!  We are not cocktail folks but we LOVED it!!  When ordering a second round, I innocently asked for an extra cherry.  For $1 you can get an extra cherry.  I'm new to the world of cocktail cherries, but these apparently are very special Luxarno cherries!  AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!  The people here are so nice.  Food was good - he had burger, I had chicken on a biscuit (chicken a little too thick) but so good.  Just wish we were closer. Love love love!

We went to Welcome Diner for Easter brunch and it was remarkable...   There are two things in that sentence for which I am grateful.   Thing 1: Thank you WD for being open on Easter. I'm not a religious man. Easter is just another day of the week for me, however I am a man who can appreciate a day off work. That said, I am grateful that you were open so that I and my degenerate crew could enjoy your establishment.   Thing 2: Thank you for having delicious food. That is all.  This was our first time trying Welcome Diner. We pretty much almost tried one of everything... because why not.   The Fried Green Tomato Sandwich and the Biscuits and Gravy were my top two items. As I've declared unabashedly in the past, I'm from the south and these two items brought me back home. Very well done in their own unique way.   I think the thing that was most surprising about WD is that they were churning out this great food from such an unassuming place. It looks like they just dropped a little ol' diner right in a residential neighborhood. The location is also just east of Roosevelt Row, in a slightly more rough area. Not bad, but some people might shy away.   The only issue I see, particularly with summer coming up is that, if I'm not mistaken (which I could be), majority of the seating is outside. There are sun shades, but from our experience, even with said shades, if you're sitting in the wrong spot, you could still get pretty toasty from the sun.   We sat outside on our visit because it was beautiful. Although as the morning moved along it did get uncomfortable at times when the sun would be at just the right angle to blast you for just long enough you could feel the sunburn happening.   All that said, get there while the weather is good! And if you do get warm, they make some refreshing mixed drinks (I had the Hurricane) and they also have a nice little beer selection as well. I almost forgot about that... I probably need to drink less of them next time.
I love this place! Such an amazing place. Had a basil gimlet, my god!!! And Will, he and the boys behind the bar are such studs.

The first time we attempted to come here we were unable to eat inside and it was raining so we didn't eat. The second time it was nice enough to sit outside. The server recommended a honey chicken biscuit sandwich, which I ordered with a side of brussle sprouts. It was pretty good, the honey on it made it messy to eat and the biscuit was a bit much in ration to the chicken. I would probably order something else next time.  My  husband ordered a burger, which he said was good, nothing over the top. I would come back and try something different, their patio is cute and the staff was really friendly.
The wife and I ate dinner here tonight and we got the veggie sandwich.  It was amazing we were both blown away.  Will you please put this on the menu?

I had the bumblebee biscuit with the brussel sprouts - both were phenomenal! We placed our order and the waiter told us that everything is made homemade and has won awards. It was hard to choose!   We ended with the begniets which were not great - they were giant and heavy and had a lemon aftertaste that I wasn't a fan of.

I have only been a few times but each time has been really delicious, the grilled cheese and the little birdie are so good and they have a good selection of beers and cocktails. Most of the seating is outside (there are big heaters for the colder months) with a very few seats inside although I have never eaten inside. Staff is very friendly and has a really great neighborhood vibe.

Perfect late night spot. Reminds me of grabbing dinner at a roadside stand in a small town.   Portions are big, food is greasy but fresh, and prices aren't that bad.   I love old valentine diners, and this is a great example. A real gem in Phoenix.

Visiting Phx from SD. Found this small diner on a yelp search. We are heading to east phx for a concert. Wanted something close by but not too pricey.  Nestled in a historic district surrounded by many original cottage homes this little walk up diner has some tasty eats. My sone went for the pb&b burger peanut butter and bacon. Came with fries. He says 5 stars. My husband got the fish po boy. A big piece of seasoned grilled fish with coleslaw on a bun. Nice and meaty flavorful fish. I got tge fried green tomato sammie with roasted brussel sprouts side. The sandwich was spicey but flavorful. Only miss here were the roasted sprouts. Too much overdark roasted sprouts. The ones not too browned were good in their simplicity. A thumbs up all around.

This is a hidden gem in downtown Phoenix! I had the whitefish sandwich, my husband had the PBB (burger with peanut butter), my mom had the jambalaya. The white fish was very tasty! The burger was surprisingly good. However, I cannot recommend the jambalaya, was dry, not that good. I'll definitely be back to try other things on the menu.

Great late night place, the food, the service and the ambiance is amazing!  We arrived and feel in love with the atmosphere of the Welcome Diner, the lights were twinkling and the music was perfect. We ordered after asking the nice gentlemen taking orders what was good, sat down and enjoyed the ambiance and out food arrives shortly after that.  Bonus: this place is super dog friendly!!!

I had this place on a list of "gotta try" lunch places near my new job. Today was the day to give it a try and I was blown away. The place is super cute (tiny inside and a nice patio), awesome, unique menu, EXTREMELY friendly service and the food was killer. I chose the Bumble Bee, fried chicken breast, local honey, house made beer mustard and bread &  butter pickles on a huge homemade biscuit. How they got the chicken freakishly crunchy yet completely juicy on the inside is a mystery right up there with the Loch Ness Monster and Bermuda Triangle. For a side, I tried the fried avocado. Oh yes, I said it. Again, crispy beyond belief and soft creamy avocado on the inside. There may be voodoo happening in that tiny kitchen. I will be back to investigate further...maybe for brunch!

This small mom&pop style restaurant has great food and an awesome atmosphere. It's very casual and friendly. It's usually pretty busy and has a small kitchen so you can't be in a huge hurry to leave but as long as you're aware of that, you'll love it.

This place is so awesome!  What an appropriately named restaurant.  We were warmly welcomed, and then met locals from the colorful house nearby.  They masterfully created an atmosphere of community.  But what's even better is the food.  The biscuits and gravy are a must try.  I didn't even know I liked them until I had them here.

The seating here is mostly outdoors. Be prepared for that. It ends up being preferable though because of the misters and the fact that Phoenix evenings are actually really beautiful, if you're looking. Along with the combination of string lights and decorations, you'll feel happy to be there, experiencing it.   I don't eat meat so I can't attest to their fried chicken (although when I come with friends they always enjoy it), but their fried green tomato sandwich is better than most things in life. And I will happily come back for that over and over. I don't think I'll get tired of it, but if I do, they also have a vegan sandwich with pulled jackfruit that tastes good as well.

Outstanding food, friendly and cool wait staff. The fried green tomato sandwich was unbelievably awesome. Never had anything like it. Drinks are good and reasonable. They actually make their own tonic for the gin and tonic drink. How cool is that? I will be back to try everything else on their menu as it all looked outstanding when other customers were served. The burger and Mac n cheese combo looked pretty good- will try that next time.

This is a great little spot with awesome food, awesome employees who treat everyone like they're friends. The menu is not of the normal run of the mill type but yet a delicious combination that should be tried. As a local business owner and supporter of independent non-chain places to eat, this is a must try! And don't forget that they serve booze! Try the bloody mary or the hurricane!

Greasy spoons unite!  Great menu, cool vibe, good service and good beers.  I was amazed at how efficient these guys are - they must lead the restaurant world in ratio of patrons served / grill square footage.    A great spot.  Don't come here on a diet though - my meal soaked through the paper plate and left a visible grease puddle on the counter top.  Psst ... the grit cakes are tasty and absorb the flavors of the meal but they are extremely greasy.

Biscuits,  pbr tall boys, craft beers on draft... need I say more? I always end up here as an attempt to sober up after hitting up the bars off of Roosevelt. Long story short it never happens because they sell beer and I just end up getting extra wasted. But, it's okay! Their food is a great hangover cure, so I just come back the next morning and stuff myself with the best biscuits EVER. Hangover situation averted.

Easily a solid 4.5. I continue to be impressed by Phoenix area venues. There is a level of creativity/uniqueness seen here that seems to be matched. A boxed car diner with outdoor picnic tables sitting in the middle of a residential neighborhood? Sign me up!   Welcome diner is the rare combination of good food, low prices, and perfect portion sizes. The fried green tomato sandwich is a must, while the Mac and cheese is among the best I've had. The torched crust takes the dish to a whole new place. The only knock on my one-man feast was the beignets, which were a little on the dense side(eats more like a cake).    To top it all off, they are open till 2am! Welcome diner, you have made a fan out of me.   Now does one want to sit outside in the Arizona heat? that's a separate issue altogether.....

If you could imagine going over to your friend's place for dinner if your friend is a chef?  That is the Welcome Diner.  Every time I have been there, the place was full of laughter and the smell of great food cooking.  If you sit at the counter, you could smack the chef on the ass.  Order a hurricane, and everyone in the joint yells, "HURRICANE!"    It is a great time.  My only complaint?  They aren't open enough hours to totally clog my arteries.

Beignets to die for! We happened onto this place after flying in at 11:00 pm from Philadelphia and what a find. Friendly, chill vibe, authentic diner experience with a twist. The fried green tomato sandwich delicious and tangy-chewy, biscuits with gravy just the right amount of creamy and spicy, comfort food at its best.

This establishment is cute and a wonderful addition to the neighborhood. the food is average but they tend to accommodate vegans which is rare. would be a good place to go after dark for most seating is outside.  they are open late and carry booze and beer, no wine.
Hurricane is  a must and big joe is amazing!! Staff is very pleasant too great ambiance overall

The closer I move to Welcome, the fatter I'll get. Everything is that good. I reminds me of little food bars in New Orleans' Irish Channel. And save room for a cocktail or punch.   Indoor seating is super limited, so be careful in arizona summers
Great late night hang! The food is great and it's always a good time. The bartenders are attentive and social! Fun for me

Went to Welcome Diner for the first time this past Saturday. They had a veggie burger on special that I really wanted to try, but sadly they ran out before we got there. Instead I got the vegan po-boy sandwich with a side of fries (which i'm so happy I chose). It was so yummy, and super filling! The menu has lots of great comfort food items, including some vegetarian/vegan options.   The staff was awesome and super friendly. The place has such a neat vibe as well. There's truly nothing like it!
