Careful, you will find yourself addicted to this place! I can never decide between the Big Jim and the Honey Bee. So I get the Big Jim with a side of honey! TOO GOOD! And they are open until 2! it's well worth the drive :D  Just don't crave it on a Monday ;) because they aren't open. I've also had the mac and cheese, and fries. Thumbs up The burgers are DELICIOUS! Every time I have been they've had some time of chef special, that always sounds so tasty. And a couple times i've been they have had $1 Big PBR's. Nice outdoor seating, atmosphere is pretty chill, along with the people who work there!  It's a must go.
Such a cute and delicious place! Perfect for date night! Great drink list and the food was amazing.

They're back as of today, and they're awesome. I was turned on to the Welcome Diner by a classmate at a software training I was attending, I said I was a food nerd and he told me that these guys were reopening today! Solid yelp reviews sold me, and they did NOT disappoint. They opened at 5:00, but I got off of class at about 4:15, so I went down there and hung around for a bit. After unsuccessfully attempting to help out with their square credit card thing (they can take cards, but it'll show up as the food truck because the restaurant account isn't setting up properly), I placed my order. I was the first customer, yay! Amazingly, the only other opening day jitter I saw was the ricecooker being ornery and tripping the circuit breaker repeatedly. In terms of "disasters" that's a pretty minimal one. I chose to wait for the rice to finish and get my meal all together, as I needed to burn time to avoid getting out of central Phoenix back to Tucson at rush hour. I had the port of call burger and a side of red beans and rice (the ricecooker worked in the end). Best burger I've had, I think ever. All the ingredients were high quality, very nice cheddar cheese, mushrooms cooked with port, and garlic aioli. And the bun. Oh damn, the bun. Feathery is the best adjective. No unevenness in texture, light, and just barely strong enough to contain the burger... well maybe not entirely contain. The red beans and rice were good - I'm not well versed in the craft of that dish, but it was tasty. Both the other customers that ordered inside got the fried chicken biscuit sandwich with apple butter made by one of the staff. They seemed very happy with their choices.  They've got beer, wine, and hurricanes. Right now they're open Thursday-Saturday 5:00-10:00pm for dinner, and Saturday and Sunday from 10:00-3:00pm for brunch. I snuck a peek at the brunch menu, and there looked to be some tasty stuff there too. They're going to work on expanding dinner service out over more of the week gradually.      What are you doing? Yeah.  You. Why are you still reading this? Go get a burger or something from here. Blah blah blah it's Tuesday at 9am and they're not open, sure, whatever, maybe that excuse will fly with your family, but not here mister/missy.

I was brought here by some friends who highly recommended this joint. I always down for a hole in the wall style place and it was nothing but that. Service was great and so was the HURRRRICANNEEs.   The food, is blissful and heavenly. The kind of food I cook at home with fresh produce and meat. It hasn't even been 24hrs and Im dying to go back. Everything is top notch and words can't describe this place; you just have to go!!  Sat down and talked with Michael (owner) about meat smoking, cooking and everything culinary. Great guy who knows his s*(&t. Overall, im very glad we were brought here and will be back in the near future!

Very fun and laid back diner vibe. Love the food and can't wait to try out everything on the menu.  Very well made drinks. Good happy hour on food and drinks. Can't wait for the weather to cool down so we can enjoy the cute patio.

I have been wanting to check this place out for a while and was finally able to make it in.  It was a Saturday night and my friends and I were exploring Roosevelt Row when we decided to look for food. We came in around 1a and although it was closing soon, they took our order and said it would take an hour for the food to come out. We ordered drinks and sat down at one of the tables. There were 4 in my group so seating wasn't a problem. The table we sat at was more of a communal table. If we came earlier, I'm sure there'd be a few different groups sitting at our table. The weather is just cooling down so it was nice to actually sit outside and enjoy the fresh air. We were literally the last ones there as our food arrived. I ordered the fried green tomato sandwich and was very happy with my choice. The breading was crispy and the tomato itself kept it's shape. The chipotle ranch sauce complimented the flavors and the sourdough was toasted. I love trying different items so if I'm with a group, I sample a bit of everyone's plate. The poutine fries were very hearty. Even though it was smothered in gravy, the fries were crunchy and not soggy. I was also very impressed by the grilled cheese. On my next trip, this would be what I order.

Amazing food!!! The best burger I've ever had. Everything thing here is amazing. Super fun ambiance & place to hang out. It has very reasonable prices for the quality you get. The staff are all super nice. You have to come here!!!!

Thank you to Yelp for leading me to Welcome Diner! I drove out here after work on a Friday, by myself, and knew as soon as I could see it that this place was a gem. It's tucked in a neighborhood, with a red and white trailer, neon lights, and string lights over wooden tables. It's so perfect that I wish I thought of it myself.   You order at a little window and can see three guys all crammed inside, cooking up amazing food. They had happy hour specials while I was there, and I got a local draft beer that was delicious. After much debate, I settled on the North Carolina pulled pork biscuit and a special side salad with a shallot vinaigrette (although it was hard not to order skinny fries and Brussels too!). I was worried it would be packed, but there were just enough people to comfortably eavesdrop and still have some elbow-room.   The food was amazing. You can tell everything is made in small batches, with love and attention to detail. Someone came out and checked on me while I was eating, offered to grab me another drink, and whisked away my dishes as soon as I was finished. Overall, it was a perfect dining experience, and I only wish I could pick this place up and plant it down on the East Coast!

So happy we drove far to come here. We wanted someplace new and unique and this place has it all. It's unique, adorable and the food is amazing! The location is what makes this unique. It's a hidden gem. The fries were so good, a heart attack on a plate that's so worth it. I got the sunrise and it was fantastic the flavors went so well together. My husband got the bumble bee and the flavors went well together. The honey was delicious with the fried chicken. Overall I would recommend this place for the atmosphere and the food. Well earned 5 stars.

I looked up a list of the best burgers in Phoenix  before our trip to Arizona and the peanut butter and bacon number at Welcome Diner caught my eye. We managed to make it there after a concert, around 1am on Halloween. They were busy, but we managed to get a seat inside.   The diner is in an actual diner car, so it's tiny with a large, cute patio area. The cooks were churning out orders quickly. My boyfriend ordered a delicious White Russian stout and the blue sky burger, and I got my peanut butter burger with fries. The fries were great, the burgers were flavorful, unique and perfectly cooked. The bartender was great, and we very much enjoyed the experience. Cute, quirky little place. I'd definitely come back when I'm back in town.

My fav diner hands down. I just love the hospitality and service. The food is delicious. Every time I have a cheat meal welcome is a must. I recommend this place to everyone. I always bring friends to try it.  Keep it up welcome!

The Big Jim (apparently their best-selling item) is a deep-fried breaded chicken patty with two biscuits and some other toppings. Along with a small amount of sausage gravy. Unfortunately, it doesn't work. It's too much bread and not enough flavor. Sausage gravy is tasteless. Only two hot sauces are offered. Tabasco and Crystal. Even with that, food needs more flavor. From what I can gather, very little nuance or spice is used in their food. unfortunately, it's all very pricey for above average diner food.   Very limited beer selection (4 taps - nothing special). More focus on cocktails.  Great space, they're all working very hard, super friendly service.  The bathroom is smaller than an airplane bathroom. You are literally in a mobile home restaurant. Not much they can do about that, but it's very cramped.  Great patio!  3 1/2 stars.

A great spot to come to for some late night dining. The food isn't amazing, it's greasy and certainly not healthy, but at 1am who cares. Definately not the cleanest joint in town, but character makes up for it. I reccomend it if you've got no other options.

Food was great.  My wife and I had been wanting to try this place and finally made it there a few days ago.  It is in a bit of an odd location wedged in the middle of a neighborhood run-down old homes.  Great place to check out though when weather is nice as it appeared almost all of the seating was outside.  We split the mac and cheese and a fried chicken sandwich with honey.  Both were great.  I am generally not a huge fan of fried chicken but theirs is legit.  Not to greasy and lots of flavor.  Great biscuit as well.  Also thought the mac and cheese was some of the best mac and cheese we have ever had.  Comparable to what you would get at a fine dining restaurant.  Definitely will be back--want to try some of there other things and drinks next time.  Very hipster feel.
Cheerful and relaxed ambience, great food, wonderful and friendly service. Backyard neighborhood party feel, with home cooked taste. Recommend making it for happy hour.

I love their new space! Excellent design and their restroom was pretty cool too! It's a mix of vintage and modern which I loved. We got the Mac + Cheese, Smoked tomatoes and OKRA! YES OKRA! That was my favorite. Of course their drinks were so good and the service was excellent. Congratulations once again on the opening and we look forward to coming in again!

Ahhh, I read the reviews from "New-times the best of," and had a high expectation to eat. My veggie burger was bitter because it was burned on one side and I asked them, "is it normal burning bitter like this?" They said YES. (Only one side?? ). Really? I had better veggie burger even at Fat burger or even at Na mi.  The flavor was nice actually on the first bite before I bite the burned side :(. I am little bit disappointed.  The prices for 2 burgers (veggie and peanut butter burger) and 1 lemon pie homemade (with over-dozed sugar flavor in one side and strong lemon taste at the center) total $20-ish.  Peanut butter burger was good especially for them who love peanut butter in their burger.

Amazing place! The atmosphere is just phenomenal! It's very quaint and charming. When you're done taking in the awesomeness of the outdoor seating strategically placed around beautiful trees and string lighting, you get to the walk up window where you check out their ever changing specials menu board or the regular menu with a wide variety of fun dishes to choose from. They also have a full bar with a drink menu which I was pretty happy about! The food is all made in house with the very freshest local ingredients, even down to the Chipotle ranch dressing (which was to die for) the staff was fun, friendly and charismatic and the price was fantastic for the quality! And to top it all off, they were easily able to accommodate our large birthday group!  I will definitely be going back with as many people as I can drag with me to show off this hidden gem in downtown Phoenix!

THIS PLACE is great. I love this joint. The staff is awesome and the food is great. Their grilled cheese is so good. I also love their beer selection and their full bar. I have a hard time decided what to order when I go here because everything looks so good. This place is tucked away and can easily be passed up, but don't make that mistake. I love it here.
The atmosphere and food is amazing! We did wait a little too long for our food to come out but this place is one of the cutest diners in Phoenix!

There is not really a bad time to go to welcome dinner (unless you dont like big crowds) I find it fits so many different situations perfectly . this little gem has some of the best food in phoenix . and will for sure fill up even the most hungry of you out there. They don't mess around. Must try spot in down town

Wow, I love it when food surprises me. Here's the run down of our food. -Fried Green Tomato sandwich = AMAZING  -Mac & Cheese = Best and creamiest M&C I ever had. The burned very top bits adds another dimension of flavor and texture. My picky toddler could not get enough of it -Fried jack fruit - so good -Big Jim - Good but too rich & heavy for me Go, eat, and be happy

Went on a Saturday night and it was pretty packed. I would recommend visiting through the week if possible.   I ordered the little birdy (chicken,biscuit,cheese) it was good but a little hard to handle. Also had the jambalaya as an appetizer (big enough for 2 to share) I would order it as an entree next time.   The seating arrangements are mostly outdoor, which is fine when the weather is nice like it has been in March but would be a bit much in summer months.   My rating is based on the items I liked, I didn't go 5 star based on the price points of some items and the lack of soft drink options. This wouldn't deter me from returning in the future.

Nom Nom Nom.  The food here is so delicious!  My personal favorite is the fried green tomato sandwich and next would be the carol.  Of course my all time favorite is no longer on the menu, i am told if requested when not slammed, if all ingredients are there, they will make that too!  Goodness I love this place.  If you haven't eaten here, what are you waiting for?
Always great atmosphere, very relaxing and casual! The food can be a little inconsistent, but by far a fantastic spot for a snack and a drink!

They have a vegan option. It's nice to have more options near the Garfield that are open late too. Also, it's all about the grilled cheese on the biscuit with bacon added. The sides that come with the dishes are disappointing. I'd prefer a smaller/easier to eat sandwich with some sauteed veggies.
great place! love the food and the employees are accommodating! The No Way Jose is amazing!

I absolutely love this place and I have such a great time when I done here with my friends :) we've had the privilege of eating both inside and outside. Indoors, our friend group basically took up all of the barstools, but the environment was fun because you get to have the bartender right in front of you, see the meals being prepared, and be right in the middle of all the action! Outdoors, it is easier to talk to all of the people in your group and when the weather is beautiful outside why not  :) I've only ordered the Big Jim and it's hard to venture away from a dish you already love! There's just something about fried chicken and gravy in-between 2 biscuits that make the perfect combination! The Poutine is delicious and there is definitely enough of it to share! My friends ordered the PB Burger, The Koko, and the No Way Jose which they were very thrilled about! Cocktails are wonderful as well! I recommend this place to everyone I know and I'm always looking forward to coming back!
Loved it! You should try it! It's a dining experience unlike any other!   Nice job Welcome Diner!
This place makes me wish it was mine! The best home made biscuits, juicy off the bone fried chicken, great collard greens, and amazing catfish po boy.
Love this spot lowkey great food and service food was juicy mad at my self for being stuffed n not able to finish it

Oh my diner oh my diner oh my Diii-ner on Roosevelt--  So I usually don't eat at diners because food ain't all that great.  But where there is jackfruit I will follow.  Welcome Diner on Roosevelt and 10th Streets sells a lot of burgers and booze but they also offer a jackfruit po'boy ($8) and several other interesting veggie dishes.  Even though I fancy the taste of sweet, juicy, ripe jackfruit, it's also scrumptious when cooked and used like a vegetable.  This is the fourth spot where I've had jackfruit in a sandwich (or taco) and 'twas delicious.    Paired with a cabbage slaw that adds crunch to the 'wich, the flavor was mild and hearty.  I requested no BBQ sauce because that sickly sweetness would have disturbed the taste of the fruit.  My only regret is no side was included in the price.  Welcome Diner also sells a fried green tomato sammich. ($8.5)  Doesn't that sound delicious?   [crickets]  Doesn't it?  Okay, well maybe it's just me.  And lesson learned:   "Sounding" delicious and tasting delicious are two entirely different senses.  The sourdough was oily, toasted with a few slices of breaded fried tomatoes laid in-between.  And a fried tomato is...well...it tastes...uhhhh...urrrr...well...well, at least it's a vegetable, damn it Janet.    No side either.   If it wasn't for the arugula, corn relish, and ranch dressing on the sandwich, it would have been a complete disappointment.  Ya' hurd meh?  Complete. Disappointment.     And so TOMATO gets added to the list of things that should not be fried and passed off as food.  (That list is quite long, but let me not diverge from the review.)     Anyway, I will return someday for another jackfruit po'boy, but at $8 bucks with no side, my next visit won't be too soon.
My wife, the picky vegetarian had some bizarre avocado sandwich and a side of brussel sprouts.  If we end up moving to Phoenix, this restaurant may be the reason why.
Welcome Diner Crew Great! The food was also very tasty and will be a go back to place in the near future.

I love the nostalgia of a Valentine Diner having grown up with one next door. This group of chef's make it hard to like overall but some of their inventions are superb. Overpriced, overworked menu ideas are from newbe Chefs, I pray you get over it and think good food for everyone. I had the fried green tomato sandwich which underwhelmed with mushy tomato which the corn relish could not help. Hard to believe $8 for a side of Mac & Cheese but I ordered it. It wasn't the worst I have endured but far from acceptable, no flavor and texture was again, mush. Don't know where all these great Yelp reviews come from but I am losing faith in Yelp.
I went here on a Saturday night. Everything was great, especially the food, except for how long we had to wait. It felt like an hour. I had to cancel my after dinner plans because it took so long.

One of my favorite places now. Simple menu but great food with some inventive twists. Mostly burgers, salads, biscuits (biscuit sandwiches), and sides (fries, slaw), few other things. Cool vibe. Mostly outdoor seating, never experienced this place in mid-summer, must be scorching--then again, it's only open at night when it's cooler.  Oh, and yeah, only open after 5pm (typically). I'm there now, surrounded by all college age kids as I type this. EDIT: I felt I must update and drop a star because 1) the outdoor furniture is extremely old and weathered, and not just rustic, and 2) there were quite a few ants on the narrow table/bench where I sat outside.  I can understand these things being "normal" for "normal" situation outdoors, but "normal" doesn't get 5-star ratings. They should get refurbished furniture and go crazy on insect control.

I had fun visiting welcome diner! Open super late and some amazing unique options. I think it's cool how they have mostly outdoor seating, makes this place unique. There were a few vegetarian options which looked amazing but I went for the jackfruit sandwich, my boyfriend and I also shared Mac n cheese. My boyfriend got a biscuit with fried chicken and he thought it was awesome!  My sandwich was incredible, a crunchy baguette with perfectly spiced jackfruit! I had grabbed ketchup just in case but didn't even need it. My boyfriend didn't like the charred top of the mac n cheese but I thought it was good. He did like the underneath part of it. We also tried the home-brewed ginger beer and it was tasty! The ginger was extremely strong but very good. Took a while to get our food but this was a fun place to just hang out so it was not a problem. We both can't wait to come back!

I hate to give this a bad review because i honestly was hoping to love this place. I was expecting to give it 5 stars along with the rest of the reviews.. But of course that wasnt the case. Its cute and small but great for spending time with friends. I love the fact that its open till 2am. The only issue i had is their food is not that good i felt. To start before i even got to order and was looking at the menu i had a friend with me that had takeout from another place. We were approached by a young lady named Christina who told him he couldnt bring in the food because of the liquor license and that he needed to "get out". I could understand a beverage from somewhere else but a liquor license has nothing to do with food. The thing was she had a bit of an attitude which really turned me off to not even order anymore, but i still did regardless because i wanted to try this place.  I ordered the poutine fries which i was really hoping to be good seeing all the pictures and reviews for it. Like everyone said the wait time for your food is truly ridiculous. I ordered my food take out only to watch others that came after me be served their take out.. All in all it took 56 minutes for french fries and a side of gravy.  For $9 french fries i expected them to be good.. maybe i came too late or on an off day for the cooks but i feel i could have honestly ate better fries at a McDonalds.. A young guy i believe to be the manager came out and apologized for the misunderstanding of Christina shooing us out. He let us know that she was confused on the liquor license that it was only for outside beverages not food. Props to him for being kind enough to do that. But on the other hand the employees should ask questions if they are unsure on something before jumping on someone. Its common respect for the employees and customers.  Would i be back? Unlikely.

Authentic, quaint location. Best spot for burgers in all of Maricopa. Homemade ginger beer (non alcoholic) and  FLAVORFUL vegan options. Cute,Dog-friendly, outdoor setting! My only complaint is that it opens at 5..I've caught myself on multiple occasions auto piloting to Welcome Diner just to knock myself in the head for forgetting its not open during lunch hours.

Stopped here after a Suns game. Great location off of the busy streets. Nice little spot but dont let it fool you. The food is more on the gourmet side, they have a nice selection of alcoholic drinks. Not much room inside the diner but plenty of room outside. They have heat lamps if its that time of year. Service was very friendly and the person who took our order was very informative and was talking about where they get their bacon from AMAT ngst other details.  I ordered the PoBoy fish sandwich and friend got the Big Jim chicken biscuit. No sides came with our food except some watermelon. I didnt taste the big jim but looked good and my friend said it was great. PoBoy was very good and whatever sauce they use in it was outstanding   I would def come back again for the price i wish they included some kind if side besides the watermelon but overall excellent experience and food. Check it out

This is my absolute favorite place downtown..maybe in all of Phoenix. I have eaten their pork fries, big jim, pb&b, and the poutine and I've got to say that everything is beyond incredible. Their Hurricanes are the best drinks! Staff is always friendly and the food is so worth the price. Love it!
Amazing amazing melt in your mouth food,  affordable, funny down to earth staff, fun visits! Go here now!

First let me say that all the boys working here are super cute. So that was a bonus!! I had The Big Jim and it was delicious! Next time I will get the fried egg on top!! Oh and I also had an orange drink, can't remember the name but it ruled!

So good, I'll eat on a patio when it's 35 degrees out.   Gone are the days of diners as restaurants with incredibly greasy food and questionable cleanliness. The future of diners is here, with its eclectic flavors that appeal to carnivores and vegans alike. You're going to find the dish for you here, I guarantee it.   There's a small trailer with indoor bar seating. Good luck getting in there, as the space is obviously limited. For everyone else, you're gonna walk up to a window and swiftly have your order placed. They take cash and credit, as long as you're not too much of a "baller" carrying above $20 bills. I think some RoRo newcomers might have trouble with that. ;-)   A little birdie on my shoulder told me to keep it simple and go with, well, the Little Birdie. With simply fried chicken and cheddar on a biscuit, it's great to test the waters and see how welcome really shines. My chicken was perfect! I would seem it took a little dip in buttermilk before being introduced to a tasty batter. I can really tell these cooks know their chicken. The biscuit was amazing as well--I'd go as far as to say it's the best I've had on this side of the Mississippi. My vegetarian dining companion went with the jackfruit fries. I'd only had the fruit once before, and I'm not an expert on preparation, but I will say it was definitely tasty and a great meat substitute.   Everything was washed down with a pint of PBR, but if you want something a little fancier, there are a few craft beers, and a generous cocktail list. For a very small price, I walked away happy and eager to return!

First off don't get nervous trying out this place because of it's location. It's an outdoor diner. You can sit inside but there's only a few seats available. They play old school songs, which is nice to listen to. I loved the fries that we got and the corn dog. Big Jim was very delicious too! It was perfect with the gravy! I wasn't a big fan of koko and only had a bite out of it. It had an unusual taste to it.

I was SO, SO very excited to try this place. I had been asking my husband to try this spot for months. We finally had dinner here over the weekend and that's the last time I get excited over an eatery again. I ordered the Big Jim and my husband had the Grilled Cheese with extra bacon, we shared mac and cheese and "poutine". I had a beer and he had a Coke. The Big Jim was basically slop on a plate. I have never seen something that looked so messy and that was so difficult to eat! I tried to eat the thing and it just wasn't gonna happen. I didn't want to further embarrass myself and I was so over trying to eat it, that I decided to take it home. My husband's grilled cheese DIDN'T come with the extra bacon he ordered. Instead it was served to him on a little plate. Really? The "poutine"? Try sausage gravy over fries. Where were the cheese curds and the delicious light brown gravy?! No cheese of any sort. What a joke! Totally NOT poutine. Stars for the Mac and Cheese and beer because that was the only enjoyable thing in front of my face.  In closing - We spent around $60.00 on overpriced bland food. The tip is automatically added to your bill at check out which pissed me off. I'll tip what I WANT to tip, not what you're TELLING me to tip. Patrons also taxed for beer, non alcoholic beverage and food. Charge after charge on the receipt that's sent via text. I realize we all pay for it one way or another, but seeing all those little charges annoyed the crap out of. Especially because my food sucked.   What an underwhelming, expensive experience!
This is my late night joint. Fire biscuit selection. Staff is fantastic and loving. Top 5 pics In Phoenix handdddds down.

I have been dying to try out this unique place after all the amazing photos I have seen on Instagram.  First of all I love the hours, even through the mid week they are open late!  Driving through the downtown neighborhood to get here is kinda sketchy in the middle of not so decent area. So don't be scared your going the right way haha  Walking up to the Welcome diner it was so sweet how it's all set up! You can sit inside but only if there's room, it a bar top for 3 people. However, outside is where the fun is, the hanging lights, the awesome community tables are everywhere. The menu is short and to the point. I ordered the fried green tomato sandwich and the Sunrise. The fried green sandwich was a little hit to bite for the first few minutes but wow, how amazing it was! The sunrise was so delicious  with the chorizo, I will have to try the other choices next time. To wash it down I got the house made ginger beer which was so refreshing I wanted more!  If you come here and don't mind waiting for a few extra long minutes for your food it won't disappoint!
This is my favorite place to come sit outside. Really delicious food. Love coming late night for whiskey sours too. Staff is always awesome.

The food is awesome. I love the biscuit sandwiches particularly the bumblebee. The cocktails are unique and delicious.  Last night I tried the fried green tomato sandwich and it was out of this world. I took the advice of the person taking my order and added bacon. it was so amazing I want one right now.   I also had the mac and cheese which was amazing. I have not had a bad thing here.  And unlike a lot of the downtown establishments the hipsters working here smile and say thank you and stuff. so refreshing. thanks for being awesome!

Stopped by here late sat night (thanks Yelp fam)and the place was buzzing. However we loved the vibe and the whole concept. It was a perfect night to sit outside. They do have indoor seating but very limited. The crowd was very hipster/bohemian/eclectic, I think that covers it. We even sat with a table full of complete strangers (cause that's what I do) they were a fun group of folks.   We decided on the Mac and cheese along with the biscuits and gravy. They were both delicious and the biscuits were sooooo good. Oh and the homemade ginger beer (non alch) was really good too. Unfortunately we were to full to try the beignets, but will def try next time.  Overall this is a place I would go out of my way to go enjoy some good food and some good people. Staff was very personable and great at making suggestions on what to try!  Neighborhood is def sketch as some Yelpers have commented on... But we no scared..lol

Loved my first time here ! Got here by 6pm which was perfect because we beat the rush. I would not want to be here when there is a line, but if you have the time and want a leisurely night out a line is worth the wait even so. However, with that being said do not.come here starving because you do have a bit of a wait for your food, understandable though the place is tiny and the food comes out incredibly fresh !!   We got the fried green tomato sandwich with bacon added it was so good with great textures and flavors..bread a bit too crisp (blackened) at some points but a unique and yummy dish. We also had the bumblebee biscuit sandwich which was really good, the chicken was moist, crunchy , but not filling enough despite it being heavy. We also got the happy hour pork fries, prettty good, but I'll get plain fries next time, liked the slaw and the sauce on top.  Food good, staff was very helpful, local beer, and cool atmosphere.   I would come here again for sure.  I had to deduct one star only because of the bathroom situation ...I'm borderline germaphobe and I almost couldn't stand the bathroom. It's a unisex , airline bathroom size stall with a sliding/folding door, that is right off the kitchen line !! Eek, kinda crazy, just avoid needing a restroom if you are a germaphobe, and even more so if you're extreme about it.   Welcome Diner ,you're great I hope to visit in the summer to keep the spirit alive !

Solid 5. Totally chill attitude from the guys behind the counter serving up killer food. To start: an Old Fashion for me and a Candy Corn signature for the wife. We split not one but two orders of the bacon and cheese fries, and had the biscuit w chicken, gravy, and bacon. All fantastic. Go here anytime if you got a hankering for comfort food after a hangover or just because. We'll be back soon. And we're bringing friends.
Great food with custom cocktails.  Family friendly and good local people who are friendly running the place.
Got the Carol, brussel sprouts, and insanely delicious mac. Melted with different kinds of cheese and blow torched to a perfect crisp. Deeeeeeelish

The Little Bird was amazing! I prefer my Mac n Cheese baked, but the portion size exceeded my expectations. Louisiana Pure Crystal Hot Sauce makes everything taste better tho! The Hurricane was perfect and the Wiskey Sour meh. Will be back to taste the jackfruit fries, a burger and beignets!

This place is such a great little gem located in central Phoenix. I have been here numerous times and the food is outstanding. My favorite is the PB&J burger, it's not something I would normally order but sometimes you have to take chances on food.   If you are looking to sit inside the tiny trailer that only fits about 10 make sure to get there when they first open. The place gets really packed, but there is additional seating outside. If you a first timer I would recommend sitting inside because the staff is great along with their drinks.

I tried the pull jackfruits po' boy(vegan) the first time, loved it! and the fish po' boy the second time and oh boy was I happy  with the fish po' boy since I'm a  pescatarian, it was probably the best fish sandwich I've had. I want to go again and try everything I can eat. Also please try the honey soaked beignets they serve so you can die happy.
Love their burgers.. Great atmosphere .. I suggest you guys come early to beat the rush.. The peanut butter burger is amazing..

I saved my 400th Yelp review for this Phoenix gem. This is one of the first places I drag out-of-towners... usually for brunch. And when I have brunch at Welcome Diner, I usually cannot resist ordering the same thing, the Holy Puerco. Pulled pork, cheesy grit cake, pure heaven.  The best thing about this place, especially if you get one of the rare seats inside the luncheonette, is that it feels like you own the place. The staff cooking and carrying on are an arm's length away. I love the communal "Hurricane!" cheer that resounds whenever somebody orders one of these fresh-squeezed fruit cocktails. Welcome Diner is one of those places that the ambiance overwhelms you so suddenly that you are drawn in to the fun atmosphere... and though you may not be a morning drinker, you can easily be convinced that it's time for a beer or cocktail with breakfast.  I can't say enough about the wonderful poutine here. Other places may just smother their fries in brown gravy, but this place used the white breakfast sausage gravy. Although the cheese curds get a little lost, this is a great way to eat poutine! I also like their choice of either sausage gravy or mushroom gravy if you order the biscuits and gravy (or, do half-and-half, if you must).  The crowd that dines here is cool, the staff is righteous, and the food is spot on. If you want something funky and delicious and scratch-made, you would do well to pound a path to this wiggity-wack little diner in the middle of a dusty old Phoenix neighborhood. Off the beaten path, as it were...

Food was delicious. Got the sunrise with chorizo, and my husband got a burger that he really liked. It took a while (45 min) to get the food, but I was understanding considering how small their kitchen and cooktop were.. And how busy they were (always a good sign). We also ordered a dessert at the same time we ordered dinner, and FORTY minutes AFTER we finished our dinner (a total of an hour and a half of waiting), still nothing. I pulled our waiter aside and asked him about them, he nicely said, " they're the next order up." Ok.. I was Pissed off, but I let it go. Another 15 minutes goes by, 4 OTHER orders to different tables that got there an hour after we did... NOTHING. Got up and left. He watched us leave and said nothing. A lot of distractions happening, and with the prices they have, they need to deliver not only with taste (which I will say, they did) but with service also. Just because you serve good food does not mean you can make people wait for over an hour and a half for it. Not that worth it.

Welcome diner was very satisfying! We pulled up and I was like crap this place is either gonna be really good or really bad. We got the bumblebee and big jack with a side of Mac and cheese (added bacon). Wasn't a huge fan of Mac and cheese... It tasted a bit strange. The bumblebee was amazing with added hot sauce. I didn't try the big Jack because he finished it in two bites which meant it was pretty good! Best cheat meal there ever was - minus the Mac and cheese. It was a bit more expensive than I thought it would be... 47 with tip.

Favorite place in Phoenix,  looking forward to the new location for more seating in the Garfield. The entire crew who make up welcome are truly wonderful and know how to make you feel at home. And obviously the food and drinks are the best in Phoenix.

We stopped in at 1am expecting to grub on some good late night food and head home.  We entered the dining area, were seated, and a few minutes later were brought some water.  After that...nothing.  We waited about 20 minutes (my wife said it was more like 30) for someone to take our order, while others came in and were seated.  When we noticed a waitress begin to take the order of a couple that came in after us, we just left.  I understand it's a super laid back restaurant, with lots of "hey bro" being exchanged between the staff and the regulars (they also called some guy Mas Puto) but maybe they should also focus on their core business- serving food.  We were forced to eat jack in the box.

I'd like to preface with the fact that we came here after First Friday. My partner and I had just finished vending and were looking for a way to celebrate the end of the night. We're old birds that don't stay up very late, so late night dining is fairly foreign to us, especially in Phoenix. We yelped and found Welcome Diner. Our company was delighted that I had mentioned it as she had been here previously. An antsy me took that as a good sign and didn't even think about needing to wait in line.   When we first walked up to the diner, we noticed a huge amount of people sitting outside, a very long line, and a few groups standing around. My partner and I joined the groups of people standing around trying to look for somewhere else to go. We really didn't feel like waiting in line. We couldn't get ahold of our company to switch gears, so we ended up just standing in line. When they arrived, we were reassured that the wait would be worth it. We waited 56 minutes in line... FIFTY SIX MINUTES. There had to be approximately ~13 people in front of us. When we finally got to the front of the line, we had to wait another 10 before the guy that was just sitting there took out order. The kitchen looked really busy, but definitely the long line was a little more than they can handle it seemed. I'm not one to wait too long for food, so this was just a miserable experience for me. I promise I'll move on from the wait times soon...but we literally waited another 48 minutes for out food to come out.   Moving on...  Pulled Jackfruit Po'Boy - 3.5/5 - Jackfruit was WAY too saucy and salty. Just a reminder to everyone and anyone that makes pulled jackfruit with BBQ...a little bit of BBQ goes a long way. You don't need to drench it. This made the "toasted" much too soggy for my liking. I was told that this would be the best pulled jackfruit I'd ever had... and I believed it because of the line, but I was sorta disappointed.   Mac & Cheese - 5/5 - okay, this was really damn delicious, enough said.  Jackfruit Fries - 4/5 I think I would've preferred this as my choice dish over the Po'boy. The fries just went better than the baguette   All in all- I really hated that I had to wait so long for this meal. If I had not been with good company and company that I had not seen for ages...I wouldn't have waited. I wasn't amazed with the food, but I'd give it another try, so long as I did not have to wait two hours.
This place was "eh". I really don't understand all the hype. The chicken I ordered was over cooked and dry. The food took forever and the service was not something to brag about.

I love the atmosphere more than anything else.  As a visitor to Phoenix, I am not use to this heat but the calm warm nights are the perfect setting for outdoor seating (though there is a small indoor diner bar). There are plenty of tables, lights and a gatorade water cooler to satisfy that thirst.  I got the Big Jim and a side of Brussels sprouts ($14 total).  Brussels Sprouts are cut large and I felt they could have been cooked down a bit more or cut smaller for my liking.  The Big Jim on the other hand was quite tasty.  Fried Chicken, Biscuit and Gravy.  How good is that?  Oh, there is bacon and cheese too....damn. I would ask for extra gravy on the side next time.  Watermelon on the side was a perfect pairing to this rich dish.  Compostable cup, +1

As good as it gets as far as diners go.  I'm not usually considered to be a hipster, but it might rub off on me if I spent more time her.  Great crowd hanging out eating delicious food.  Tiny enough that you HAVE to talk to the staff, they're right next to you.  Unless you sit outside.  That might be fun, too.  I've never actually been to a diner that had a liquor license, so have a hurricane with your brunch.

Such a cool hidden spot! The restaurant environment was awesome. Definitely not what I expected when looking from the outside in, but the amazing food and menu options make all your doubts go away for sure. I had the KoKo biscuit and that was very good. The chipotle sauce is what makes it. When seeing "biscuit" I was unsure if it was going to enough to fill me but when it came out it was a big enough biscuit to fill you up! The entrees are greatly portioned. My mom ordered Jambalaya which she loved saying it was a "blast of flavors" and different from what she's had before. She and I also shared the delicious French fries (great size to share!). And to top it all off the beignets were literally fresh out the fryer! Overall amazing place! Wanna go back!

Amazing diner, great locally sourced selections that change out daily/weekly. Small location with limited seating, but great if you get there early. Try their alcoholic special drinks, love the selection and it changes often. Ask about the history of the place, awesome story!

Love the atmosphere at this place, and the fact that the food is great, too, makes this one of our favorite neighborhood haunts. With just a few counter seats inside the trailer that houses this diner-style joint, you may want to order through the window and post up at one of the many outdoor tables, especially if you're with a group. Try a cocktail to start while you wait for your order - they're strong but delicious, typically served in mason jars or goblets, which matches the laid back vibe of the place.   There are a number of great dishes here, but among the best are the Fried Green Tomato sandwich and the poutine. The tomatoes are perfectly fried, light and crispy, with greasy flavor enhanced by the slightly sweet zest of corn relish and the subtle heat of chipotle sauce. Served on toasted local bread, it's got just the right amount of crunch and flavor. Plus, it's unlike any sandwich you'll see on other menus around town. The poutine is also a must-try. Served with country-style gravy and perfectly distributed melted cheese on top of thin, crispy fries, it's not a traditional poutine but one of the most delicious versions in the Valley. If gravy's not your thing, the fries are just as delicious on their own.   Other highlights include the fried chicken sandwiches, which come in a number of variations featuring ingredients like honey, country gravy, and buffalo sauce. Although the biscuits they're served atop can be a bit dense, the chicken is perfectly moist and flavorful and never too greasy. The side of watermelon completes this southern-themed dish. And, if you're a burger lover, try one here. The meat is well-cooked with great flavor and the patties are perfectly portioned.   The service at Welcome Diner is casual but friendly and efficient. You'll get real attentiveness at the counter and maybe some small talk. Don't expect anything too formal - this is definitely a neighborhood joint, but you can tell the staff takes pride in their place of employment. And why wouldn't they? After all, Welcome Diner is a true neighborhood gem.

Retro setting, organic food, and friendly service.  FOOD Well, it's a diner so you have burgers, fries, grilled cheese, etc to choose from. The burgers have always been cooked as I like them (whatever your preference is...) The fries are organic potatoes, cut daily- sometimes a little on the brown side in appearance but they always taste good.  Grilled cheese is great- not too greasy like some places.  There are sodas and iced tea to drink- both organic.  ENVIRONMENT 8  seats inside and outdoor seating availible. I would recommend eating outside if it is nice- sometimes inside is crowded and everyone can hear everyone else's business.   OTHER Bring cash, no cards accepted. If your service is good- tip them. They are really nice!

I was pleasantly surprised. It has a cute ambiance and very tasty locally sourced food. Even the beer and wine, I noticed, were local. I got the Champion burger and my husband got the No Way Jose and both were delicious. A thick, perfectly cooked patti, with perfect seasoning and compliments. I really loved the bacon jam on the Champion. I'd totally go back!

Food is great. Food is 5 stars. Service is meh. 3 stars for service. The gripe on the service is probably more to my personal taste. The place is very hipster, customers and servers. I think it would be difficult to be an apathetic hipster and provide quality customer service. Nobody was rude or anything, just blah. It certainly isn't going to stop me from being a repeat customer.

When we got there it was late at night.(almost their close) and they were out of everything. No problem they asked us what we wanted and they made substitutes and the food was delicious. Wow. I mean yes it was late night eats but I wouls get this at any time of the day.  Looove it.

The Welcome Diner is, in a word, welcoming! The folks who work there are super friendly and great to talk to. It's a small and intimate little place so expect to have some cool conversations with other patrons.   Be prepared with cash and a sweatband (or five!). In the summer heat, it's a bit hot in there, but everyone looks a little sexier with a bead or two of sweat on their forehead, no?   I got a grilled cheese (made with lettuce, tomato & bread n butter pickles) and fresh cut fries that are to die for. Way better than In N' Out's just so you know. And the chocolate chip cookie. Oh how its nutmeg danced on my taste buds! I liked it. A lot a lot.  They get everything they can from local & organic growers, have phenomenally yummilicious bread and even Mexican Coca-Cola. Hooray for real sugar cane! Too bad I realized this after I ordered a diet coke. I'll splurge on some calories if it means I get to drink from a glass bottle any day.  I'm so glad my friend showed me this place. It is a definite gem and I will definitely be back. When it cools down, I may even bring the pooch along and sit outside near the kiddie pool. Fun!   If you haven't yet, grab a friend and try this joint out pronto.

The people are really cool.  Excellent food made from local ingredients. The chicken biscuit sandwich is yummy. Also, must indulge in the poutine. Fun place with lots of misters running over the picnic tables outside which kept us cool. Must check this place out for yourself.

Everyone is very friendly and helpful. The Food was Great, my fiance had a welcome burger and the just custom made me a breakfast burger. The chef came in and made a burger he had just created and gave us a taste. Would totally drive down from LA again for another bite

I'm kind of a big deal around here...lol The fried green tomato on a biscuit with an egg....what....that's right...go there....orgasmic flavor explosions....everybody here is like family...great concept great people and amazing food. Just reminds me of a queens New York diner with way better food. Chef Michael Babcock is nothing short of genius. Ask for the "David" and your life will be changed...open til 2...get your fix. See you there. Big up to Wayne, matt, peter, rob, kyle, and the rest of my FAM...

We just had a wonderful diner at our new favorite local place. The food was very good, I had the welcome burger and my wife had the chicken on a biscuit that had aioli sauce on it. We shared a pulled pork fries that was delicious. My burger was one of the better ones that I have had. My wife had a Ginger Beer (NA) that was so good she had another. Friendly staff and great service. Seating is outside a diner with a walk up window. We had a great time and will be back.
Great food. Great drinks. Open late so if ya do go put and still want to get food ya can. Check out the sluricane. It's a very tasty potent drink.

Make sure not to zone out while you're driving to the Welcome Diner or you'll zip right past it (as my friend and I did).  It's right on the corner of 10th Street & Roosevelt in a cute little red and white dining car.  There are a few parking spaces behind the diner on 10th Street.  I would check the hours, as I think I was told differently than the hours posted in the other review.  My friend and I went to the diner on a Saturday afternoon and were able to get seats inside at the tiny counter.  I'm sure as it gets warmer, those will be harder to come by and that when the weather is nice, most people sit outside.  It is indeed a tiny space on the inside and half the seats have a direct view into the kitchen area, which is kind of homey.  I'm pretty small, so the size inside wasn't an issue for me, but claustrophobes and bigger people might feel squished.  I ordered a hamburger and fries and my friend got an egg sandwich.  The burger was pretty good, but relatively small in comparison to what's generally served at restaurants.  If you're really hungry or a big eater, you'll probably want to go for the double burger.  The fries were good - nice and crisp.  My friend was pretty happy with her egg sandwich but unhappy with her cup of water, which was apparently pretty bad even for tap water.  They have a bunch of organic sodas, along with Coke and Diet Coke, if you're like me and can't wash down a burger and fries with anything but a carbonated beverage.  Overall, I thought it was a pretty cool place and will definitely return with more friends in tow.  (Possibly for one of their movie nights...movies + tasty food = a good time).  Bonus points for their helping with the downtown rejuvenation while also supporting local businesses (Schreiner's, Mary Coyle's).
Great neighborhood location, great laid back environment (outdoor seating only), extremely friendly staff, and a deliciously unique menu. We'll be coming here often!
As a student, late night munchies happen all the time. Welcome diner always cures.

Went to celebrate with family and friends and had Delicious Bloody Mary's and feasted on some good ole homemade food for the Soul!  Holy Puerco is The headliner followed by the Bumble bee !  Had a bite of the  peanut butter burger and it was delicious!   Come check them out!   Cool spot!

Going over the reviews I'm beginning to think that I'm either crazy or just show up on off nights. The food is alright but the service is so bad that if you told me it was a gimmick I would not be surprised. Rude self righteous hipsters who treat people like idiots. I would bet money that they are the slowest restaurant in Phoenix. The slow service and the bad attitudes are the only things consistent about welcome dinner. They are constantly running out of menu items. Again I feel that this is a hipster gimmick but who knows.   If you like to sit outside and enjoy being treated like "you don't get it" while you wait 45 minutes for your food then hop on your fixy and head on down to Welcome Diner. Where food and service come second to how cool they are.

Tried the fried tomato sandwich, jackfruit sandwich, fries, and squash blossoms... all absolutely fantastic! We also really enjoyed the biscuit with jam for dessert. Everything about this place was great, there was plenty of parking and it wasn't crowded on a Saturday night. The chef and staff were friendly, funny, and so much fun. The diner lived up to its name and if I had one last/first/only meal in Phoenix it would be here.

I have been going here for years... And this is my first review ever and it had to be for my favorite place in Phoenix. Everything on the menu is fabulous!! Even the PB&B burger that I never thought I would try... Amazing. Their slaw and Brussels sprouts are on point!!!
This place is pretty awesome. Poutin  is great! Very hipster style atmosphere. Mostly outside seating. Located in a little neighborhood. Rough to sit outside during summer months. Friendly staff.
Great little diner. I've lived right down the block and never stopped in. When I found out they had food until 2am I stopped it. Love everything about this place!

May I just say that the service and food here is awesome?!  I'm in the industry myself and don't like going into a restaurant so close to closing, but we were hungry for good food and they just so happened to be open. The service and food we received was very good quality. They serve burgers provided by Niman Ranch and have an open bar. John Luther (Awesome name, btw!) took our order and was very friendly the entire time. The three of us ordered the No Way Jose Burger which came with a choice of fries or cole slaw. The price is pretty reasonable: $10.75 for the burger and fries. We each also ordered 3 Hess Cream Ales and 3 burgers for a grand total of $55.82.   The atmosphere was very chill and the clientele, for the hour, was very friendly. We will definitely be coming back here again soon! Especially since it's only a few blocks away!  Also, shout out to Dreya(?), our chef for the night. Great job!

Was in Phoenix to meet up with some friends and we settled on this place for our Friday evening dinner plans.  Location & Aesthetics -- Located just on the corner of E Roosevelt & N 10th St. in Phoenix. Parking is limited to the street or in the small area behind the diner though I think the diner staff park there. Seating is mostly outdoors.  There is seating within the diner but it's small so if you're coming with a crowd, then I'd recommend dining outside.   There are string bulb lights outside with powerful misters, and large tables and chairs.  It is sandy outside so you may want to wear shoes versus flip flops.   Outside area was very clean and well kept.  Tables were clean as well. Noise level is nonexistent except for the passing vehicle or two from the street.    Service -- Staff are very friendly and helpful explaining items from the menu including drinks.  Upon arriving, you order at the little window at the side of the diner.  Provide then with your order, pay, then go sit.  Your drinks and food will be brought out to you.  Menu -- Lots of available menus right next to the order window - drinks and meal menus.  Menus were easy to understand with small descriptions of the dishes or drinks.    Food -- I had the Welcome burger which didn't disappoint.  Made to my liking as requested and to cooked to perfection, it was mouthwatering, flavorful, well seasoned, and juicy. I had a side of fries with fresh cut, cooked well, hot, and slightly drizzled with salt along with a chopped seasoning (don't know the name) on it but it certainly added extra flavor. For my drink, I order a couple of Hurricanes which also was made to perfection -- not too sweet and not too tart with accurate proportions of rum and other integral ingredients.  Overall, very happy with the place, staff and terrific food.  Will definitely recommend and would love to return to try their fried chicken with biscuits plus their poutine fries which I spied other folks eating!
Love this place!  Great biscuits and gravy sandwiches.  I wish that they had more indoor seating for the summertime, but that is the only thing I would change.  Pro tip: come hungry

Omg! Please try their JACKFRUIT FRIES They Are the best I have never had! Vegan on top of it :) So So So Good! I promise you wont be disappointed;) they have the best patio and drink too their homemade ginger beer is so refreshing and unique give both of this thing a try!Will be back for sure!
Amazing service, food and drinks! My friends and I had a great time, they were playing great music and we had good conversation with the bartenders and even the cook. Will be back soon!

After leaving a so-so review of 3 stars due to issues with service, I was contacted by the GM of the restaurant, Wayne, to discuss my experience. He apologized and offered to send a gift card my way. I was totally blown away and impressed! This restaurant and their staff really do care about your experience, and I'm happy to say that I will be coming back and telling my friends to go too. Huge thumbs up to Welcome Diner!   BTW: Fried Green Tomato sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had!

I'm only in Phoenix for a few days but I'm tellin ya I will be coming back here before I leave. Hospitality: the best. Ever. Food: I tried the welcome burger medium rare AND IT WAS SO GOOD. Definitely gonna try the Mac and cheese with chorizo next time. The people that work here might as well be family; they're a really tight knit group and we had two of the employees come talk to us--Mike and Wayne: really cool chill guys. You might at first be weirded out by the location (it's in the middle of a bunch of houses) but it adds to the homely feeling that I experienced while at the welcome diner.

Love the new location! Great atmosphere, delicious food and yummy cocktails!!! The jackfruit fries topped with purple coleslaw is one of my favorites. The brussel sprouts and wonderful. The yellow jacket cocktail is visually appealing and delicious.

Ummm BOMB! I had the Big jim? Hopefully thats what it's called it was a biscuit, with fried chicken, and gravy with syrup. The chicken was so awesome so tender! The wait staff was awesome as well!!!! Thanks for a great time!!

This place is the perfect place to go on date night. Not too loud and very urban/ hipster setting. The only draw backs, which is why I'm removing a Star, are the seating is very limited and over dirt and the chairs are uncomfortable. The food and service is great though!

This place is fantastic!  Stumbled upon it on Yelp.    Very small, intimate indoor seating and plenty of outdoor seating.    The juice was fresh, the coffee fair trade, the Big Jim, a mountain of fried chicken and gravy.    Plus all the dudes that worked there were super friendly.

I would have given 4.5 stars, but, you get it.  Loved my experience at Welcome. The casual nature was inviting and the food was outstanding. The cocktails were slightly underwhelming, but overall, I can't wait to come back for a second visit!

Welcome Diner in its latest incarnation is a gem. Their new hours make them far more accessible for dinner service, but you'll still want to plan on showing up relatively late, at least during the summer, as most of their seating is outside.  The food here is the star, but the workers and cooks are all having a great time, really genuine and fun, and overall make the experience even better.   The Port of Call burger is exactly what you want: perfectly cooked, coated in cheese and onions and whatever else, and the type of meal that will leave you just barely too full.  The fried chicken sandwich is a thing of beauty, if you can unhinge your jaw to take it on. Get it with melted cheese, and go even further by tacking on gravy and bacon, if you think your heart can handle it.  The fries are fantastic as well. It's a bit pricey, but the quality of ingredients loads the food with flavor and makes it well worth it. They also have some amazing specials, and: their biscuits. Their biscuits are a thing of beauty, either with honey on them, or as part of the chicken sandwiches; they're simply perfect.  They're just a hop-skip off the 7th St. I-10 exit, and well worth trying out.

I can't begin to describe how cool this place is. Imagine growing up with your best buds, and you all happen to be amazing cooks. These guys love what they do, and food is their craft. Everything is made from scratch and taste so good. You could literally order anything and you will be mind blown. My girl ordered the bumblebee. I was so happy when she was too full to eat it all lol. Best biscuits ever. Thanks for the great food! They also have really good drinks, their ginger beer is house made and totally worth it.

This is my 4th visit, 1st time eating there.  Went on Sept 25th around 630pm.  It was alittle warm and surprised there was no misters on.  My wife came with.  We ordered 2 mix drinks, shared the Champion Burger and fries(very good) and shared the macaroni and cheese with tomato confiti.  It came out to 36$ plus 5$ tip.  My wife loved the macaroni, I thought it was alittle bland, maybe it was the confiti.  So far on my visits, I've had the hamburgers and chicken biscuit with gravy, all very good.  We both love the ambiance, the outdoor seating and the friendlyness of the staff and customers.  It's only 5 blocks from our house so it's very close.

Atmosphere just right and such warm friendly staff. Really accommodating. We felt very well taken cared of. Good stuff: Eggs over easy were perfect, smooth grits. Waffle batter is sweetened so some might opt for no powdered sugar, and a little doughey. They were able to do Omelette as a Scramble which was so nice. Area is funky but all was well with our car. .

Wow. This place is amazing. Full disclosure, I'd had a few beers before stopping in, but I stand by my statement. I was expecting the usual greasy 1am fare and was blown away. A friend and I shared the fried green tomato sandwich and the grilled cheese. Both were outstanding, but I'd have to say the tomato was the standout. The sourdough bread they were served on was a treat in itself. We finished up with the beignets with local honey and powdered sugar which were also insanely delicious. A little different than what I've had in New Orleans, but c'mon, deep fried dough and sugar. You can't go wrong. The honey gave it kind of an Arizona twist. The staff was really friendly and came by twice to ask us how our food was. I'll definitely be back!! Gotta have some biscuits next time.
I would eat here everyday if I could afford it. Big Jim is ammmazzzing and the iced tea is perfectly made !
The world needs more places like this. Honest yummy creative food in a casual chill environment. Definitely coming back for more!

We went to the Welcome Diner on "First Friday" earlier this month.  We'll be back for sure.  It's a very casual atmosphere with some limited indoor seating along a counter and more seating outside.  We each enjoyed our meals.  I eat vegan and loved the Vegan Po'Boy; my son is a vegetarian and he loved the grilled cheese sandwich; and my wife, the carnivore of the family, really liked her fried chicken sandwich.  They try to use local foods.  The staff was great, as was the music they were playing.

We actually came here through Yelp's help, looking for a diner or a brunch place close to the Az Science Center. Dont be deceived or be scared by the neighborhood, it is not the suburbs, it is within a residential area in Downtown Phoenix. This place is a cross between a food truck that mutated into a tiny diner: the inside has 9 seats and a bar and their kitchen and outside has this "picnic" feel which has tables with umbrellas and chairs. Our family of 5 (with kids ages 8, 7 and 5) chose to sit inside. We were there upon opening, the waiter and cook (Wayne and Clay, if I remember correctly) were very attentive to our family's needs. My hubby got the Big Jim. He said he loved his food except for the biscuit, but he said hes not really into biscuits. But the chicken and gravy were tasty and well-seasoned. Had the fish po' boy and it was juicy! My kids and I were passing our plates, stuffing our faces with each bite of their grilled cheese with rustic tomatoes sandwich, sunrise and my po boy. My 5 year old son whos a really picky eater almost finished his sanwich and thats a lot for him! Im giving Welcome Diner 4 stars, I wish you have more beverage choices for kids like freshly squeezed OJ? Nevertheless, we will be back!

Honestly, my favorite place to eat late night in Phoenix. LOVE the set-up with kiosk-type ordering and picnic tables, reminds me of little food joints in the pacific northwest.  I ordered a burger and mac & cheese. Can't go wrong with any of the options. The mac & cheese is some of the best I've ever had!

Great little place with fantastic food and drinks. The local hipsters seem to dig it, but it's a family-friendly neighborhood joint too. Small bar inside and picnic tables on the outside patio encourage a community atmosphere. We ended up having a nice conversation with a guy who sat down at our table. :)

My friends and I came here to celebrate a birthday. Once 7pm rolls around, more people start to arrive - available seating and parking reduces dramatically. Also, I would come before 7 on a Wednesday to take advantage of happy hour 5-7pm.   Our orders took a while to come out. I ordered the Big Jim [$11], which was great. Fried chicken, bacon, gravy, biscuits, cheese. With random pieces of watermelon. The poutine [$9] just with the  gravy on top was meh ahahah. The fries weren't that great.   The beignets were pretty good, except all of the honey sauce pooled into the bottom so the bottom beignets were overly drenched and way too sweet.   The neighborhood is kind of sketchy, but Welcome Diner is on the same street as JoBot and Melt, so you can walk down and enjoy your time there.

I wasn't keen on the idea of eating at a hipster dinner know for its alcohol, but I was proved wrong for sure when we sat down. First of all the vibe here is what is (hipster) but very happy friendly people both behind the counter and what I would suspect are regulars. The employees were very helpful and patient with me taking my time to order, as you have to walk up to one window to do so, and there was a line. So I took a chance on their recommendation and tried the fake pulled pork sandwich. I never even had jackfruit before, so I knew even if it tasted bad it would be a new experience. Wrong again, it was amazing, the flavor the texture all on point. Just wow it almost makes me want to go back to eating pork to try the real one. I mean I've never tasted anything like this before. A must try if you visit

I would be lying if I said this diner didn't influence me to move to the Garfield district. This is my absolute favorite place. I used to drive all over the valley depending on what mood I was in, and now I pretty much just go to the Welcome Diner. They have about 9 seats inside and quite a bit of patio seating. They have a few nice big outdoor heaters too.  Some things I love  -Excellent quality food sourced from local vendors -Amazing amazing drinks. They make their own bitters, grenadine, squeeze their own lime juice  and even have fresh herbs to put in. Each one I've seen made is with love. -Good service, fun atmosphere -Almost everything is made from scratch -Specials that are (always delicious) experiments, not leftovers. -Catfish Fridays (Try the sampler!)   I would say price wise it's not necessarily cheap, but not expensive. Average plate will run you about $10, but considering the quality and atmosphere I have no problem paying it!   Favorite dishes- PB&B burger Bacon Blue burger Veggie Stallion (housemade edamame and mushroom veggie burger with housemade ricotta) Red beans and rice with sausage Grilled cheese on a housemade biscuit. Try the holy puerco!
This place is great! The burgers are amazing and the coleslaw is fantastic. 4 stars because it's pretty pricey, but worth it for a fabulous meal.

This was my boyfriend and i's go to spot after I picked him up from the airport. But now that they moved locations and changed up their menu, they took a lot of our faves off of it! I loved their beignets, luxardo (I think that was the name) salad, and a few more I can't remember the names of. Still a good place, but it would be better with the old menu!

Went back for dinner the other night.  Party of four for drinks and food. It was great ... We had The Koko, Fried Green Tomato sandwich, Avacado Po'Boy and Little Birdy. Rounded out with Carol Fries and Brussels Sprouts. Mmmmmm, Mmmmmm Good.  Added some drinks and friendly banter from Morgan and a good night was had by all!    Thanks Welcome Diner for a great night!

The food is PHENOMENAL. My wife and I STILL talk about our amazing brunch. The Welcome Diner is an adorable renovated trailer tucked away in a quiet neighborhood. Outdoor seating (bring sunscreen, it can get hot). Customer service is fantastic, these guys have no qualms about discussing their food and fav dishes in depth if you're feeling torn between dishes.  Hands down the best brunch I've ever had. Inventive, powerful flavors, generous portions!

Welcome Diner, talk about fantastic! Browsed around and found this diner, in a neighborhood many would consider not welcoming, they could not be more wrong. The homemade biscuit, made with love and of course incredible honey, just delicious down to the last crumb. A welcoming staff and food that can leave you stuffed! Will definitely keep coming back and invite all who will join. If you your a local you need to eat here, if your visiting phoenix, you need to eat here! As always my yelpers, eat, drink, explore, and buy local!

Man, to be brutally honest, I was a bit disappointed!  I had heard about this place for about 1.5 years now.  My buddy at work told me about it, as well as a couple of my Yelp friends have reviewed it.  It sounded like a cool concept, it was open late, and some of the food items sounded fantastic.  Me and my buddy had some time to kill before picking up a friend at the airport, so we decided to stop by for some late night grub.  I browsed the menu for a bit and decided to go with an order of poutine, and a Bumblebee sandwich.  Total for those 2 things was a little over 20 bucks!  STEEP!  Anyways, here is how they were.............  Poutine-  These were some fries topped with sausage gravy and cheddar cheese.  A bit different than a "traditional poutine", but close enough?  The fries themselves seemed a bit overcooked, like they were left in the fryer an extra 20 seconds or so.  They were a bit brown, but not really "crispy".  The sausage gravy tasted ok, and the melted cheddar was kind of "meh".  It wasn't a horrible plate of fries, but no way in hell does it justify the $9.00 price tag.   There were actually fries left on the plate (That rarely happens!) when we were done!  I would not get them again.  Bumblebee-  This was a biscuit sandwich which came with chicken, mustard, honey and pickles.  The chicken was fried proper and tasted alright, but the portion was skimp and the texture of the chicken was just a bit "off".  The biscuit itself was incredibly large, but a bit dry.  I had a similar experience up in Portland at Pine State Biscuits.  Rave reviews, but when it came to the biscuit, the biscuit was sub par.  What's up with that?  It's your signature item, but unless you drown it with gravy/sauce/mustard/something else, the biscuit just isn't that great!   The pickles may have been the best part of the sandwich.  Lame, right?  I ate the whole thing, but was not truly satisfied.  For $10.00, I wouldn't buy it again.  Overall, not that impressed!  Service was friendly, and the joint is a cool little spot, but the food is just ok and the price is really expensive (IMO).  Once was enough and I highly doubt that I will be back.  There are just so many other places I would rather drop $20.00 at for a meal.  Exactly what 2 stars is..."Meh...I've experienced better!"
Love this place. Somewhere you can grab a bite in the evening or late night and the quality is always the best. Top notch people and top notch food.

LOVE! LOVE! LOVE WELCOME DINER. Their food and drinks are amazing. They have one of the best hamburgers I have ever had and their Hurricane is ON POINT.  Love spending happy hour on their awesome patio :)

Back when Welcome Diner was just burgers, hot dogs, and giant chocolate chip cookies served on greasy paper plates speckled with ants (or "protein sprinkles" as momma called 'em) it was simply a welcome diner. Now it's so much more than that.  Have you ever watched someone hand you a glass of local red wine blend through a trailer window? How about a Sazerac? Well, it's time to change that. (Here I am assuming you said no. If you said yes, please un-see this section and continue.) When you start your meal with a southern throwback cocktail and finish it with homemade beignets, you best believe that whatever comes in between is going to knock your socks off. This is fine because you're probably sitting outside, so the dress code is pretty nonexistent, anyway.  My crew ordered the three most talked-about items on the menu. The peanut butter burger is the safe option + a bit of "flare" that is essentially peanut sauce. The meat is delicious, as is the bun and everything else between it. We also had the Carol, which was a unique BBQ pulled pork & biscuit sandwich with slaw... a mustard-y spin on a stack of down-home delicious. Last but DON'T YOU EVER THINK LEAST, the Bumblebee fried chicken & biscuit sandwich with honey and amazing b&b pickles. Us Southerners opted to scoot the mustard to the side and let the honey shine, but you could probably do anything to this fried chicken and it would still be incr-edible. Just get it. Get a bucket of it.  Now let's talk beignets. (Don't you wish people said that to you more often? You're welcome.) You can get them with powdered sugar & honey or peanut butter & jam. The waitress literally said the pb&j beignets were her favorite thing in the world, and then quickly added her daughter as a frontrunner to the favorites list. Not knowing her taste in dessert, or daughters for that matter, I trusted her immediately and was thrilled with the combination of light, lemony fried dough juxtaposed with fresh berries and creamy peanut butter. Ain't nothing wrong with the classic, but damn it, it's 2014. The matrimony between pb&j and beignet shouldn't even be questioned.  TL;DR - The Welcome Diner isn't just tasty, it's soulful and lovely. Bring an insatiable appetite and leave with a permasmile.

SO delicious. my husband and i stopped by last night for dinner (after months of talking about coming down). first of all, the place is adorable. it was not insanely hot last night (finally!), so we were excited to sit outside and enjoy some awesome food. i ordered the pulled jackfruit po'boy, my husband ordered the chicken parm special, and we shared a side of fries.  wow. just... awesome. as a vegetarian, it's sometimes a bummer to eat a veggie burger or vegetable sandwich over and over again. nothing makes me happier than to find a menu that has something really cool (and vegan) that i can eat. the po'boy was not easy to eat (my only gripe!), but i definitely did my best and ended up using a fork to scoop up the jackfruit that didn't make it in the sandwich. the bbq sauce is awesome, just the right amount of salty, sweet, spicy, and tangy. the coleslaw was fantastic as well, and the baguette it came on was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. so yummy.  my husband really liked the chicken parm, but can't wait to come back to try the bumblebee biscuit. the fries were also awesome, nice and crispy with a really yummy herbed aioli.  service was great. beer was local and delicious. food was wonderful. music was fun and super loud. all in all, definitely worth five stars.

What a positive experience, two for two. Ask for the Jack Fruit po-boy, you won't believe it. No it's not pulled pork it's pure veggie. The drinks are marvelous, they make their own ginger beer, it's not on the menu but ask for a dark and stormy.

Whhhhaaaat?! I have not reviewed these guys?! It's possibly because I was hoping to keep them my little secret. These guys took their Old Dixie food truck and took over this unique and eclectic location that has been home to other popups over the last couple of years. Inside seating is VERY limited 8 built in stools against a small counter. I love sitting inside but I often enjoy their out door seating during the summer and especially on these beautiful Phx winter nights. [They do lunch and brunch as well.]   The Food: I have enjoyed everything I have tried here. They are known  for their biscuits, which are fairly large, sturdy enough to be used in their biscuit sandwiches but tender enough to enjoy with their homemade honey butter (the honey sourced from a small apiary in the neighborhood) or house made jelly/preserves or apple butter. Many of their veggies are often sourced out of the community garden when possible. They source locally as much as possible, and their menu adjusts seasonally, while keeping some of their popular favorites. They always offer vegetarian options and occasionally even vegan. [Skip the goat cheese on the beet tureen salad and that is a yummy vegan option]   They make all food to order and honor substitutions or additions within reason.  Heck, for dinner one night I ordered their biscuit with goat cheese and smoked apple butter (found on the dessert menu) and asked if they could add bacon.  They gave me a bit of a raised eyebrow as they found the request unique and gladly served it up (and it was SOOO good)   My favorites: Anything with their fried chicken.  Anything with their biscuits.  Their french fries are  hand cut and fabulous.  They smoke their own meats  (and sometimes apples for their smoked Apple butter) so try the Carolina or any smoked  sausage, pork chop, etc. that shows up on the specials board.  Their burgers rock! (YOU HAVE to try the PB&B, well unless you have a peanut allergy).  Their salads are lovely and tasty.   They offer some select cocktails and a limited choice of liquor. But this doesn't matter because all you need to know is get a HURRICANE (or 3). You'll thank me later.

This place is SO rad. My crew and I were in town working an event and couldn't find anything open for dinner and drinks after 10pm. Found this place on yelp and was so so so happy about it. Looks like something you would find in Austin, TX. The no way jose was insane. The big Jim was heaven. Staff was awesome. American hipster vibe. Great music. I wish i could eat here everyday!!
